Upon completing enchantment to +3, it automatically becomes Runesmithed, and cannot be Runesmithed other ways.
Additional Effects:
Runesmithing: {@item Crimson Crystal|TftJC}
Druid Useable: Yes

item.name: Bolas
entries: Special. A Large or smaller creature hit by a bola must make a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check verse the attack roll. If they failed, they are knocked prone. A bola has no effect on creatures that are form lessor that don't have legs. Creatures with more than four legs have advantage on the check.

item.name: Bonetooth Necklace
entries: This Necklace magically collects trophies from your hunts. You can spend an hour performing a Ritual to prepare a Hunt. A creature can only be hunted if;

items: You know their name, you have seen them in person and have spoken with them
They are a level or CR higher than your level
Wish you dead

entries: If a creature meets these conditions, you can Hunt them. Upon killing the target of your Hunt, a piece of them is magically added to the necklace.
You gain a +1 to attack rolls per trophy collected. At 5 Trophies, the item changes.

item.name: Boomerang
entries: Simple Invention.
If the Boomerang Misses, make a DC 15 Sleight of Hand Check, and on a success, it returns back to your hand successfully. Otherwise it lands in a random area within 15ft of the original target.

item.name: Brace of the Ouroboros
item.reqAttune: by a creature with Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma greater than or equal to 15
entries: This combination Armbrace and belt depicts the visage of a grand serpentine Time Dragon biting its own tail with crystal inlays. A brace like this has never been forged before.
The essence of a time dragon would not want its power diluted. You cannot combine this item.
As an action, you can activate this brace and gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a bonus to your Intelligence checks and saving throws equal to your proficiency bonus (even if you are already proficient in either)
Your walking speed increases by 10 feet
You gain advantage on saving throws made against any spell or magical effect that would modify time around you (Chronurgy spells or similar effects to Slow)

Temporal Strike (Recharge 6): Once per turn when you make a Melee Weapon Attack against a target, they must make a DC 17 Wisdom Saving throw or be thrown through time. The target is moved 1 round forward in time, a target moved forward in time vanishes for the duration. When the effect ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in an unoccupied space nearest to the space if it is occupied. Once this ability is used, roll a d6 at the start of each of your turns. If you roll a 6, you may use this ability again.

entries: This effect lasts for 1 minute. At the end of its activation, you gain 1 level of exhaustion and are stunned for a 1 turn.
The brace can be activated in this way 3 times and you regain 1 use per long rest. You cannot end this effect early.
If the attuning creature has access to Psionic Energy Dice, the Telekinetic Feat, or the Telepathic Feat, they gain access to the following ability:
Astral Blade: When you attack with a weapon while the Warbrace is active, your attacks are considered magical and can add 1d8 Force damage once per turn.

item.name: Breath Stone
entries: As an action, you can pop the stone into your mouth consuming it, unleashing a breath weapon effect. The breath weapon takes the form of a 15-foot cone of elemental damage. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking elemental damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once consumed the breath stone is used.
Based on the color of the stone it determines the elemental damage type
The following breath stones exist:

items: {@item Breath Stone (uncommon)|TftJC}
{@item Breath Stone (rare)|TftJC}
{@item Breath Stone (very rare)|TftJC}
{@item Breath Stone (legendary)|TftJC}

item.name: Breath Stone (legendary)
entries: As an action, you can pop the stone into your mouth consuming it, unleashing a breath weapon effect. The breath weapon takes the form of a 15-foot cone of elemental damage. Each creature in the area must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 6d12} elemental damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once consumed the breath stone is used.
Based on the color of the stone it determines the elemental damage type

description.chatFlavor: Unleash a 15-foot cone breath weapon. DC 20 Dex save, 6d12 elemental damage. See item for damage type.

item.name: Breath Stone (rare)
entries: As an action, you can pop the stone into your mouth consuming it, unleashing a breath weapon effect. The breath weapon takes the form of a 15-foot cone of elemental damage. Each creature in the area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 4d8} elemental damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once consumed the breath stone is used.
Based on the color of the stone it determines the elemental damage type

description.chatFlavor: Unleash a 15-foot cone breath weapon. DC 15 Dex save, 4d8 elemental damage. See item for damage type.

item.name: Breath Stone (uncommon)
entries: As an action, you can pop the stone into your mouth consuming it, unleashing a breath weapon effect. The breath weapon takes the form of a 15-foot cone of elemental damage. Each creature in the area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d6} elemental damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once consumed the breath stone is used.
Based on the color of the stone it determines the elemental damage type

description.chatFlavor: Unleash a 15-foot cone breath weapon. DC 13 Dex save, 3d6 elemental damage. See item for damage type.

item.name: Breath Stone (very rare)
entries: As an action, you can pop the stone into your mouth consuming it, unleashing a breath weapon effect. The breath weapon takes the form of a 15-foot cone of elemental damage. Each creature in the area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 5d10} elemental damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once consumed the breath stone is used.
Based on the color of the stone it determines the elemental damage type

description.chatFlavor: Unleash a 15-foot cone breath weapon. DC 17 Dex save, 5d10 elemental damage. See item for damage type.

item.name: Bright Orb
entries: Orbs are magic items found within Kima-at that can be applied to weapons, foci and armor, each granting unique effects. Orbs have 10 charges, which return at dawn.
You can only use one charge per orb, per turn. Up to 2 Orbs can be placed on a single item, which combines them and grants new effects.
Having 2 orbs on one weapon/armor/foci combines their charges, and allows you to use their abilities interchangeably. Using a Combo effect requires 2 charges spent
Weapon Effect: Hit creatures gain 1 {@condition Radiance|TftJC}.
Armor Effect: -2 Radiant Damage, you can spend a charge when you gain a stack of Radiance to not gain it.
Focus Effect: Creatures hit by or who fail a saving throw gain 1 Radiance, or 2 if the spell cast matches the Orb's element.

item.name: Brightwarden
entries: This magical shield grants +1 to AC.
This shield is Sentient, and has an Alignment of Lawful Good (Int 10, Wis 12, Cha 18) and will always urge the user to protect others.

entries.name: Guardian's Reaction
entries: As a reaction to an ally taking damage from an enemy, you may move your movement speed towards them. If you end your movement within 5 feet of the ally who took damage in that instance, they instead take half damage and you take the other amount. You can only use this ability an amount of times equal to your proficiency bonus until the next day at high noon under the sun.

item.name: Bulwark
entries: This magical shield projects an additional shield of force around itself when activated. As a bonus action, you can activate the shield to increase its AC value by +3. While in this state you also have resistance to force damage and immunity to the magic missile spell.

While the shield is activated and you succeed on a Dexterity saving throw that effects more than one creature you can choose to extend its protection to all allies within 30 feet. Each creature within 30 feet automatically succeeds on the Dexterity saving throw and suffers no damage or negative effects. You suffer the full effect of the saving throw as if you had failed the save. Once you use this ability the shield becomes inactive, and cannot be activated again until you finish a short or long rest.

item.name: Butterflyfish Scale
entries: This scale shimmers with a myriad of colors, interwoven with the membranous pattern of a butterfly's wing.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can crush the scale in your hand. For the next minute, you reduce all damage you take from Transmutation spells by 5, and you are immune to any spell or magical effect that would alter your shape against your will.

customProperties.armorEffects: Armor made of Calcified Sludge grants resistance to Acid damage.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Weapons deal an additional 1 acid damage on hit.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Material
Required Tool: Alchemist's Tools
Forging Conditions: 13 INT, 3rd level Transmutation Spell
Armor Effects: Armor made of Calcified Sludge grants resistance to Acid damage.
Weapon Effects: Weapons deal an additional 1 acid damage on hit.
Additional Effects: -
Runesmithing: ???
Druid Useable: ???

item.name: Candle of Brilliant Arcana
entries: These candles hold a powerful magical charge. When a magic item within 30ft of a candle uses a charge, you can have the candles restore its power. It regains an expended charge or use. After it has done so, the candle loses its magical ability.

item.name: Cape of Monologuing
entries: “And now, I shall reveal my master pla–”
“–CUT HER FACE OFF! AAAAAA!”

Time out! How often has this happened to you? A party of vagabonds arrives and just before you reveal the intricacies of your master plan, they start attacking. So uncultured! Thanks to the Cape of Monologuing, you’ll never have to worry about this again.

Yes, this is a very real item, and not something I just created out of thin air! As a...reaction...yeah a reaction, you conjure this cape out of thin air and time stops all around you for what seems like a minute. During this time, you cannot take actions, bonus actions, other reactions, or any movement...however you can monologue about your master plans. Also you can pace or whatever for dramatic effect, but you need to end up in the same spot, m’kay? After this, the cape explodes and is gone forever.
This is a real item. Obviously not something I made up on the spot because I’ve built this moment up in my head for two damn years, Todd.

item.name: Captain's Scimitarrrrrr
entries: This scimitar is forged from {@item Posidinium|TftJC}.

Once per dawn, you can use the weapon to summon a Water Elemental, which is friendly to you, follows your commands and lasts for 1 hour or until reduced to 0 hp. While the elemental is summoned, you gain a swim speed of 60ft, or add 30ft to your current swim speed (whichever would be higher).

item.name: Captain's Vestments
entries: This studded leather armor is crafted from {@item Posidinium|TftJC}.
Any creature you summon or otherwise under your control within 30ft of you gains a bonus to attack rolls and saving throws equal to half of your Persuasion bonus.

item.name: Carnivore's Delight
entries: Preparation: Requires Cook's Tools to prepare.
Ingredients: x1 Rare Beast Meat, x1 Rare Monstrosity Meat, x1 Humanoid Meat
Effect: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points you regain 1d8 hit points.

description.chatFlavor: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points you regain 1d8 hit points.

item.name: Ceatus
entries: Unarmed. Unarmed weapons replace your unarmed damage with the weapon damage listed. If you have other options for unarmed damage, such as a Fighting Style or Martial Arts monk feature you can choose which damage die applies. A value written as +X as opposed to X adds to unarmed damage rather than replacing it.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

customProperties.forgingConditions: Must have 11+ levels in Paladin/Cleric, or a subclass that gains power from Celestials (Celestial Warlock/ Angelic Armsmaster Fighter.)
customProperties.armorEffects: You gain resistance to Radiant and Necrotic Damage.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Weapons deal an additional 1d10 radiant damage on a hit, 2d10 against fiends and undead. Paladins wielding this weapon have their damage from their Divine Smite and Smite Spells increased by 1 step.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Material for Horn of Valhalla (Iron)

Required Tool: Smith's Tools

Armor Effects: You gain resistance to Radiant and Necrotic Damage.

Additional Effects: Material for Horn of Valhalla (Iron)

You can only use one charge per orb, per turn. Up to 2 Orbs can be placed on a single item, which combines them and grants new effects.
Having 2 orbs on one weapon/armor/foci combines their charges, and allows you to use their abilities interchangeably. Using a Combo effect requires 2 charges spent
Weapon Effect: Hitting a creature successfully with a weapon grants 1 {@condition Arcanergy|TftJC}.
Armor Effect: -2 Force Damage, when you take force damage you can spend a charge to gain a stack of Arcanergy.
Focus Effect: Creatures hit by or who fail a saving throw grant you 1 Arcanergy, or 2 if the spell cast matches the Orb's element.

item.name: Chilling Orb

You can only use one charge per orb, per turn. Up to 2 Orbs can be placed on a single item, which combines them and grants new effects.
Having 2 orbs on one weapon/armor/foci combines their charges, and allows you to use their abilities interchangeably. Using a Combo effect requires 2 charges spent
Weapon Effect: Hit creatures gain 1 {@condition Frosted|TftJC}.
Armor Effect: -2 Cold Damage, you can spend a charge when you gain a stack of Frosted to not gain it.
Focus Effect: Creatures hit by or who fail a saving throw gain 1 Frosted, or 2 if the spell cast matches the Orb's element.

customProperties.armorEffects: Chromed Silk requires half of the gold cost to Enchant it. Can only be used for Light Armor.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Chromed Silk requires half of the gold cost to Enchant it. Chromed Silk weapons always deal Slashing damage.

Additional Effects: Material for +1 Cobbler's, Leatherworker's, or Weaver's Tools (2 Plates).
Runesmithing: {@item Lolth Cashmere|TftJC}
Druid Useable: Yes

entries.name: Decree Thrall
entries: This ornate circlet is adorned with 10 glimmering emeralds scavenged from the sea floor. While wearing the circlet, you can use an action to place a magical command on a creature you can see within 60 feet and decree them as your Thrall. An unwilling creature must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you (a willing creature can choose to fail this saving throw). If you or creatures friendly to you are fighting it, it has advantage on the saving throw. While within 60 feet of you, your Thrall is forced to obey your orders to the best of its ability, but won’t follow any commands that are directly harmful to it. If you are farther than 60 feet, the creature defends itself to the best of its ability. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to this item’s effects for the next 24 hours. While you have a Thrall under your control and are within range, you can use the following abilities:

entries.name: Tyrant’s Command
entries: You can use a bonus action to exert your dominion. Your Thrall takes {@dice 1d10} psychic damage and its maximum hit points are reduced by the same amount. You then grant your Thrall advantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw it makes before the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Tyrant’s Edict
entries: You can empower the effect of Tyrant’s Command. Your Thrall instead takes {@dice 5d10} psychic damage and their maximum hit points are reduced by the same amount. Upon taking this damage, the Thrall can immediately attempt to remake the saving throw to end the {@condition charmed} effect. You then grant the Thrall advantage on all rolls until the start of your next turn.

The damage dealt by these actions cannot be reduced or resisted in any way unless it would bring the Thrall to 0 hit points, in which case they do not take the damage and the {@condition charmed} effect ends. If this damage puts the Thrall below half of its normal maximum health, it can immediately attempt to remake the Wisdom saving throw against the {@condition charmed} condition, ending the effect on a success; if it was caused by Tyrant’s Edict, they make the saving throw with advantage.

entries.name: Emerald Expenditure & Release
entries: If you have a Thrall under your control and you do not perform either Tyrant’s Command or Tyrant’s Edict on your turn, 1 of the emeralds on the circlet is expended. If all 10 gems are expended, the charmed condition ends and the Thrall is released from your control. You may also end the charmed condition as a bonus action.

Whenever the {@condition charmed} condition ends, the creature’s maximum hit points are restored and the affected creature knows it was charmed by you. The {@condition charmed} condition also ends when the bearer of the Circlet attempts to charm another creature, if their attunement to the Circlet ends, or through the use of {@spell remove curse} or a similar spell. After successfully charming a creature with this circlet's ability, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest unless you expend 5 gems. This circlet regains {@dice 1d3} expended gems daily at dawn. If you expend the last gem, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, all the gems shatter and this item loses its magic.

customProperties.shatterChance: d20, on 1 all gems shatter and item loses magic

item.name: Claws of the Blue Dragon
entries: This magic claw can be attached to a melee weapon you are proficient in.
Once attached, it cannot be removed without the use of a {@spell Remove Curse|PHB} spell or similar magic.
If you unattune to it, the attachment remains however you no longer gain the benefits of this magic item.
While attached to a weapon, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier instead of Strength or Dexterity for attack and damage rolls made with that weapon.
Draconic Fury. When you hit with a melee weapon attack using the weapon with the attachment, you can add an additional {@dice 1d8} lightning damage to the attack.

Draconic Venom. On a successful hit with a melee weapon attack using the weapon with the attachment, the target must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or become vulnerable to a lightning damage until the start of their next turn. If a creature is immune to lightning damage they become resistant instead.

item.name: Claws of the Green Wyrmling
entries: This magic claw can be attached to a melee weapon you are proficient in.
Once attached, it cannot be removed without the use of a {@spell Remove Curse|PHB} spell or similar magic.
If you unattune to it, the attachment remains however you no longer gain the benefits of this magic item.
While attached to a weapon, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier instead of Strength or Dexterity for attack and damage rolls made with that weapon.
Draconic Fury. When you hit with a melee weapon attack using the weapon with the attachment, you can add an additional {@dice 1d4} poison damage to the attack.

Draconic Venom. On a successful hit with a melee weapon attack using the weapon with the attachment, the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Clip
entries: Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of bullets detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

customProperties.armorEffects: You have advantage on saving throws that would magically move you against your will, including teleportation and planar warping spells. You are considered a Construct while wearing this armor.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Weapons cannot roll with disadvantage or advantage.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Clockwork Bronze Tinkerer's Tool can be used to mend Constructs. As an action you can restore a number of hit points to a construct equal to the Construct's number of hit dice + your proficiency bonus. This consumes one hit die from the construct.

Required Tool: Tinker's Tools

Weapon Effects: Weapons cannot roll with disadvantage or advantage.

entries: Preparation: Requires Cook's Tools or Brewer's Tools to prepare.
Ingredients: x1 Remedial herb, x1 Trailvine.
Effect: You ignore one level of exhaustion but cannot benefit from a short or long rest for the next 8 hours.

customProperties.forgingConditions: Divine Strike or Divine Smite Feature
customProperties.armorEffects: Critical Hits against you become normal hits. Armor does not pose disadvantage on stealth checks.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Weapons have the Siege Property. Fiends are considered Vulnerable to this weapon base damage.

entries: Plane of Origin: Arcadia
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: Divine Strike or Divine Smite Feature
Armor Effects: Critical Hits against you become normal hits. Armor does not pose disadvantage on {@skill stealth} checks.
Weapon Effects: Weapons have the Siege Property. Fiends are considered Vulnerable to this weapon base damage.
Additional Effects: Material for Horn of Valhalla (Bronze)
Runesmithing: {@item Leviathan|TftJC}
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Compass of Seeking
entries: While holding this golden compass, you can speak the name of any location of which you have been before, and the compass will point to the location. If the location is not on the plane you are on, it will point to the nearest portal to that plane, including possibly leading through multiple unrelated planes to get to your target if no immediate portal exists.

The compass always points to the most efficient route, ignoring things such as human limitations, bodies of water, or gravity. If the compass can’t find a proper route, its needle will spin until a new name is spoken or a pathway opens.

item.name: Compass of the Guiding Arrow
entries: The Compass of the Guiding Arrow is a finely crafted magical compass that aids adventurers in locating specific items of significance. This compass is currently linked. This compass is treated as +1 {@item navigator's tools|PHB}.

Linking. To link or unlink to a specific item, the attuned user must be within 5 ft of the item and spend 1 minute concentrating on severing/connecting the connection. As if they were concentrating on a spell. You cannot link a new item if it is already linked.

Guiding Arrow. the compass's arrow constantly points in the direction of the chosen item. It provides a reliable guide, even if the item is hidden, obscured, but must be on the same plane of existence. The arrow adjusts its direction as the user moves, always pointing towards the desired object.

Protection from Interference. The Compass of the Guiding Arrow possesses a magical shielding that prevents external forces from manipulating or disrupting its guidance. It cannot be affected by spells or abilities that alter the accuracy of directional devices.

item.name: Conflux of The Dead Star
entries: This dodecahedron is structured with a metal frame that houses a fragment of The Hungry Star.
While little is known of the entity, it is said that The Hungry Star is merely a fragment of an ancient being that resides in the Far Realms that seeks to consume all of reality.

Those that praise this being are creatures of hunger, death, undeath, desperation, and blood - for consuming life is best to satiate hunger. Often these creatures are twisted into a dark form of themselves to serve their master.

This conflux was created by the Archmage Galtorious Ives to contain and harness his Master’s power for his own use and those loyal to him. Every ritual, every binding, every aspect of knowledge he had was fed into this power. While he was the one who housed this fragment, this power had always existed. Master Ives bound this in his own follower’s souls, for they had already been eaten and renewed by The Star. However over the centuries the conflux has changed hands over and over, often leading to calamity.

No mortal can possess this conflux and ever be the same. The whispers that haunt those who use this vile artifact drive them to madness, a want to devour all life, and to bring forth their enlightenment to all planes.

entries.name: Attunement
entries: A creature attuned to the artifact must spend 80 hours comprehending how the Conflux sets and resets itself to understand its pattern. The creature must be able to speak and write the Deep Speech language to understand the binding enchantments and the power that the being within offers. Once they have completed these 80 hours they may use the features of this item.

Whenever a creature attunes to the Conflux of The Dead Star, that creature must make a DC 19 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, that creature’s alignment changes to an Evil (keeping their Lawful, Neutral, or Chaotic) alignment, and is {@condition charmed} by the Conflux.
While charmed in this way, the creature is loyal to Hadar, The Dark Hunger. They will follow its morality and its beliefs for consuming all of reality.

entries.name: Soul Consumption
entries: Should a creature die within the influence of the Conflux (10 feet), it consumes their soul. They cannot be restored to life by any means short of a {@spell wish}. The dead creature will then rise as a Death Knight after 10 days, using all the abilities, knowledge, and spellcasting it had in life as though it were the person who had died, and under control of The Hungry Star. The Death Knight rises where the creature fell.

entries.name: Awoken
entries: While attuned to the artifact, you have resistance against {@damage psychic} damage and creatures can no longer read your thoughts unless you allow them to.

entries.name: Herald of the Void
entries: While attuned to the artifact, you can use an action to cast one of the following spells: {@spell hunger of hadar}, {@spell arms of hadar}, {@spell animate dead}, or {@spell create undead}. Once you use one of these spells you cannot cast a spell in this way until you satisfy your Ravenous condition.

entries.name: Ravenous
entries: While attuned to this artifact, you contract the Blood Ravenousness. While under the effect in this way, you must consume 1 gallon of blood from a humanoid creature within a week. If you do not satisfy this condition, your Wisdom Score is reduced by 1 per week not consumed. When your Wisdom becomes 5, you are consumed by the artifact.

entries.name: Whispers
entries: While you are attuned to this artifact, other creatures cannot take short or long rests within 300 feet of you as they are plagued with nightmares.

entries.name: All-Consuming
entries: As an action, you may consume any number of Hit Dice available to you or any number of willing creatures within 10 feet of you. You then roll these Hit Dice and take {@damage necrotic} damage equal to the number rolled. If you use other creatures’ Hit Dice, then they take this damage as well. You may choose to empower your next melee weapon attack with damage equal to what you rolled or regain a number of spell slots equal to the number of Hit Dice consumed in this way. Should you or any other creature that had their Hit Dice consumed drop to 0 hit points, they are considered dead, and follow the rules for when a creature dies within the influence of the Conflux.

entries.name: Command Oblivion
entries: While you are attuned to the Conflux, you can use an action to cast {@spell dominate monster} on an Undead or Aberration (DC 18). You cannot use this property again until you satisfy your Ravenous condition.
The effects of the Conflux can be suppressed by being placed within an {@spell antimagic field} or the casting of a {@spell wish} spell.
For a creature to unattune to the Conflux, they must have a 9th level {@spell remove curse} spell cast on them and then a 9th level Atonement condition as per the {@spell ceremony} spell be cast.

Armor Effects: -

customProperties.weaponEffects: Weapons ignore AC granted through Armor or Shields.

customProperties.weaponEffects: Cosmium weapons roll double the damage die, and take the highest result.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Cosmium Painters tools can create real life objects by painting them. Objects last for 1 minute and cannot have a value greater than 10gp.

item.name: Creed
entries: You gain a bonus +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magical firearm.
On hit, the weapon deals {@dice 1d4} extra necrotic.
If this weapon kills a target, that target returns as a {@creature zombie|MM} under your control. You can only have one zombie under your control from this weapon at a time.

Clip 6. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

customProperties.forgingConditions: Enchanted Primary Tools + Boon of Focus
customProperties.armorEffects: You incur no penalties from moving on frozen terrains, slipping on ice or any negative effect on your movement on ice. You gain Resistance to Piercing Damage. As a Free Action, you can sacrifice a Hit die to the Armor to empower it. It instead grants immunity to Piercing Damage, and +10 walking speed on Snow/Ice for a number of rounds equal to half the rolled value of the Hit die (Min 1).
customProperties.weaponEffects: Weapons made from Crimson Canium have their damage die size increased by 1 tier (d4s -> d6s. If the damage die is either 1d12 or 2d6, it becomes 2d8). You can sacrifice a Hit Die to the weapon to increase this amount by another step. This lasts a number of turns equal to half the rolled value on the Hit Die (min 1).
customProperties.additionalEffects: Hit Die return upon completing the condition for your Boon of Focus.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Material
Required Tool: Jeweler's Tools
Secondary Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: Enchanted Primary Tools + Boon of Focus
Base Metals: {@item Bloodstone|TftJC} + {@item Tytantium|TftJC}

Armor Effects: You incur no penalties from moving on frozen terrains, slipping on ice or any negative effect on your movement on ice. You gain Resistance to Piercing Damage. As a Free Action, you can sacrifice a Hit die to the Armor to empower it. It instead grants immunity to Piercing Damage, and +10 walking speed on Snow/Ice for a number of rounds equal to half the rolled value of the Hit die (Min 1).

Weapon Effects: Weapons made from Crimson Canium have their damage die size increased by 1 tier (d4s -> d6s. If the damage die is either {@dice 1d12} or {@dice 2d6}, it becomes {@dice 2d8}). You can sacrifice a Hit Die to the weapon to increase this amount by another step. This lasts a number of turns equal to half the rolled value on the Hit Die (min 1).
Additional Effects: Hit Die return upon completing the condition for your Boon of Focus.
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Crimson Crystal

customProperties.armorEffects: If left touching another plate of metal for 1 hour, it copies its properties. It can only copy the properties of rare or lower metals, and only one at a time. Can now be combined with other magic items to combine its effects, but Crimson Crystal must remain as the base material.
customProperties.weaponEffects: If left touching another plate of metal for 1 hour, it copies its properties. It can only copy the properties of rare or lower metals, and only one at a time.  Can now be combined with other magic items to combine its effects, but Crimson Crystal must remain as the base material.
customProperties.additionalEffects: If left for a week touching a plate of a different metal that requires Jewelers tools, that plate becomes a plate of Bloodstone.

entries: Runesmithed

entries.name: Properties
entries: Base Metal: {@item Bloodstone|TftJC}
Required Tool: Jeweler's Tools
Forging Conditions: -

Weapon Effects: If left touching another plate of metal for 1 hour, it copies its properties. It can only copy the properties of rare or lower metals, and only one at a time. Can now be combined with other magic items to combine its effects, but Crimson Crystal must remain as the base material.
Additional Effects: If left for a week touching a plate of a different metal that requires Jewelers tools, that plate becomes a plate of {@item Bloodstone|TftJC}.
Druid Useable: Yes

item.name: Cross-Shield
entries: Simple Invention.
If you do not move on your turn you benefit from the AC of the shield until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Crown of Crimson
item.reqAttune: by a creature with spellcasting that uses their Charisma
entries: You gain a +2 to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC. When you would cast a spell that requires Gemstones as an expended material component, the cost of the gemstones is lowered by 100 for you.

item.name: Crown of Sun Peak
entries: This golden amulet bears an ancient Mere’su’ra symbol of the sun and is inlaid with precious stones. While you wear this amulet, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.

While you wear this amulet, your spells that create light have their radius or range increased by 10ft. In addition, any spell you cast that creates light is treated as being two levels higher when they are contested by a spell or effect that would try and extinguish it.

Effected Spells: control flame, dancing lights, light, produce flame, faerie fire, branding smite, continual flame, flame blade, flaming sphere, moonbeam, daylight, fire shield, dawn, hallow, holy weapon, immolation, wall of light, sickening radiance, investiture of flame, sunbeam, crown of stars, symbol, temple of the gods, holy aura, sunburst, prismatic wall.

item.name: Crown of the Everknowing
entries: This crown once belonged to the Golden Empress of Mere’su’ra who hungered to know everything in the world. This crown is inset with nine sapphires that glow with a soft blue light. A creature wearing this crown gains +2 to their Intelligence and increases their maximum Intelligence to 22.
While wearing this crown, you gain +1 max Hit Points for each tool or language proficiency you have.

Cursed. This crown is imbued with the Thilask’s lust for knowledge, which infects the wearer. You will go to great lengths to learn and hoard secrets. Gaps in your knowledge irritate you and you will try to fill them whenever possible.

Whenever you fail a History, Nature, Arcana, or Religion check, one of the seven sapphires on the crown will light up. When all seven gems light up, you suffer 20d10 psychic damage and have disadvantage on any Intelligence saving throws, attack rolls, and ability checks for one week. If this damage reduces a creature to zero hit points they turn into a Nothic. If the crown ever leaves your person, your Intelligence becomes 1, this lasts until you have the Crown again or a 9th level Remove Curse removes the curse.

customProperties.armorEffects: Cubic Granite can only be made into shields. Cubic Granite shields grant half cover against ranged weapon attacks.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Cubic Granite can only be made into ammunition. Cubic Granite ammunition ignores half cover and deals bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Acheron
Required Tool: Mason's Tools
Forging Conditions: ???
Armor Effects: Cubic Granite can only be made into shields. Cubic Granite shields grant half cover against ranged weapon attacks.
Weapon Effects: Cubic Granite can only be made into ammunition. Cubic Granite ammunition ignores half cover and deals bludgeoning damage.
Additional Effects:
Runesmithing: ???
Druid Useable: Yes

item.name: Cursed Catalyst
entries: Once per week, you can invoke the Catalyst's power to attempt to alter a Cursed object, and can perform one of the two effects. Both effects take an hour to complete the ritual.

Extraction - Touch a Cursed Object, and based on its rarity, make an Arcana Check (DC 11 for Common, DC 13 for Uncommon, DC 15 for Rare, DC 17 for Very Rare, DC 19 for Legendary, DC 30 for Artifact). On a success, you can remove a Curse from that object. The Curse is then placed into the Catalyst, and now affects the Catalyst.

Malediction - You can place Curses on Magic Items. Make an Arcana check based on the items rarity (Same scaling as before, must be done on an already magical item), and on a success, you may either place a Curse you have absorbed into the Catalyst onto that object, or place a Curse from this list onto the object. If you remove a Curse from a Magic Item that was created by the Catalyst, it is destroyed.
Curse of Loyalty - You are unwilling to part with this item, and grow hostile to anyone that would try to take it from you.
Curse of Withering - Each time you finish a Long Rest attuned to this item, your Maximum HP is reduced by 3.
Curse of Burning Soul - If you were to die, your soul is sent to the Nine Hells.
Curse of Ill-Luck - You gain a -1 to all ability checks.
Curse of Vulnerability - You are Vulnerable to either Fire, Cold, Lightning, Acid or Poison damage (you decide what type when applying this curse).
Curse of Undead Attraction - Undead Creatures with an intelligence of 8 or lower will instinctively attack you if they are within 60ft of you.

customProperties.armorEffects: If you don't have resistance/immunity to poison damage while wearing this armor, you take 5 Necrotic Damage at the start of each of your turns. Any creature that makes contact with you by hitting you with a melee weapon/attack/melees spell attack, by grappling or by being grappled by you takes 5 Necrotic Damage, and an additional +2 Necrotic for every +1 Enchantment value this armor has (up to 11 Necrotic Damage).
customProperties.weaponEffects: If you don't have resistance/immunity to poison damage while wielding this weapon, you take 5 Necrotic Damage at the start of each of your turns. Cyanidium Weapons deal an additional 1d10 Poison Damage on a hit, and any poison that coats this weapon becomes an Injury Poison. If this weapon is Enchanted with a +X effect, any poison's DC applied to it is increased by that value.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Cyanidium Poisoner's Tools have a 1/4 chance to make an additional dose upon crafting a Poison.

entries: Plane of Origin: Material

Secondary Tool: Alchemist's Supplies

Base Metals: {@item Putrid Lead|TftJC} + {@item Devil's Mercury|TftJC}

Any creature that makes contact with you by hitting you with a melee weapon/attack/melees spell attack, by grappling or by being grappled by you takes 5 Necrotic Damage, and an additional +2 Necrotic for every +1 Enchantment value this armor has (up to 11 Necrotic Damage).

Weapon Effects: If you don't have resistance/immunity to poison damage while wielding this weapon, you take 5 Necrotic Damage at the start of each of your turns. Cyanidium Weapons deal an additional {@dice 1d10} Poison Damage on a hit, and any poison that coats this weapon becomes an Injury Poison. If this weapon is Enchanted with a +X effect, any poison's DC applied to it is increased by that value.
Additional Effects: Cyanidium Poisoner's Tools have a 1/4 chance to make an additional dose upon crafting a Poison.
Druid Useable: Yes

customProperties.forgingConditions: Can only be forged by a creature of a Lawful Alignment.
customProperties.armorEffects: The Gold cost for casting spells that expend the material is lowered by 25% while wearing this armor (you must be proficient in this armor for this benefit to be used).
customProperties.weaponEffects: This weapon has advantage attacking creatures of a Chaotic Alignment (or unaligned), and disadvantage attacking creatures of a Lawful Alignment.

item.name: Dark Storm's Voice
entries: This magical hammer grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls.
The hammer constantly hums with the power of the storm and is cloaked in a dark shadow and when called upon can unleash the fury of the storm.
As an action, you can make one melee weapon attack which increases your reach by 30 feet and deals thunder damage instead of bludgeoning damage.
While in darkness or dim light, the maul becomes shrouded in shadow becoming nearly unperceivable. While shrouded in shadow this maul's bludgeoning damage ignores damage resistances.
Additionally, you can use the hammer to cast {@spell thunderwave|PHB} with a DC of 14.

customProperties.armorEffects: Advantage on saving throws against effects from Fiends.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Reroll radiant damage dealt by this weapon and take the higher result.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Material for Horn of Valhalla (Silver)

item.name: Deneith Cave Gemstone Fragment
entries: To use the fragment you must have it on your person. Once per dawn the fragment can be used to do one of the following things.

entries.name: As a bonus action
items: expend one hit die and regain that much hp.
Use a maneuver. The maneuver stored in the fragment is listed below based on the color of the shard. The DC is 13 and your superior die is 1d6 for the maneuvers.

item.name: Deneith Oasis Gemstone Fragment
entries: To use the fragment you must have it on your person. Once per dawn the fragment can be used to do one of the following things.

entries.name: As a bonus action
items: regain a first level spell slot.
Cast a first level spell. The spell stored in the fragment is listed below based on the color of the shard. The DC is 13 for the spell casted through the fragment.

customProperties.forgingConditions: 6th Lvl Cold Spell, Using DEX for check
customProperties.armorEffects: Heavy Armor is treated as Medium Armor, and Medium armor is treated as Light. Light Armor requires no proficiency to wear.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Weapon attacks that hit a creature force a DC17 Con save (poison effect), and on a fail the target suffers 1d6 Necrotic damage at the start of their turn. This lasts for 1 minute, and the target can repeat this saving throw to end the effect early.

Forging Conditions: 6th Lvl Cold Spell, Using DEX for check

Weapon Effects: Weapon attacks that hit a creature force a DC17 Con save (poison effect), and on a fail the target suffers {@dice 1d6} Necrotic damage at the start of their turn. This lasts for 1 minute, and the target can repeat this saving throw to end the effect early.
Additional Effects: -
Runesmithing: {@item Mercurial Sludge|TftJC}
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Dirythym

customProperties.forgingConditions: Must be forged in absolute darkness.
customProperties.armorEffects: Armor made from this metal reduces Thunder and Lightning damage by 2d6. Additionally, you are immune to Thunder and Lightning Damage from non-magical sources.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Dealing or taking Thunder/Lightning damage causes your weapons reach increases by 5 feet until the end of your next turn. Attacks that hit deal 1d8 extra Thunder or Lightning damage if you use the reach granted by this metal to hit the attack.
