entries.name: Properties
entries: Base Metal: {@item Malcanthym|TftJC}
Required Tool: Jeweler's Tools
Forging Conditions: Must be forged in absolute darkness.
Armor Effects: Armor made from this metal reduces Thunder and Lightning damage by {@dice 2d6}. Additionally, you are immune to Thunder and Lightning Damage from non-magical sources.

Weapon Effects: Dealing or taking Thunder/Lightning damage causes your weapons reach increases by 5 feet until the end of your next turn. Attacks that hit deal 1d8 extra Thunder or Lightning damage if you use the reach granted by this metal to hit the attack.
Additional Effects: -
Druid Useable: Yes

item.name: Dissolving Orb
entries: Orbs are magic items found within Kima-at that can be applied to weapons, foci and armor, each granting unique effects. Orbs have 10 charges, which return at dawn.
You can only use one charge per orb, per turn. Up to 2 Orbs can be placed on a single item, which combines them and grants new effects.
Having 2 orbs on one weapon/armor/foci combines their charges, and allows you to use their abilities interchangeably. Using a Combo effect requires 2 charges spent
Combined Orbs: {@item Toxic Orb|TftJC} + {@item Charging Orb|TftJC}
Weapon Effect: Hit creatures take an additional {@dice 1d8} Poison damage.
Armor Effect: You can end the {@condition Poisoned} condition on yourself, and have a +5 against the next saving throw against a Poison within the next minute.
Focus Effect: Creatures hit by or who fail a saving throw take an additional {@dice 1d8} Poison damage.

customProperties.armorEffects: You take 1 reduced damage equal to your level from Fiends and Undead, or 1.5x per every level in Cleric/Paladin/Other divinely powered subclasses (rounded down).
customProperties.weaponEffects: This weapon deals Radiant Damage instead of its normal damage type. It deals an additional 1d10 Radiant Damage on a hit, or 2d10 against Fiends and Undead. This weapon is imbued with the abilities of Destroy Undead, and instantly destroys both Undead and Fiends of the listed CR found in Cleric's Destroy Undead (using your Level to calculate CR, and your Spell Save DC. If you don't have a save DC, calculate with CHA).
customProperties.additionalEffects: A Holy Symbol made from Divinium grants Clerics the ability to roll 2d100 when using Divine Intervention and choose the result of the two values rolled.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Material
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Secondary Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: ?
Base Metals: {@item Dawn Steel|TftJC} + {@item Celestial Gold|TftJC}
Armor Effects: You take 1 reduced damage equal to your level from Fiends and Undead, or 1.5x per every level in Cleric/Paladin/Other divinely powered subclasses (rounded down).

Weapon Effects: This weapon deals Radiant Damage instead of its normal damage type. It deals an additional {@dice 1d10} Radiant Damage on a hit, or {@dice 2d10} against Fiends and Undead. This weapon is imbued with the abilities of Destroy Undead, and instantly destroys both Undead and Fiends of the listed CR found in Cleric's Destroy Undead (using your Level to calculate CR, and your Spell Save DC. If you don't have a save DC, calculate with CHA).
Additional Effects: A Holy Symbol made from Divinium grants Clerics the ability to roll {@dice 2d100} when using Divine Intervention and choose the result of the two values rolled.
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Docent (Combat Morph)
entries: To attune to a docent, you must embed the item somewhere on your body, such as your chest or your eye socket.
This docent can be merged onto a second docent, allowing the owner to switch between any possible morphs with an action.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: A docent is a sentient item of any alignment with an Intelligence of 16, a Wisdom of 14, and a Charisma of 14. It perceives the world through your senses. It communicates telepathically with you and can speak, read, and understand any language it knows (see "Random Properties" below).

entries.name: Combat Support
entries: Whenever you end your turn without making use of the docent’s abilities your AC is increased by 1 until the start of your next turn, in addition it has several random abilities.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: A docent has the following properties:

{@b Damage Types}. Damage Types. As a bonus action, the docent can fire a beam of energy of either fire or radiant, as well as {@dice 1d4} additional damage types: (1) cold, (2) acid, (3) thunder, (4) force. This beam uses your spell casting bonus (if you have one) or your Intelligence + proficiency. On hit it deals {@dice 1d10}+1 of your chosen damage type.

{@b Skills}. As a bonus action, the docent can Help you with one of the skills it knows. It knows up two skills (roll a {@dice d4}): (1) {@skill Athletics}, (2) {@skill Acrobatics}, (3) {@skill Stealth}, or (4) {@skill Perception}.

{@b Spells}. The docent knows up two of the following spells and can cast each once per long rest, requiring no components (roll a {@dice 2d6}): (1–2) {@spell hellish rebuke}, (3–4) {@spell shield} or (5–6) {@spell absorb elements}. The docent can cast the spell without requiring your reaction.

entries.name: Personality
entries: A docent is designed to advise and assist the warforged it's attached to. One of the simple functions of a docent is to serve as a translator. The docent's properties are under its control, and if you have a bad relationship with your docent, it might refuse to assist you.

item.name: Dragon Jelly

description.chatFlavor: Gain a random draconic boon. See item description for details.

entries: A powerful narcotic for dragons, it can imbue non-draconic creatures with temporary draconic boons, or permanent ones for dragons. Roll {@dice 1d5} (rerolling if you already have this effect), you gain one of these abilities. If you are not draconic, these abilities last for 1 hour.

items: {@bold 1 - {@reward Dragon's Breath|TftJC}}
{@bold 2 - {@reward Dragon's Claws|TftJC}}
{@bold 3 - {@reward Increased Eyesight|TftJC}}
{@bold 4 - {@reward Dragon's Heart|TftJC}}
{@bold 5 - {@reward Tough Scales|TftJC}}

entries: Draconic Creatures that intake 5 doses of Jelly gain a Boon of their choice from this list.

items: {@reward Draconic Elemental Affinity (Dragonborn)|TftJC} / {@reward Draconic Elemental Affinity (Kobold)|TftJC}
Draconic Regality
Draconic Ferocity

entries: This boon changes slightly based on your race, depending if you are a Kobold or Dragonborn.

customProperties.armorEffects: You have advantage on Charisma checks when bartering. Dragons will be innately more aggressive towards you.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Once per turn, when you hit with this weapon you can add your Proficiency Bonus to the Damage. Dragons will be innately more aggressive towards you.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Dragon's gold Cartographer's tool can be used to create spell scroll of Locate Object, or Locate Creature. When used in this way the gold cost to make such scroll is reduced by 75%. You can make and cast these scrolls even if they aren't on your spell list or you don't have the spell slot.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Material
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: 15 CHA, 20 if smith is Draconic.
Armor Effects: You have advantage on Charisma checks when bartering. Dragons will be innately more aggressive towards you.
Weapon Effects: Once per turn, when you hit with this weapon you can add your Proficiency Bonus to the Damage. Dragons will be innately more aggressive towards you.

Additional Effects: Dragon's gold Cartographer's tool can be used to create spell scroll of Locate Object, or Locate Creature. When used in this way the gold cost to make such scroll is reduced by 75%. You can make and cast these scrolls even if they aren't on your spell list or you don't have the spell slot.
Runesmithing: {@item Wyrm Platinum|TftJC}
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Drake Egg Nog
entries: Preparation: Requires Cook's Tools or Brewer's Tools to prepare.
Ingredients: x1 Uncommon Dragon Meat (Type determines resistance).
Effect: The first time you take the damage type of the meal reduce the damage by 2d8 to a minimum of 1. The effect then ends.

item.name: Driver Modification - Perfected Projection
entries: When a creature of a CR equal to or less than your Proficiency Bonus within 30ft of you dies, you can use a Reaction to present this Modification, and have the Modification scan them. A part of their essence is absorbed into the Driver Modification. This can only be done when the Modification is not inserted into an energy driver. You can have a number of Essences stored in the Modification at a time equal to your Proficiency Bonus, scanning more removes a previous scan from your Modifier. When you activate this Modification, it creates a spectral version of a creature of your choice scanned within the Modifier. The Scan is then deleted. That creature is loyal to you, follows your commands and lasts for 1 minute or until their hp is reduced to 0. They have half of their normal maximum hp when summoned this way.

item.name: Driver Modification - Wild Weave
entries: This Modification contains magical energy allowing the wearer to mold their spells. Upon being crafted, it contains 1 Metamagic (determined during crafting). When you activate this Modification, you additionally expend the highest level spell slot you have remaining, and gain a number of charges equal to half its spell level (rounded down, minimum 1). These charges can then be spent while the modification remains active to utilize the Metamagic within it. After 1 minute, or when the charges are all spent, the Modification loses its energy and is depleted until it is recharged.

item.name: Drum Mag
entries: A drum mag operates the same as a clip, but can store much more rounds. A drum mag can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 5 minutes. Drum mag weapons are prone to jam, and have their misfire score increased by 1.

item.name: Dual Doors of Knox
entries: These dual doors where wielded by a fire giant dread naught who *hated* doors. he hated them so much that he ripped the seal off a cloud giant hoard room and used them are his shields.

+2 magic weapon AND +2 shield. You must be wielding both items to gain their benefits. {@dice 2d6} bludgeoning, cast {@spell knock|PHB} once per LR, can target up to 9th level magics that are considered "locking" or "sealing".
Paired. Paired weapons has special features that only activate when you are wielding two of the same weapon with the paired property.

item.name: Eclipse Sol
entries: This simple blackened sword hilt is covered with delicate Celestial runes.

As a bonus action, the wielder can bring the blade to life, if it is currently day a vibrant golden blade of light springs to life from the hilt, if it is currently night a dark blade of shadow appears instead. The light blade deals {@dice 1d10} Radiant damage and the shadow blade deals {@dice 1d10} necrotic damage. If the blade is summoned during an eclipse, or on a plane that does not have a day or night cycle it instead summons a twilight blade of light and shadow. This blade deals {@dice 1d8} necrotic and {@dice 1d8} radiant.
The blades summoned gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

When a creature is reduced to zero hit points with this blade a small mote of light breaks off from the blade and orbits the wielders head. This mote can be grasped as a bonus action, allowing the wielder to make a ranged spell attack (+9 to hit) against one creature within 120 feet. The beam deals {@dice 3d12} radiant damage on hit. Up to 4 motes can orbit the wielder at once. If the blade is deactivated or dropped all motes vanish.
While the blade is active the wielder can teleport at will. Teleporting requires two feet of movement for every foot traveled.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Ecto Pack
entries: Innovative Invention.

This backpack comes outfitted with a large hose attached to it, allowing to the quick suction of gaseous materials. The Ecto Pack allows the wearer to harvest Gaseous reagents from creatures, like mists, vapors, fogs, essences, etc. Harvesting a gaseous reagent with this item requires only {@dice 10} minutes of harvesting, and the harvester can choose to make either a {@skill Survival} check or a Glassblower's check (CON). After a successful harvest, the gas appears in a small glass tube where it is safely stored within the pack, that can easily be removed.

item.name: Egg of Seeking
entries: "What an eggscellent and eggsquisite artifact, we can’t eggnore or eggscuse its ability to eggsecute. Indeed we must eggspress that we are eggstatic at its eggsplosive eggspertise, though we are egghausted. How eggciting to see something so eggstravagant, it’s eggceptional…"
"Captain...wha...what was that? Did you plan that? Is this why you were an hour late to the crime scene?! People were murdered!"
\...Eggsactly."

When you break an Egg of Seeking, it reveals the location of any purposefully hidden objects, entrances, containers, persons, and the like within 100 feet for one minute. When this happens, that which is purposefully hidden is enveloped in the illusion of a brightly-colored egg. The hunter of such should then easily be able to poach the location(s) of what is hidden as long as it resides on the same plane of existence.

item.name: Electrolysis Orb
item.reqAttune: Spellcaster that can cast 5th level spells or higher
entries: This metal orb hovers around the user and requires no hands to wield. The Orb retains its magical properties while within 120ft of its owner, and leaving this radius causes it to slowly hover back to its owner at 30ft per round. Upon casting a 1st level spell or higher, the attuned can move the Orb up to 30ft (before or after the spell is cast).

It grants a +2 to your Spell Save DC and Spell attack rolls. The orb can be fitted with 4 plates of a Rare Metal (requiring 1 hour of work and smiths tools in hand, no downtime required), granting the effects of their Weapon Bonus to your Spell attack rolls if it can be properly applied. The plates can also be removed by spending an hour.
The owner of the Orb can give the Orb Commands as a Bonus Action. Below are its possible commands.

items: Static Wave - The Orb pulses with electricity. All creatures within 15ft of it must make a Dexterity Saving Throw against your DC or take 3d8 lightning damage (half as much on a success).
Reflector - The Orb pulses with a protective field. All creatures within 15ft of the orb gain 1d8 + your casting modifier Temporary Hit points.

Positioner - The Orb channels your magic through it. Until the start of your next turn, spells you cast originate from the Orb instead of you. Alternatively, you can use the Orb to reposition Line spells with the orb acting as a point of rotation.

customProperties.armorEffects: Increase an ability score of your choice by 1, up to 20. One other ability Score of your choice is lowered by 2.
customProperties.weaponEffects: You are proficient in any weapon made of Electrum.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Not legal tender for most towns. Treated as Silver for overcoming damage resistances.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Material
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Secondary Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: -
Base Metals: {@item Gold|TftJC} + {@item Silver|TftJC}
Armor Effects: Increase an ability score of your choice by 1, up to 20. One other ability Score of your choice is lowered by 2.
Weapon Effects: You are proficient in any weapon made of Electrum.
Additional Effects: Not legal tender for most towns. Treated as {@item Silver|TftJC} for overcoming damage resistances.
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Enchanting Catalogue Vol.
entries: These tomes contains the secrets to enchanting magical objects.
Affects the following Jobs: Appraisal Shop, Arcanist, Jeweler, Tailor

items: {@item Enchanting Catalogue Vol. I|TftJC}
{@item Enchanting Catalogue Vol. II|TftJC}
{@item Enchanting Catalogue Vol. III|TftJC}
{@item Enchanting Catalogue Vol. IV|TftJC}

item.name: Enchanting Catalogue Vol. I
entries: This tome contains the secrets to enchanting magical objects.
It can be read over 1 week to learn the recipe for one magical item of the books rarity or lower, determined randomly, or gain a +2 bonus to an Arcana check in downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Arcanist, Appraisal Shop, Jeweler, or Tailor Wage Progression by 1
Once this book has been used in this way 2 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Enchanting Catalogue Vol. II
entries: This tome contains the secrets to enchanting magical objects.
It can be read over 1 week to learn the recipe for one magical item of the books rarity or lower, determined randomly, or gain a +3 bonus to an Arcana check in downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Arcanist, Appraisal Shop, Jeweler, or Tailor Wage Progression by 2
Once this book has been used in this way 3 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Enchanting Catalogue Vol. III
entries: This tome contains the secrets to enchanting magical objects.
It can be read over 1 week to learn the recipe for one magical item of the books rarity or lower, determined randomly, or gain a +4 bonus to an Arcana check in downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Arcanist, Appraisal Shop, Jeweler, or Tailor Wage Progression by 3
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Enchanting Catalogue Vol. IV
entries: This tome contains the secrets to enchanting magical objects.
It can be read over 1 week to learn the recipe for one magical item of the books rarity or lower, determined randomly, or gain a +5 bonus to an Arcana check in downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Arcanist, Appraisal Shop, Jeweler, or Tailor Wage Progression by 4
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Encyclopedia of Art, Music and Literature
entries: While on your possession you gain a +1 to Musical Instruments and Artisan Supplies.

item.name: Encyclopedia of Combat and War
entries: While on your possession you gain a +1 to Weapon Attack Rolls.

item.name: Encyclopedia of Inventions and Technology
entries: While on your possession you gain a +1 to Tools Checks

item.name: Encyclopedia of Social Culture
entries: While on your possession you gain a +1 to Persuasion and Deception

item.name: Encyclopedia of the Lands and History
entries: While on your possession you gain a +1 to History and Nature Checks

item.name: Endless Beginnings
item.reqAttune: by a creature with Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma greater than or equal to 15
entries: This combination Armbrace and belt depicts the visage of a grand serpentine Time Dragon biting its own tail with a jet black visage. The metal hums with a blacklight, almost crystalline. A brace like this has now been forged by the Gith'vyrik
The essence of a time dragon would not want its power diluted. You cannot combine this item.
As an action, you can activate this brace and gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a bonus to your Intelligence checks and saving throws equal to your proficiency bonus (even if you are already proficient in either)
Your walking speed increases by 10 feet
You gain advantage on saving throws made against any spell or magical effect that would modify time around you (Chronurgy spells or similar effects to Slow)

Temporal Strike (Recharge 6): Once per turn when you make a Melee Weapon Attack against a target, they must make a DC 17 Wisdom Saving throw or be thrown through time. The target is moved 1 round forward in time, a target moved forward in time vanishes for the duration. When the effect ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in an unoccupied space nearest to the space if it is occupied. Once this ability is used, roll a d6 at the start of each of your turns. If you roll a 6, you may use this ability again.

entries: This effect lasts for 1 minute. At the end of its activation, you gain 1 level of exhaustion and are stunned for a 1 turn.
The brace can be activated in this way 3 times and you regain 1 use per long rest. You cannot end this effect early.
If the attuning creature has access to Psionic Energy Dice, the Telekinetic Feat, or the Telepathic Feat, they gain access to the following ability:
Astral Blade: When you attack with a weapon while the Warbrace is active, your attacks are considered magical and can add 1d8 Force damage once per turn.

item.name: Energy Driver
entries: This metal disc can be affixed to a belt, bandolier, armor, or other things. It contains the power for rapid change. After completing a Long Rest, one of your spell slots becomes 1 slot higher (must select a slot equal to or lower than your proficiency bonus, even if you are not of the level for that spell slot, must remained attuned to retain this benefit), or if you don't have spell slots, you gain a 1st level spell slot. Additionally, you learn to cast 2 spells based on your alignment.
Good - Heroism
Neutral - Absorb Elements
Evil - Last Light
Lawful - Compelled Duel
Neutral - Sanctuary
Chaotic - Chaos Bolt
The Energy Driver has room for up to 2 additional parts to be added to it.

customProperties.armorEffects: While wearing this armor, you gain resistance to psychic damage. While concentrating on a spell, you are gain the benefits of a Ring of Mind Shielding's first effects.
customProperties.weaponEffects: While you are concentrating on a spell, your thrown and ranged weapons deal an additional 3 Psychic Damage on hit. Attacking a creature in your weapons long range doubles this value.
customProperties.additionalEffects: 2 Plates can be used as Material reagent for a Ring of Mind Shielding.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Material
Required Tool: Jeweler's Tools
Secondary Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: ?
Base Metals: {@item Void Ash|TftJC} + {@item Skaier|TftJC}
Armor Effects: While wearing this armor, you gain resistance to psychic damage. While concentrating on a spell, you are gain the benefits of a Ring of Mind Shielding's first effects.
Weapon Effects: While you are concentrating on a spell, your thrown and ranged weapons deal an additional 3 Psychic Damage on hit. Attacking a creature in your weapons long range doubles this value.
Additional Effects: 2 Plates can be used as Material reagent for a Ring of Mind Shielding.
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Eternium

customProperties.forgingConditions: Must be forged in a place where time flows differently.
customProperties.armorEffects: You gain resistance to force damage. You gain a fly speed of 10 feet, if you already have a fly speed it is increased by 20 feet.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Eternium weapons roll double the damage die, and take the highest result. Once per turn, if you roll maximum on a damage die you may roll an additional damage die (which is also rolled at advantage).
customProperties.additionalEffects: You can cast Slow once per day without using a spell slot.

entries: Runesmithed

entries.name: Properties
entries: Base Metal: {@item Cosmium|TftJC}
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: Must be forged in a place where time flows differently.
Armor Effects: You gain resistance to force damage. You gain a fly speed of 10 feet, if you already have a fly speed it is increased by 20 feet.

Weapon Effects: Eternium weapons roll double the damage die, and take the highest result. Once per turn, if you roll maximum on a damage die you may roll an additional damage die (which is also rolled at advantage).
Additional Effects: You can cast Slow once per day without using a spell slot.
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Evercure Potion

description.chatFlavor: You are affected by the Greater Restoration spell.

entries: This Golden potion swirls with small strands of light seemingly flowing within it. As an action, a creature can drink or administer the potion to another creature. Their body is refreshed, as they are affected by the Greater Restoration Spell.

item.name: Explosive Cannonball
entries: Ammunition for cannons enhanced with explosive compounds.
The weapon deals its normal damage, and gains 5 explosive (or +10 explosive if the weapon was already explosive). The explosive damage dealt by this ammunition is halved.

entries.name: Explosive
entries: Upon a hit, everything but the targeted creature within a radius determined by its explosive value of the target takes additional damage equal to the weapon’s damage roll. If the weapon attack misses, the explosive ammunition fails to detonate. Inanimate objects take double damage die from Explosive weapons. Explosive weapons have their misfire score increased by 1.

item.name: Explosive Firearm Ammunition
entries: General explosive ammunition for firearms enhanced with explosive compounds.
The weapon deals its normal damage, and gains 5 explosive (or +10 explosive if the weapon was already explosive). The explosive damage dealt by this ammunition is halved.

entries.name: Explosive
entries: Upon a hit, everything but the targeted creature within a radius determined by its explosive value of the target takes additional damage equal to the weapon’s damage roll. If the weapon attack misses, the explosive ammunition fails to detonate. Inanimate objects take double damage die from Explosive weapons. Explosive weapons have their misfire score increased by 1.

item.name: Explosive Handcannon Ball
entries: Ammunition for handcannons enhanced with explosive compounds.
The weapon deals its normal damage, and gains 5 explosive (or +10 explosive if the weapon was already explosive). The explosive damage dealt by this ammunition is halved.

entries.name: Explosive
entries: Upon a hit, everything but the targeted creature within a radius determined by its explosive value of the target takes additional damage equal to the weapon's damage roll. If the weapon attack misses, the explosive ammunition fails to detonate. Explosive weapons have their misfire score increased by 1 (or gain a misfire of 1 if they did not have a misfire score originally).

item.name: Explosive Lobber
entries: Explosive 5. Upon a hit, everything but the targeted creature within a radius determined by its explosive value of the target takes additional damage equal to the weapon’s damage roll. If the weapon attack misses, the explosive ammunition fails to detonate. Inanimate objects take double damage die from Explosive weapons. Explosive weapons have their misfire score increased by 1.
Barrel 3. A barrel is a chamber that holds a number of rounds. You can spend a Bonus Action to reload a single round in your barrel.

item.name: Explosive Shot
entries: Complex Invention.
Cost 100gp. Requires Alchemist's Tools (INT)
Creates either 4 {@item Explosive Handcannon Ball|TftJC|Handcannon Balls}, 2 {@item Explosive Cannonball|TftJC|Cannonballs} or 5 {@item Explosive Firearm Ammunition|TftJC|Explosive ammunition}.

These cannonballs can be used within a Handcannon, Cannon or explosive firearm as ammunition. The weapon deals its normal damage, and gains 5 explosive (or +10 explosive if the weapon was already is explosive). The explosive damage dealt by this Shot is halved.

entries.name: Explosive
entries: Upon a hit, everything but the targeted creature within a radius determined by its explosive value of the target takes additional damage equal to the weapon's damage roll. If the weapon attack misses, the explosive ammunition fails to detonate. Explosive weapons have their misfire score increased by 1 (or gain a misfire of 1 if they did not have a misfire score originally).

item.name: Eye of the Tempest
entries: This sapphire eye houses the remaining spiritual energies of Laradrin, the Ascendant Tempest. Any creature with the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature that touches the eye must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or be compelled to replace one of their eyes with this one. While within an eye socket this eye functions as a regular eye. However, it can also perceive magic, while you have the eye with the Eye of the Tempest in it open you are under the effects of the Detect Magic spell. Due to the confusing nature of only perceiving this through one eye, if you have both eyes open you have disadvantage on Perception and Investigation checks.

While within an eye socket the host creature can draw on its energies. They learn the Empower and Transmute Metamagics, adding these to their known Metamagics if they have them. Once per long rest they can use the Empower Metamagic on a spell dealing Lightning damage without expending any Sorcery Points. Once per long rest they may use the Transmute Metamagic to transmute any spell into Lightning damage without expending any Sorcery Points.

The Eye of the Tempest is cursed and cannot be willing removed. A remove curse allows it to be removed for 1 minute, during which time a creature must succeed a DC 15 Medicine(Dexterity) check to successfully remove the eye. On a failure, the host takes {@dice 2d4} slashing damage and {@dice 4d10} psychic damage.

item.name: Fate Coin
entries: As a reaction you can flip this coin into the air and place your fate in its hands. Roll {@dice 1d2}.
On a 1, your next roll becomes a natural 20 and you have advantage on all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks until the end of your next turn.
On a 2, your next roll becomes a natural 1 and you have disadvantage on all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks until the end of your next turn.
After the coin has been flipped it bursts into sparkles.

customProperties.forgingConditions: 6th level Fire spell, boiled in salt water
customProperties.armorEffects: When taking force, cold or thunder damage, the wielder can use their reaction to convert the damage they take into either of the other two damage types. All subsequent instances of the converted damage type are treated as the chosen type until the start of the wielder's next turn. Additionally, the wielder gains immunity to crushing pressure of deep water.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Weapons possess the Siege property. When you take cold, force or thunder damage your weapon becomes empowered. It deals an additional 1d8 of that damage type for a number of rounds equal to the damage you took in that instance /10 (min 1). If you take a different damage type, it replaces this effect. Taking more of the same damage type refreshes the round timer on how long the weapon remains empowered.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Material
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: 6th level Fire spell, boiled in salt water

Armor Effects: When taking force, cold or thunder damage, the wielder can use their reaction to convert the damage they take into either of the other two damage types. All subsequent instances of the converted damage type are treated as the chosen type until the start of the wielder's next turn. Additionally, the wielder gains immunity to crushing pressure of deep water.

Weapon Effects: Weapons possess the Siege property. When you take cold, force or thunder damage your weapon becomes empowered. It deals an additional {@dice 1d8} of that damage type for a number of rounds equal to the damage you took in that instance /10 (min 1). If you take a different damage type, it replaces this effect. Taking more of the same damage type refreshes the round timer on how long the weapon remains empowered.
Additional Effects:
Runesmithing: X
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Fiendish Syringe
entries: Innovative Invention.
As an Action, you can administer the Syringe into a dead creature instantly taking the creature's blood. The Blood is the correct amount to act as a Magic Item reagent.

item.name: Figurine of Wondrous Knowledge (Onyxphire Crow)
entries: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an action to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an action to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.

entries.name: {@creature crow|WDMM|Silver Raven}
entries: This onyx statuette of a crow is embedded with sapphire tears. While within darkness it can be activated, becoming the Wereraven Lavore. This transformation lasts for up to 6 hours, once used it cannot be used again for 7 days.

Lavore is a lawful Neutral military historian who studied under the Sapphire dragon Traz'zyn, the Supreme Tactician. He has an intelligence of 18, wisdom of 10, and charisma of 9; Speak read and write in Common, Draconic, Deep speech, and Gnomish; He has extensive and narrow knowledge on the history of Illusion magic, extraplanar travel, Lolth's arachnid decedents, and aberrations with innate psionic abilities. He has a +9 bonus to intelligence checks to recall lore from any of these areas of expertise (including his intelligence mod).

item.name: Fire Belly Mead
entries: Preparation: Requires Cook's Tools or Brewer's Tools to prepare.
Ingredients: x1 Common Dragon Meat, x1 Trailvine.
Effect: You have advantage on all saving throws to resist the effects of cold climates.

item.name: Firearm Armor Piercing Ammo
entries: These rounds burst on contact, drilling through tough defenses. The weapon gains a +1 to hit against creatures wearing Medium Armor, +2 to hit against creatures wearing Heavy Armor, an additional +1 to hit against creatures using a {@item Shield|PHB}, but a -1 to hit against Unarmored Creatures. Light Armor provides no changes.

item.name: Flail of Disruption
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you hit a fiend or an undead with this magic weapon, that creature takes an extra {@dice 2d6} radiant damage. If the target has 25 hit points or fewer after taking this damage, it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be destroyed. On a successful save, the creature becomes frightened of you until the end of your next turn.
While you hold this weapon, it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

item.name: Flamethrower
entries: Gas 7. Gas weapons do not need to be loaded, rather attached to them is a tank of fuel. A gas weapon uses one unit of gas per attack, and can be fired until the tank is depleted. A Gas tank can be refilled by spending 1 minute per unit expended. You cannot store additional units of Gas, except within the weapon itself.
Cone 10. Cone weapons attack in a cone with a length equal to their value, using the attack roll rolled on all creatures within its cone area behind the initial target.

item.name: Flaming Blades
entries: Innovative Invention.
This weapon has channels where oil can freely flow between to keep the blades alight.
As an Action, you can ignite the Blade with fire. While lit, they deal an additional {@dice 1d6} Fire Damage.

They stay lit per a number of successful attacks landed equal to how many doses of lantern's oil they have inside, which is stored in the pommel. They can store 5 doses worth. It takes 1 minute to fully refill the pommels with oil.
These weapons also make for great tools for performers looking to spice up their act.

item.name: Flaming Orb
entries: Orbs are magic items found within Kima-at that can be applied to weapons, foci and armor, each granting unique effects. Orbs have 10 charges, which return at dawn.
You can only use one charge per orb, per turn. Up to 2 Orbs can be placed on a single item, which combines them and grants new effects.
Having 2 orbs on one weapon/armor/foci combines their charges, and allows you to use their abilities interchangeably. Using a Combo effect requires 2 charges spent
Weapon Effect: Hit creatures gain 1 {@condition Burning|TftJC}.
Armor Effect: -2 Fire Damage, you can spend a charge when you gain a stack of Burning to not gain it.
Focus Effect: Creatures hit by or who fail a saving throw gain 1 Burning, or 2 if the spell cast matches the Orb's element.

item.name: Flash Camera
entries: Innovative Invention.

This contraption has the ability to capture a still image and convert it into a small flexible photograph. As an action you can deploy the tripod beneath it to stabilize it, giving advantage on checks to use it. As an action, you can make a {@skill Perception} or {@skill Investigation} check with the camera, capturing an image directly in front of it. The further away the image, the less detail you will get. Your check determines how clear the image will be.
Having a Flash Camera while working the Journalism or Artist job increases your wage by 5 gp.

item.name: Flayer Slayer (Very Rare)
entries: Carvings of decapitated mind flayers adorn this greataxe’s metal blade. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic greataxe.

An Aberration hit with this greataxe takes an extra 1d12 slashing damage. If the Aberration is currently grappling a creature, the Aberration must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or release each creature it is grappling.

If a flying creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to hold the greataxe aloft and cause it to flare with light. The attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll, and it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the start of its next turn.

item.name: Frost Cactus Wine
entries: Preparation: Requires Cook's Tools or Brewer's Tools to prepare.
Ingredients: x1 Common Dragon Meat, x1 Trailvine.
Effect: You have advantage on all saving throws to resist the effects of hot climates.

item.name: Frostwail
entries: This maul of ice and ivory bears a never melting heavy head.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magical weapon. When you hit a creature with this weapon you deal {@dice 2d6} cold damage.

When you land a critical hit the maul head explodes dealing {@dice 3d12} cold damage to each creature of your choice within 10ft of you. The maul head then takes {@dice 1d4} rounds to reform, during this time the maul cannot deal damage.

item.name: Future of Chromaticism Dragon Masks
entries: These masks bear the visage of oneself realized as a Chromatic Dragon. regardless if attuned or not, the magic of the mask remains bonded to the being that is bound by infernal contract to Tiamat. Some features persist even without being attuned, and can not be undone except by being removed from the Infernal Contract.
The Dragon masks are no longer cursed, and lose their Cursed effects. Instead, the wearers gains the following Madness effects:
{@item Blue Dragon Mask|RoTOS} - Combat is an art, and should be seen as such. There is elegance in outwitting foes, and your battles should herald acclaim.
{@item Black Dragon Mask|RoTOS} - Combat and victory is more than about winning, its about instilling fear in those who are beneath you.
{@item Red Dragon Mask|RoTOS} - Combat is a necessary tool that none wield better. The world is rightfully mine.
{@item Green Dragon Mask|RoTOS} - Combat is a new opportunity to proves one's intellect. Fighting fair would be holding back.

If you are to die, and not revived within 1 day, you are reborn as an Adult Dragon of your associated colour. You can choose to transform early into your Dragon, but cannot undo this form afterwards. Alternatively, after 100 years pass (dead or alive), you transform into an adult dragon.
As an Action, the wielder can change this into any melee weapon they are proficient with.
While attuned you gain all other benefits of the masks and,

You gain an associated Breath Weapon of a Young Dragon of your colour, recharging on a 6. Your creature type is considered Humanoid/Dragon. As a part of a 1 minute ritual, you and all of your equipment (except for the associated Blade) can transform into a Young Dragon of your colour. You retain your mental statistics, but not class/racial features. Dropping to 0 hit points or after 1 hour passes transforms you back. Each time you do so 1d4 years is removed from your timer.

item.name: Gauntlets of the Frigid North
entries: While you wear both of these steel gauntlets, any non-magical weapon you grasp with either gauntlet is treated as a magic weapon.

As a bonus action, you can use the gauntlets to cause ice to envelop one or two melee weapons in your grasp. Each icy weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d6} cold damage on a hit. The ice last until you sheath or let go of either weapon. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.
In addition, you can touch one 5-foot cube of water and cause it to freeze for 1 hour.

item.name: Generator Orb
entries: Orbs are magic items found within Kima-at that can be applied to weapons, foci and armor, each granting unique effects. Orbs have 10 charges, which return at dawn.
You can only use one charge per orb, per turn. Up to 2 Orbs can be placed on a single item, which combines them and grants new effects.
Having 2 orbs on one weapon/armor/foci combines their charges, and allows you to use their abilities interchangeably. Using a Combo effect requires 2 charges spent
Combined Orbs: {@item Static Orb|TftJC} + {@item Charging Orb|TftJC}
Weapon Effect: Hitting a creature successfully grants +15 walking speed until the end of your next turn.
Armor Effect: Gain +15ft walking speed this turn.
Focus Effect: If a creature is hit by or fail a saving throw, that grants +15 walking speed until the end of your next turn.

customProperties.forgingConditions: Must be smithed on the Ethereal Plane
customProperties.armorEffects: Armor made from Ghost Steel allows the user to see creatures on the Ethereal Plane. Gives advantage on saving throws against undead that would give you the Frightened condition.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Can only be made into light weapons. Ghost Steel weapons can hit creatures on the Ethereal Plane, regardless of the plane the weapon is on. Ghost Steel weapons ignore damage resistances from undead.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Any clothes made from Ghost Steel Weaver's tools grant +1 to Disguise checks.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Ethereal Plane
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: Must be smithed on the Ethereal Plane

Armor Effects: Armor made from Ghost Steel allows the user to see creatures on the Ethereal Plane. Gives advantage on saving throws against undead that would give you the {@condition Frightened} condition.

Weapon Effects: Can only be made into light weapons. Ghost Steel weapons can hit creatures on the Ethereal Plane, regardless of the plane the weapon is on. Ghost Steel weapons ignore damage resistances from undead.
Additional Effects: Any clothes made from Ghost Steel Weaver's tools grant +1 to Disguise checks.
Runesmithing: X
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Gith'vyrik Lancer
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. It has the thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. When you hit with a ranged attack using this weapon, it deals an extra {@dice 1d8} force damage or, if the target is an Aberration, {@dice 2d8} force damage. Immediately after the attack, the weapon flies back to your hand.

item.name: Githyanki Silver

customProperties.armorEffects: The Dexterity Bonus Medium armor can provide is increased by 1.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Can be used to sever a Silver Cord. All Slashing weapons gain the Finesse Property.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Treated as Silver for overcoming Resistances.

entries: Runesmithed

entries.name: Properties
entries: Base Metal: {@item Silver|TftJC}
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Armor Effects: The Dexterity Bonus Medium armor can provide is increased by 1.
Weapon Effects: Can be used to sever a Silver Cord. All Slashing weapons gain the Finesse Property.
Additional Effects: Treated as Silver for overcoming Resistances.
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Githyanki Spacer Helm
entries: Complex Invention.

This special helm protects the wearer from environmental hazards that are airborne and is key in navigating the void that is the Astral Sea. This helm can only be worn for 10 hours at a time before 2 attached filters need to be replaced for new ones. While wearing this helm, you can breathe normally in any environment, and you have advantage on saving throws made against harmful gases and vapors (such as {@spell cloudkill} and {@spell stinking cloud} effects, inhaled poisons, and the breath weapons of some dragons). You also resist the cold environment of the Astral Sea.

item.name: Githyanki Warbrace (Astral Dragon)
item.reqAttune: by a creature with Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma greater than or equal to 15
entries: This combination Armbrace and belt depicts the visage of a grand astral dragon with amethyst inlays. This brace was once made for elite warriors of Vlaakith, but have since been lost or are not in production, although it is still possible to create new ones with materials from various planes of existence.
This item was blessed through Vlaakith, and she would not want this to be muddled in any other way. You cannot combine this item.
As an action, you can activate this brace and gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a bonus to AC equal to your (Intelligence/Wisdom/Charisma) modifier
Your walking speed increases by 10 feet
You gain advantage on Acrobatics Checks
You gain a bonus equal to your Constitution saving throw for maintaining concentration on spells equal to your (Intelligence/Wisdom/Charisma) Ability modifier

entries: When you activate this brace, roll 1d3, on a 1 you use your Intelligence modifier, on a 2 you use your Wisdom Modifier, and on a 3 you use your Charisma modifier
This effect lasts for 1 minute. At the end of its activation, you gain 1 level of exhaustion and are stunned for a 1 turn.
The brace can be activated in this way 3 times and you regain 1 use per long rest. You cannot end this effect early.
If the attuning creature has access to Psionic Energy Dice, the Telekinetic Feat, or the Telepathic Feat, they gain access to the following ability:
Astral Blade: When you attack with a weapon while the Warbrace is active, your attacks are considered magical and can add 1d8 Force damage once per turn.

item.name: Githyanki Warbrace (Unawakened)
item.reqAttune: by a creature with Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma greater than or equal to 15
entries: The brace can be activated in this way 3 times and you regain 1 use per long rest. You cannot end this effect early.
As an action, you can activate this brace and gain the following benefits:

items: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet
You gain advantage on Acrobatics Checks

entries: The brace can be activated in this way 3 times and you regain 1 use per long rest. You cannot end this effect early.
If the attuning creature has access to Psionic Energy Dice, the Telekinetic Feat, or the Telepathic Feat, they gain access to the following ability:
Astral Blade: When you attack with a weapon while the Warbrace is active, your attacks are considered magical and can add 1d8 Force damage once per turn.

item.name: Glider
entries: Complex Invention.

This folding device contains a flexible cloth that is able to take on the weight of 1 Medium or smaller creature. This device is stored on the wearer's back, and metal rods connect to the apparatus that run down the wearer's arms. As an Action, the wearer can Prime the Glider. While Primed the wearer's range of motion is slightly more limited, causing disadvantage on making melee attacks, sleight of hand checks, and preventing the use of a Shield.

While primed, the wearer can use a reaction when falling more than 10ft to begin to glide. The Glider allows the wielder to fall harmlessly down, gliding a number of feet forwards equal to the distance they would have fallen. A creature using the Glider can only fall a maximum of 60ft in a round, as it slows descent.
If you take 5 or more fire damage while using the glider, the cloth burns up causing the wielder to begin falling. A new cloth can be replaced onto the glider for 25gp.

item.name: Gloom
entries: This blood-soaked rapier has taken countless lives and is suffused with its previous wielder's malice. Attacks with this magical rapier gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls.
While in darkness or dim light, the blade becomes shrouded in shadow becoming nearly unperceivable. While shrouded in shadow this blade's damage ignores damage resistances.

customProperties.armorEffects: You have Advantage on ability checks involving communicating with Earth Elementals. You have resistance to Radiant Damage.
customProperties.weaponEffects: You have Advantage on ability checks involving communicating with Earth Elementals. Gor'shorot weapons always deal bludgeoning damage.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Meals produced by Brewers Tools made of Gor'shorot grant Temp HP equal to the crafter's Prof bonus when consumed.

customProperties.weaponEffects: Gorgonite Weapons deal 1d4 Poison damage to all creatures within a 5ft radius of the attack target (including yourself) after making an attack roll.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Material for +1 Poisoner and Herbalism Tools (2 Plates)

Runesmithing: X
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Grand Intelligence Mutagen
entries: A creature can use an action to inject this mutagen into their brain stem. The creature doing the injection must make a DC 30 Medicine check on a failure the injected creature suffers one level of exhaustion and an additional level for every 5 below the DC.

Once injected the creatures Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores all increase by 1 up to 20. The creature also has disadvantage on Strength saving throws. The effect lasts until removed by a wish or magic that remakes a creature's body such as Reincarnate or Wish.

customProperties.armorEffects: Armor weight is reduced by ¼ and the strength requirement is lowered by 1. Any fall damage you take is reduced by 20.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Weapon weight is reduced by ¼, and creatures have disadvantage to disarm you. Any weapon with the Heavy property loses that property, any weapon without Heavy, Two-handed, or Special, gains the Light property.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Material for Outer Essence Shard (3 Plates)

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Material
Required Tool: Mason's Tools
Forging Conditions: 17 CON
Armor Effects: Armor weight is reduced by ¼ and the strength requirement is lowered by 1. Any fall damage you take is reduced by 20.

Weapon Effects: Weapon weight is reduced by ¼, and creatures have disadvantage to disarm you. Any weapon with the Heavy property loses that property, any weapon without Heavy, Two-handed, or Special, gains the Light property.
Additional Effects: Material for Outer Essence Shard (3 Plates)

customProperties.armorEffects: The Armors weight is quadrupled but its AC is increased by +1. As an action you can double the weight of the armor. While doubled you gain an additional +1 AC but your speed is reduced by 10 feet and you have disadvantage on Dexterity based attack rolls.
customProperties.weaponEffects: The weapons weight is quadrupled. Its damage die increases by one. As an action you can double the weight of the weapon to increase the weapons die by an additional step. When you do this you have disadvantage on all Dexterity saving throws and Dexterity ability checks.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Suitable material for Titanic Plate.

Weapon Effects: The weapons weight is quadrupled. Its damage die increases by one. As an action you can double the weight of the weapon to increase the weapons die by an additional step. When you do this you have disadvantage on all Dexterity saving throws and Dexterity ability checks.
Additional Effects: Suitable material for Titanic Plate.
Druid Useable: Yes

item.name: Guileless' Guide Vol.
entries: This guide contains self-help tricks on improving your charisma and social standing.
Affects the following Jobs: Franchiser, General Store, Priest, Stablehand, Tour Guide

items: {@item Guileless' Guide Vol. I|TftJC}
{@item Guileless' Guide Vol. II|TftJC}
{@item Guileless' Guide Vol. III|TftJC}
{@item Guileless' Guide Vol. IV|TftJC}

item.name: Guileless' Guide Vol. I
entries: This guide contains self-help tricks on improving your charisma and social standing.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature a 10% discount to one purchase in downtime, provided it is an object of the same or lower rarity as this tome.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Franchiser, General Store, Priest, Stablehand, or Tour Guide Wage Progression by 1.
Once this book has been used in this way 2 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Guileless' Guide Vol. II
entries: This guide contains self-help tricks on improving your charisma and social standing.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature a 10% discount to one purchase in downtime, provided it is an object of the same or lower rarity as this tome.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Franchiser, General Store, Priest, Stablehand, or Tour Guide Wage Progression by 2.
Once this book has been used in this way 3 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Guileless' Guide Vol. III
entries: This guide contains self-help tricks on improving your charisma and social standing.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature a 10% discount to one purchase in downtime, provided it is an object of the same or lower rarity as this tome.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Franchiser, General Store, Priest, Stablehand, or Tour Guide Wage Progression by 3.
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Guileless' Guide Vol. IV
entries: This guide contains self-help tricks on improving your charisma and social standing.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature a 10% discount to one purchase in downtime, provided it is an object of the same or lower rarity as this tome.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Franchiser, General Store, Priest, Stablehand, or Tour Guide Wage Progression by 4.
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Gunblade
entries: Barrel 2. A barrel is a chamber that holds a number of rounds. You can spend a Bonus Action to reload a single round in your barrel.

Gunblade. A Gunblade is a melee bladed weapon that additionally has the capacity to have bullets stored within it. It is treated as a martial melee weapon that is also a firearm. The Gunblade can be used to make melee attack, or ranged attacks that instead deal piercing damage. It only has a misfire score and expends bullets when used as a ranged weapon. When a Gunblades barrel is empty, it can continue to be used like a standard melee weapon. In addition, you may use Gunner features that require ranged attacks (such as Shoot to Thrill) with melee weapon attacks as well, so long as you are using a Gunblade.

item.name: Gunsmith's Tools
entries: Gunsmith's tools include a variety of hand tools, precision instruments, and cleaning implements used in the creation, repair, and modification of firearms and gunblades.

entries.name: Components
items: Small hammer
Precision screwdrivers
Files and rasps
Bore brush
Measuring calipers
Oil and cleaning cloths

entries.name: Proficiency
entries: If you have proficiency with gunsmith's tools, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to craft, repair, or modify firearms and gunblades.

entries.name: Sample Uses
items: Repair a jammed or damaged firearm
Craft ammunition or custom gun parts
Modify a gunblade with special features
Identify the make or origin of a firearm

item.name: Hand-Bomb
entries: Simple Invention.

On a successful hit, the Hand-Bomb explodes. All creatures within a 15ft cube of the point of detonation must make a DC 13 DEX Save, taking {@dice 3d4} Force damage on a fail or half on a save (If the bomb detonated while being thrown at a creature, they have disadvantage on the save).

On a miss, the bomb lands at the feet of the targeted creature. The bomb will then detonate after the end of your next turn, or if the bomb would take radiant/force/fire/thunder damage before that point.
The bomb can be picked up and thrown again in this time period, or diffused by making a DC 13 Tinkers Tools (INT/DEX) check. Failing this check immediately detonates the bomb.

item.name: Handcannon
entries: This miniature cannon can be wielded effectively with two hands, like a heavy crossbow.
Proficiency in the Heavy Crossbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus with this weapon.
It uses small cannonballs as ammunition, 10 of which can be bought for 5gp.
There are the following versions:

items: {@item Handcannon MK I|TftJC}
{@item Handcannon MK II|TftJC}
{@item Handcannon MK III|TftJC}

item.name: Handcannon Armor Piercing Rounds
entries: These rounds burst on contact, drilling through tough defenses. The weapon gains a +1 to hit against creatures wearing Medium Armor, +2 to hit against creatures wearing Heavy Armor, an additional +1 to hit against creatures using a {@item Shield|PHB}, but a -1 to hit against Unarmored Creatures. Light Armor provides no changes.

item.name: Handcannon MK I
entries: Innovative Invention.
This miniature cannon can be wielded effectively with two hands, like a heavy crossbow.
Proficiency in the Heavy Crossbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus with this weapon.
It uses small cannonballs as ammunition, 10 of which can be bought for 5gp.

As an Action, the wielder can ignite the fuse on the end of the cannon and fire it. Make a ranged attack roll (range 120ft, with no long range). It travels in that line until it hits a creature's AC, or it reaches the end of its range. A Creature hit by this attack takes {@dice 4d10} + DEX Bludgeoning Damage.
It requires 3 Actions to Reload. If the wielder has the Crossbow Master Feat, this is lowered to 2.

item.name: Handcannon MK II
entries: Complex Invention.
This miniature cannon can be wielded effectively with two hands, like a heavy crossbow.
Proficiency in the Heavy Crossbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus with this weapon.
It uses small cannonballs as ammunition, 10 of which can be bought for 5gp.

The wielder can ignite the fuse on the end of the cannon and fire it. Make a ranged attack roll (range 120ft, with no long range). It travels in that line until it hits a creature's AC, or it reaches the end of its range. A Creature hit by this attack takes {@dice 4d10} + DEX Bludgeoning Damage.
It requires forgoing 3 Attacks to Reload. If the wielder has the Crossbow Master Feat, this is lowered to 2.

item.name: Handcannon MK III
entries: Complex Invention.
This miniature cannon can be wielded effectively with two hands, like a heavy crossbow.
Proficiency in the Heavy Crossbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus with this weapon.
It uses small cannonballs as ammunition, 10 of which can be bought for 5gp.

The wielder can ignite the fuse on the end of the cannon and fire it. Make a ranged attack roll (range 120ft, with no long range). It travels in that line until it hits a creature's AC, or it reaches the end of its range. A Creature hit by this attack takes {@dice 4d10} + DEX Bludgeoning Damage.

It requires forgoing 2 Attacks by the wielder to Reload. If the wielder has the Crossbow Master Feat, this is lowered to 1. Additionally, the wielder can use a Bonus Action to progress the reload of this weapon by 1. Minimum 1 attacks required to reload the cannon.

item.name: Harmony Tea
entries: Preparation: Requires Cook's Tools or Brewer's Tools to prepare.
Ingredients: x2 Harmony Caps.
Effect: Gain +1 to all concentration checks until you fail one.

macro.name: Harmony Tea Effect

item.name: Harvest Sauce
entries: Preparation: Requires Cook's Tools or Brewer's Tools to prepare.
Ingredients: x3 Red Winter Berries, x1 Remedial Herb, x1 Bubblepod.
Effect: Must be eaten with another meal, whenever you gain temporary hit points, increase the amount gained by 1.

item.name: Harvester
entries: Complex Invention.

Using 4 hours of time, you can carefully extract sap from plant matter. To extract things, one must place the correct amount of a crop's harvest into the machine and monitor its extraction. Below are the current crops that it can use and their production rates. Additionally, for all plants and those without unique options, they are granted an option based on their rarity.
4 Rusty Spriggs -> 1 Random Uncommon Seed
1 Dead Kelpglider -> 1 Aquatic Companion Seed
10 3-leaf False Clovers -> 1 Reroll with advantage
10 Rock Gum Roots -> 1 Weakened Sovereign Glue (must be used within 1 week, loses stick after 1 day)
1 Gem Root Seed -> 50 gp diamond
10 3-leaf Golden Clovers -> 1 Reroll with advantage
40 Ironoak Berries -> 1 Ironoak Seed
16 Noble Willow Leaves -> 1 Noble Willow Sap
8 Common plants product -> {@dice 1d4} enriching fertilizer
8 Uncommon plants product -> {@dice 1d4} robust fertilizer
8 rare plants product -> {@dice 1d4} fortifying fertilizer
8 very rare plants product -> 1 Permanent Robust fertilizer
8 legendary plants product -> 1 Permanent Fortifying fertilizer

item.name: Heart of Ice
entries: You gain resistance to Cold Damage. If you already have resistance from another source, this either becomes resistance to Necrotic Damage, or immunity to Cold (your choice).
Your Charisma Score and its maximum increase by 2, up to 30.
Whenever you succeed on a Saving Throw, the Amulet bursts with Ice. Your next weapon or spell attack in the next minute deals additional damage equal to your Charisma Modifier.

item.name: Heart of the Empire
entries: This golden amulet is in the shape of the monumental pyramids of Mere’su’ra, a favored piece of jewelry of its tragic empress. When in direct sunlight it glows a soft golden.
Golden Heart. Your Constitution score increases by 2 and your maximum increases by 2 as well.

Heart of the Mind. When you fail a Death Save instead of marking a failure, you reduce your Intelligence by 1, this intelligence drop cannot be mitigated through any means. If this drops your Intelligence to 0, you die instantly. Intelligence lost in this way is regained on the last day of the month.
Greater Diviner. While on your person, Divination spells of 5th level or lower do not require spell slots to cast.

Cursed. Cursed. Upon touching this amulet a creature becomes cursed. While cursed, they gain boundless compassion similar to Thilask the Empress of Mere’su’ra. You instinctively trust people and cannot think about lying, answering openly and honestly to those you encounter. You automatically fail Deception and Insight checks and the saving throws of any effects that would force you to tell the truth.

You are unable to benefit from any illusions that would obscure your appearance or effects that would shape change you, such as polymorph or wild shape and similarly magic items or spells that prevent creatures from reading your thoughts or learning your creature type don’t work on you. Should you ever take off the amulet or lose it your Constitution becomes 1, this lasts until you have the amulet again or a 9th level Remove Curse removes the curse.

customProperties.armorEffects: Your proficiency bonus is added to damage rolls anytime you cast a spell of 1st or higher level that deals fire damage (once per cast).
customProperties.weaponEffects: While wielding the weapon, you can cast Searing Smite using this weapon without requiring concentration a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per Long Rest. Any attack made by this weapon is treated as if the you and the target are in sunlight.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Any magical effect that requires "dawn" can be circumvented at midnight by holding that item to any item made of Helios.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Material
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Secondary Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: 13 CHA + 3rd level Fire Spell
Base Metals: {@item Gold|TftJC} + {@item Blazing Brass|TftJC}
Armor Effects: Your proficiency bonus is added to damage rolls anytime you cast a spell of 1st or higher level that deals fire damage (once per cast).

Weapon Effects: While wielding the weapon, you can cast {@spell Searing Smite} using this weapon without requiring concentration a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per Long Rest. Any attack made by this weapon is treated as if the you and the target are in sunlight.
Additional Effects: Any magical effect that requires "dawn" can be circumvented at midnight by holding that item to any item made of Helios.
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Herald of the Tidecaller
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, druid, or warlock
entries: This magical staff was created by the Sealord Overkin when he conquered the known seas by controlling the great leviathan Veshrime. The staff imparts a faction of Overkin's power to control the seas onto its wielder, if they should prove worthy to wield it. The power of the staff can be shared amongst multiple creatures. Unlike regular magic items any number of creatures can attune to the staff.

This staff can be wielded as a magical quarterstaff that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While wielding the staff, you can make attack with it with Wisdom instead of Strength. While holding the staff you gain a swim speed of 60 feet and can breathe underwater. Attack rolls with this weapon in water have advantage and cannot gain disadvantage.

The staff has a number of charges equal to the combined levels of cleric, druid, or warlock of all creatures attuned to it to be used on the following properties. It regains {@dice 2d6+1} charges at dawn each day.

entries.name: Abyssal Control
entries: 1 charge. While holding the staff, you can use an action to attempt to control any beast, elemental, or monstrosity with a swim speed within 120ft of you. The target must make a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure of 5 or more, the creature must follow your commands on the next turn. On a failure the creature does not have to follow your commands but may only take one action (action or bonus action) on their turn, including only making one attack, and cannot take reactions or use legendary actions. This DC increases by 1 for each creature attuned to the staff, doubled if they are a druid, tripled if they have 10 or more levels in druid.

entries.name: Spells
entries: While holding the staff you can use it to cast the following spells, expending the number of charges required: {@spell shape water} (no charges), {@spell create or destroy water} (1 charge), recurring remedy (3 charges), {@spell acid arrow} (3 charges), {@spell wall of water} (5 charges), {@spell water walk} (5 charges), {@spell control water} (7 charges), {@spell maelstrom} (9 charges), {@spell wall of ice} (12 charges), {@spell regenerate} (15 charges), {@spell tsunami} (18 charges), {@spell shape change} (creatures with a swim speed only) (22 charges). You use your DC and Spell Casting ability for these spells, and can also cast them by expending a spell slot instead of charges.

entries.name: Master of Tides
entries: As an action you can activate the staff to create a bubble of aquatic control around you. Each creature of your choice within 30ft of you gain a swim speed equal to their walking speed, can breathe underwater, and can freely communicate through the water. Likewise, creatures of your choice in the radius inside water have disadvantage on attacks against targets inside the radius who are also inside the water. This effect lasts for 1 hour, after which it cannot be used until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Herbalist Helper Vol.
entries: These tomes contains the secrets of medical knowledge, plants, and poultices.
Affects the following Jobs: Alchemist, Gardening, Doctor, Poisoner

items: {@item Herbalist Helper Vol. I|TftJC}
{@item Herbalist Helper Vol. II|TftJC}
{@item Herbalist Helper Vol. III|TftJC}
{@item Herbalist Helper Vol. IV|TftJC}

item.name: Herbalist Helper Vol. I
entries: This tome contains the secrets of medical knowledge, plants, and poultices.
It can be read over 1 week to learn the use for one plant, potion, or poison of a rarity lower than this book, determined randomly.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Gardening, Doctor, Poisoner, or Alchemist Wage Progression by 1
Once this book has been used in this way 2 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time and does not require the use of downtime.

item.name: Hookblade
entries: This bracer contains a retractable two-pronged climbing tool.
There are the following versions:

items: {@item Hookblade MK I|TftJC}
{@item Hookblade MK II|TftJC}

item.name: Hookblade MK I
entries: Simple Invention.
This bracer contains a retractable two-pronged climbing tool.

As an action, the wearer can deploy (or retract) the climbing tool by pressing a button (this is considered using an item). While deployed, the wearer had advantage on ability checks made to climb surfaces. Additionally, the wearer can hang from a wall they are climbing with only the hookblade secured into the wall, freeing up a hand.

item.name: Hookblade MK II
entries: Innovative Invention.
This bracer contains a retractable three-pronged climbing tool.

As a bonus action, the wearer can deploy (or retract) the climbing tool by pressing a button (this is considered using an item). While deployed, the wearer gains a climb speed equal to their walking speed. Additionally, the wearer can hang from a wall they are climbing with only the hookblade secured into the wall, freeing up a hand.

customProperties.forgingConditions: Forged by a Human with hate in their heart

customProperties.weaponEffects: Can only be made into Slashing weapons. Deals one step lower damage dice. Targets lose 1d4 hp (untyped) if they can bleed. Counts as silver for resistances and immunities. Fey will be more aggressive towards you.

item.name: Hunter's Pistol
entries: Innovative Invention.
Barrel 1. A barrel is a chamber that holds a number of rounds. You can spend a Bonus Action to reload a single round in your barrel.

While in the off-hand, the wielder can use a reaction when targeted by a melee attack to fire the pistol at the attacker, granting a bonus to their AC equal to a roll of the pistol's damage die. (this deals no damage and expends the ammunition)

item.name: Ice Spring Wine
entries: Preparation: Requires Cook's Tools or Brewer's Tools to prepare.
Ingredients: x1 Bubblepod, x1 Drow's Wine Glass, x3 Red Winterberry.
Effect: When you take a short rest you gain +2 Hit Points per Hit Die spent.

item.name: Icebreaker
entries: You gain a +2 to attack rolls and damage rolls with this weapon.
When you cast a spell that deals Cold Damage, you can apply this sword's bonus to the Spell Attack Roll, or increase its saving throw by 2 (whichever applies).
If you make an attack with this weapon after dealing Cold Damage in the past minute, this weapon’s Critical Hit Range is increased by 1.

item.name: Iceflower Flakey
entries: Preparation: Requires Cook's Tools to prepare.
Ingredients: x1 Drow's Wine Glass, x1 Uncommon Meat (cold resistance)

Effect: You gain a +1 bonus to Intelligence saves and when you take psychic damage you can use your reaction to reduce the psychic damage to 1. Once you use this reaction you lose all the bonuses of this meal.

customProperties.armorEffects: You gain resistance to Psychic Damage. Illithids wearing this have advantage on Wisdom Saves.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Weapons that Critically hit grant the target vulnerability to Psychic damage for a number of rounds equal to your Prof Bonus. Illithids using these deal an additional 1d6 psychic damage on a hit.

item.name: Impossible Gloves
entries: Simple Invention.
This set of gloves is coated with Boggle Oil. They are flame resistant and hydrophobic.
They must be kept in water for 8 hours per hour of use to maintain their potency. Touching a creature with the gloves gives you advantage on Strength based Grapple checks.

item.name: Indara’s Fall
entries: This magical golden lance is adorned with etching of horses dashing through a rising dawn. Attacks made with this lace gain a +3 to attack and damage rolls.

In addition, they deal an extra {@dice 1d10} fire damage on hit. When this lance is used against a Dragon it deals an addition weapon die of damage, and on a critical it adds {@dice 3d6} additional damage.

Once per day, the wielder can hold aloft the lance and use an action to cast {@spell Find Greater Steed|XGE}. When cast in this way, it specifically summons the spirit bonded to the weapon, Rasharam. Rasharam has the statistics of a {@creature nightmare|MM}, but is of type celestial and only the ability to convoy its summoner. When he appears, he is equipped with a saddle and set of plate barding, which vanish with him when he is dismissed or slain. Rasharam remains until dismissed or slain.

Indara’s Fall can only be attuned, identified, and wielded by one who has slain a Dragon of CR 11 or higher. A creature can perform a bonding ritual with the blade by anointing it with CR 11 or high Dragon’s blood. Once this ritual is performed, that creature can always attune to Indara’s Fall.
Special. You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

Weapon Effects: -

item.name: Iron Ceatus
entries: Special. These heavy gauntlets require immense strength to use effectively. A creature must have 15 Strength or they make all attacks with this weapon with disadvantage.

Unarmed. Unarmed weapons replace your unarmed damage with the weapon damage listed. If you have other options for unarmed damage, such as a Fighting Style or Martial Arts monk feature you can choose which damage die applies. A value written as +X as opposed to X adds to unarmed damage rather than replacing it.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Katana of Astral Speed

In addition, you can make one attack with it as a bonus action on each of your turns.
You gain a fly speed of 60ft while in the Astral Sea.
Special. Only Ninjutsu Rogues are able to gain proficiency with this weapon.

Ingredients: x1 Mist Creeper, x1 Bubblepod.
Effect: Triples the duration you can remain underwater before you begin drowning.

item.name: Kriki’s Rolodex
entries: This simple mirrored watch can be used to capture and replicate the image of others. As an action the wielder can open this mirror and use it to alter their body, taking on the complete appearance of someone else. The form they take must be one that is stored inside the rolodex, which can hold up to five images at a time.

An image can be added to the mirror by having an intended target look into the mirror for at least 6 seconds. Once they do so, their image is stored inside the mirror and the user can take on their shape. The mirror perfectly replicates the person it has copied, making the user appear as the target, including altering perceived height and weight, as long as they are of the same size, if they are not the transformation fails.
Noticing the illusion requires a DC 20 Investigation check, in which case the creature notices something is off about the disguised person, but still does not see through the illusion.

item.name: Lance of the Steadfast Prince
item.reqAttune: by a creature with at least 15 CHA
entries: You gain a +3 to attack rolls and damage rolls with this weapon.
If you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, you deal an additional 2d8 necrotic damage and regain a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.
Additionally, your walking speed is increased by 10, and if you are mounted this walking speed is bonus is instead applied to your mount.
Special. You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

item.name: Learner’s Tome
entries: This magical book can be used to teach spells. The book is written in an encoded ink that prevents it from being copied, but a creature with the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature can spend a week studying the book and make an Arcana check. At the end of this studying, if the Arcana check totals 15 x the spell's level (10 for a cantrip), you add the spell in the book to your spells list or spells known. Arcana checks over multiple weeks are added together until the total is reached. If the spell in the book is not usually on a creature’s spell list, the book is indecipherable for them.

Once used, the book crumbles to ash. A character can inscribe a spell on their spell list or known to them on a blank learner's tome by doing the same process of making an Arcana check and reaching the threshold of 15 x the spell’s level.

item.name: Lemon Salt Crackers
entries: Preparation: Requires Cook's Tools to prepare.
Ingredients: x1 Common Elemental Meat, x2 Trailvine.
Effect: You gain a +1 bonus to all Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution ability checks.

If you would make an attack roll with this weapon and roll 1 under your Critical hit range, you can try and convince the weapon to hit a bit harder. Make a DC 20 Persuasion check, and on a success, your critical hit threshold for that attack is increased by 1. On a fail of 10 or more, the attack misses as the weapon forces you to whiff your strike.
