item.name: Locket of Warding
entries: This magical Locket contains space for a piece of a Creature to be placed within.
As an Action, you can place a reagent of a Creature within the locket and grant yourself the following benefit based on its CR and Type.

You gain advantage on one saving throw of your choice (which can be changed at dawn) against creatures of that Type. You also gain advantage on saving throws against one condition from the below list against creatures with the same Creature Type as it, based on the CR of the reagent placed within the locket (which can also be changed at dawn).
You only gain these benefits based on the CR of the Reagent placed within the locket for creatures within its CR range or lower, and can only select Conditions based on the Reagents CR.
The Reagent inside the Locket can be replaced by a different reagent, but this consumes the first reagent.

item.name: Lolth Cashmere

customProperties.armorEffects: Lolth Cashmere requires half of the gold cost to Enchant it. Can only be used for Light Armor. While wearing this armor the creature is under the effects of the spider climb spell.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Lolth Cashmere requires half of the gold cost to Enchant it. Lolth Cashmere weapons always deal Slashing damage. If a weapon has Finesse it also gains the Reach property. If it has Reach its reach is increased by 5ft.

item.name: Lysander's Coil
entries: While wearing this magical cloak you take 3 less damage from non-magical sources. In addition, you gain +1 bonus to Survival or Intimidation checks.

This item is part of the {@item Vestments of the Skybreaker|TftJC}. While wearing at least one Vestment you can benefit from a single Vestment without it requiring attunement. If you put on more than one Vestment than they require attunement to function.

item.name: Machine Gun
entries: Belt 20. Upon crafting a Belt fed firearm, you additionally gain 1 Belt. Belt fed firearms can make 2 attacks per attack they can make, but do not add your Dexterity Modifier to the damage. Each subsequent attack made with this weapon in one round receives a -1 to hit. Once a belt is out of ammunition, you can replace and reload the firearm with another loaded belt as an Action. To reload the ammunition in a belt, it requires 1 minute per 10 rounds you are reloading. Belt weapons are prone to jam, and have their misfire score increased by 1.

customProperties.armorEffects: Armor made from this metal reduces Thunder and Lightning damage by 2d4.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Dealing or taking Thunder/Lightning damage causes your weapons reach increases by 5 feet until the end of your next turn.

item.name: Malkin's Fluxbinder
entries: This magical crossbow is fitted with six gemstone lenses at the end of it. Attacks made with this magical weapon have a +2 to their to hit and damage rolls. When fired it deals an additional 1d8 damage depending on the focused gemstone: fire for ruby, acid for emerald, lightning for sapphire, cold for diamond, thunder for quartz, and acid for topaz. Changing the focused lens takes a bonus action.
In addition this crossbow can be used as an arcane focus. When used as an arcane focus you can change the damage of any spell cast through it to the damage type of the currently focused lens.

item.name: Man Catcher
entries: Special. A creature can make a grapple check with the reach of the Man Catcher. On a success the grappler can move and maintain the grapple as long as they remain with the weapon’s reach. If a second creature attempts to grapple a creature you are grappling you can grant them advantage. If three or more Man Catchers are all grappling the same creature, that creature is restrained instead, as long as all three maintain the restraint.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Marked Deck
entries: Simple Invention.

This deck has various small tells to someone with a keen eye, allowing them to use it for deceit. To spot a marked deck, a creature has to make a DC 17 {@skill Investigation} check, and on a success will notice that the deck is marked. For anyone who knows the deck is marked, they have advantage on {@item gaming set (playing cards)|phb} checks made with it.

item.name: Mask of the Bovine
entries: While wearing this mask you have advantage on all charisma checks against bovine creatures, including minotaurs.

item.name: Mechanic's Toolbelt
entries: Simple Invention.

This toolbelt has many heavy duty pockets for on the fly repairs. It can store up to 8 different types of Tools or Kits (Artisan, Gaming, or any item ending in Tools or Kit). You can take out a stored tool once per turn as a Free action, or as an item interaction on the same turn, and if you already have a set of Tools in your hand when you do so, you can store that in the belt as a part of that action.

item.name: Medal of Muscle (Uncommon)
entries: You can squeeze this medal tightly in the palm of your hand as an action. Doing so gives you advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws for 1 hour. Once this property has been used 3 times, it can't be used again, and the medal becomes nonmagical.

item.name: Mentallite

customProperties.armorEffects: You gain resistance to Psychic Damage. Illithids wearing this have advantage on Wisdom Saves. Light and Medium Armor made from this metal uses the wearer's Intelligence instead of Dexterity to calculate AC.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Weapons that Critically hit grant the target vulnerability to Psychic damage for a number of rounds equal to your Prof Bonus. You can use your Intelligence Modifier to calculate your To-Hit and damage bonuses. Illithids using these deal an additional 1d6 psychic damage on a hit.
customProperties.additionalEffects: You can cast Detect Thoughts once per day without using a spell slot.

entries: Runesmithed

entries.name: Properties

Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: 17 INT

Armor Effects: You gain resistance to Psychic Damage. Illithids wearing this have advantage on Wisdom Saves. Light and Medium Armor made from this metal uses the wearer's Intelligence instead of Dexterity to calculate AC.

Weapon Effects: Weapons that Critically hit grant the target vulnerability to Psychic damage for a number of rounds equal to your Prof Bonus. You can use your Intelligence Modifier to calculate your To-Hit and damage bonuses. Illithids using these deal an additional 1d6 psychic damage on a hit.
Additional Effects: -
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Mercurial Sludge

customProperties.forgingConditions: Must be processed using divine alchemy.
customProperties.armorEffects: Heavy Armor is treated as Medium Armor, and Medium armor is treated as Light. Light Armor requires no proficiency to wear. This armor can be absorbed into your body or expunged as a Free Action, allowing you to instantly don or doff it.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Weapon attacks that hit a creature force a DC 17 Con save (poison effect), and on a fail the target suffers 1d6 Necrotic damage at the start of their turn. This lasts for 1 minute, and the target can repeat this saving throw to end the effect early. This weapon can be absorbed into your body or expunged as a Free Action, allowing you to instantly wield or hide it.
customProperties.additionalEffects: You can cast Polymorph on yourself once per day without using a spell slot.

entries: Runesmithed

entries.name: Properties
entries: Base Metal: {@item Devil's Mercury|TftJC}
Required Tool: Alchemist's Supplies
Forging Conditions: Must be processed using divine alchemy.

Armor Effects: Heavy Armor is treated as Medium Armor, and Medium armor is treated as Light. Light Armor requires no proficiency to wear. This armor can be absorbed into your body or expunged as a Free Action, allowing you to instantly don or doff it.

Weapon Effects: Weapon attacks that hit a creature force a DC 17 Con save (poison effect), and on a fail the target suffers 1d6 Necrotic damage at the start of their turn. This lasts for 1 minute, and the target can repeat this saving throw to end the effect early. This weapon can be absorbed into your body or expunged as a Free Action, allowing you to instantly wield or hide it.
Additional Effects: You can cast Polymorph on yourself once per day without using a spell slot.
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Mercury Orb
entries: Orbs are magic items found within Kima-at that can be applied to weapons, foci and armor, each granting unique effects. Orbs have 10 charges, which return at dawn.
You can only use one charge per orb, per turn. Up to 2 Orbs can be placed on a single item, which combines them and grants new effects.
Having 2 orbs on one weapon/armor/foci combines their charges, and allows you to use their abilities interchangeably. Using a Combo effect requires 2 charges spent
Combined Orbs: {@item Static Orb|TftJC} + {@item Toxic Orb|TftJC}

Weapon Effect: Hit creatures take lightning damage on their turn if they cast a spell, with the damage equal to 2x the spell's level. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until they cast a spell of 1st level or higher.
Armor Effect: When you succeed on a saving throw, you can cause the creature/source of the effect to take lightning damage equal to the DC of the saving throw.

Focus Effect: Creatures hit by or who fail a saving throw take lightning damage on their turn if they cast a spell, with the damage equal to 2x the spell's level. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until they cast a spell of 1st level or higher.

item.name: Mere'su'ra Puzzle Box
entries: A Mere'su'ra puzzle box is a cube-shaped container 5 to 6 inches on a side, composed of airtight, interlocking parts made from materials found in the ancient civilization of Mere'su'ra. Most of these boxes are made of gold, though some are crafted from bronze or ivory. Puzzle boxes from Mere'su'ra were typically used as a pass time for scholars and something to keep treasured belongings. An empty puzzle box weighs 3 pounds regardless of the materials used to fashion it.

When an object small enough to fit inside a puzzle box is placed in it, the container magically seals shut around the object, and no magic can force the box open. The sealed box becomes immune to all damage as well. Every Mere'su'ra puzzle box is constructed with a unique means of opening it. The trick to solving the puzzle is always mundane, never magical. Once a creature figures out the trick or sequence of steps needed to open a particular puzzle box, that creature can open the box as an action, allowing access to the box's contents.
Alternatively, a creature that has discovered the trick to the puzzle box may open the box to cast {@spell fortune's favor|EGW} or {@spell time lock|TftJC} once per long rest.

A creature that spends 1 hour holding a puzzle box while trying to open it can make a DC 30 Intelligence (Investigation) check. If the check succeeds, the creature figures out the trick or sequence of steps needed to open the box. If the check fails by 10 or more, the creature must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw, taking {@dice 12d6} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Meteor Hammer
entries: <b><i>Reach.(10ft)<b><i> This weapon adds 10 feet to your reach when you attack with it. This property also determines your reach for opportunity attacks with a reach weapon.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Mirror of Makora
entries: This magical mirror is three feet in diameter and decorated with carvings of monkeys holding the mirror aloft. The mirror is unbreakable and can be used as a shield, granting the wearing +3 AC and advantage on saving throws against spells that deal fire, lightning, radiant, or force damage.

As a bonus action the wielder can throw the shield up to 30 feet at which point it stops, hanging in the air. The wielder can then target the mirror with ranged weapon or spell attacks. When hit, the mirror reflects the attack at a perfect 90 degrees from itself, increasing the damage and the hit of the attack by +1 when it does so and resetting the attack's range. If the attack hit, another mirror is created from the first, also hovering in place. For each subsequent mirror your attack hits, it gains an additional +1 to attack and damage, up to a maximum of +3. You can never have more than three total mirrors at once.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move any number of your active mirrors up to 30 feet. Your main mirror is immune to all damage however the magically created ones are not, having 16 AC and 5 HP with immunity to fire, lightning, radiant, and force damage. When you return the main mirror to yourself, all remaining mirrors shatter and vanish.

item.name: Mooncloud Jelly
entries: Preparation: Requires Cook's Tools to prepare.
Ingredients: x1 Uncommon Aberration Meat
Effect: You have advantage on your next Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throw.

item.name: Moonlight Pendant
entries: This pendant can store moonlight. If left out in the moonlight for 1 hour, it gains a charge. It can hold up to 10 charges at a time. You can expend a charge to be treated as in moonlight for your Lycanthropy.
Additionally, during a full moon, you can now make a DC 17 WIS save to control your cravings.

item.name: Moonspring Skittles
entries: Preparation: Requires Cook's Tools to prepare.
Ingredients: x2 Bubblepod, x1 Common Aberration meat
Effect: You gain a +1 bonus to all Intelligence, Charisma, or Wisdom ability checks.

macro.name: Moonspring Skittles Effect

item.name: Muscle Magazine Vol.
entries: This magazine contains tips, tricks, and hacks for improving ones body and physical form.
Affects the following Jobs: Barkeep, Dock Worker, General Laborer, Guard, Instructor

items: {@item Muscle Magazine Vol. I|TftJC}
{@item Muscle Magazine Vol. II|TftJC}
{@item Muscle Magazine Vol. III|TftJC}
{@item Muscle Magazine Vol. IV|TftJC}

item.name: Muscle Magazine Vol. I
entries: This tome contains tips, tricks, and hacks for improving ones body and physical form.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature an extra {@dice 2d4}’s to an Athletics or Acrobatics check made during downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Barkeep, Dock Worker, General Laborer, Guard, or Instructor Wage Progression by 1
Once this book has been used in this way 2 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

Once this book has been used in this way 3 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Muzzlebreaker
entries: Innovative Invention.
Requires a Firearm with a Long Range
The Firearm's range is reduced to half of its short range (before any other range modifiers), and cannot use its long range. It deals an additional {@dice 1d6} damage on a hit.
Its misfire score is increased by 1.
Tier. This is a Tier 2 Firearm modification.

item.name: Naginata
entries: Special. This weapon only has the reach property when it is being wielded in both hands.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Oiled Ballbearings
entries: Simple Invention.
These ballbearings have been coated in slippery oil. As an Action, you can apply 3 Flasks of Oil to Ball Bearings.

As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level, square area that is 10 feet on a side. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save.

description.chatFlavor: Scatters oiled ballbearings (DC 13 Dex or prone)

macro.name: Scatter Oiled Ballbearings

item.name: Orb of Elvanius
entries: This simple glass icosahedron has intricate etchings inscribed inside the glass. When touched, it glows a soft white.

As an action a creature can attune the orb to either fire, cold, lightning, thunder, or acid. The next time you take that damage type, the orb reduces it by 1d4 and grows stronger. Each successive time it blocks damage the die is increased by 1 step, up to a d6, d8, d10, and d12. Once it reduces the damage by 1d12, it reverts to 1d4.
In addition, while attuned, {@spell Elvinus’ Ward of Conflux|TftJC} is added to your spell list if you have one.

item.name: Penman's Encyclopedia
entries: This book contains space for one to jot down their own notes. The book can be used to record ones thoughts for a total of 40 hours, after which the user can choose 1 skill or tool that they are proficient in and gain a permanent +1 to that skill.
Once used twice the book becomes non-magical.

description.chatFlavor: Your melee attacks deal +1d6 fire damage for 1 minute.

entries: Your hands ignite with flames for the next minute. Your melee attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage on a hit.

item.name: Potion of Foggy Escape

description.chatFlavor: Thrown: Fog Cloud for 1 min. Consumed: Disadvantage on attacks against you until end of next turn.

entries: This swirling potion has strange spiraling grey patterns flowing through it. Drinking or breaking the potion will incur different effects.

Thrown: You can throw the potion bottle up to 20ft. It breaks open, releasing billowing smoke. This creates the effects of the Fog Cloud spell, but is not considered magical and requires no concentration. It lasts for 1 minute.
Consumed: You begin expelling smoke from your mouth, ears, nostrils and eyes. Until the end of your next turn, creatures have disadvantage on attacks they make against you.

item.name: Potion of Past Memory

description.chatFlavor: Peer through another creature's life. See item description for details.

entries: This Deep brown potion is filled with concentrated Memento beans, providing the Drinker a deep connection to Time. Before ingesting the Potion, a hair, nail or other small piece of a creature is to be mixed in with the completed Potion, after which time it glows with Chronurgic Magic. Ingesting the potion allows you to peer through that creature's life. You experience any event they would have from their point of view.

This potion's duration is based on the current amount of time the selected creature's life has lasted. 1 hour is equivalent of 1 year of that creature's life, if the creature has lived for 36 years the potion's effects remain active for 36 hours as you experience their life. Within that time, you are {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened} and {@condition incapacitated}. A creature can resist these effects if they do not want to be under the potion's effects, making a DC 19 INT save, repeating this saving throw each hour that passes or when they take damage. The events are played out backwards, meaning more recent events happen in the first hours, and the beginning of the creature's life happens at the end of the vision. This potion's effects cannot be ended early, unless with a 9th level {@spell Dispel Magic|PHB} or by making the above saving throw. The potion provides no effect to creatures that are dead or undead.

item.name: Potion of Perfection

description.chatFlavor: Gain Perfection for 1 hour. See item description for details.

entries: This potion looks to be made from liquid gold. Drinking this potion grants the creature near Perfection in everything it does. Any d20 roll on a Skill check that is 7 or lower is treated as an 8. Your Proficiency Bonus is treated as 2 Higher. You gain 1 Legendary Resistance, which is lost after the duration runs out.
These effects last for 1 hour. The potion's remaining duration is halved each time you fail a skill check/saving throw.

item.name: Powdered Butterfly Wings
entries: Preparation: Requires Cook's Tools to prepare.
Ingredients: x1 Uncommon Fey Meat, x2 Foggy Leaf.
Effect: You gain a +1 bonus to Charisma saves and can double your proficiency bonus to one Charisma checks. Once you double your proficiency bonus you lose all the bonuses of this meal.

item.name: Prism of the Moon
entries: This crystal prism can be used as an arcane focus. While using it the holder can change the damage type of any cantrip they cast to fire, acid, radiant, poison, cold, lightning, or psychic. Doing so consumes one charge from the prism, which holds up to 7 charges. It regains {@dice 1d4} charges when it spends a night in moonlight.

customProperties.armorEffects: You gain 5 damage reduction to cold damage, and each time you take cold damage, this increases by 1 (to a maximum of 10). This is lost after 1 minute of not taking cold damage.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Each time you take cold damage, this weapon deals an additional 1 cold damage, stacking up to a maximum of 5. This is lost after 1 minute of not taking cold dmg.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Material for +2 Alchemist, Brewers, or Glassblower's Tools (2).

item.name: Propeller Hat
entries: This hat can be activated to grant a fly speed of 15 feet to the wearer until the end of their turn. It takes a bonus action to activate. After being used, roll {@dice 1d20}. On a roll of 1 or 2, the propeller snaps and the hat becomes useless.

item.name: Puck
entries: This brightly colored disk is made of some sort of wondrous material and can bend easily. When inverted it will quickly spring itself back to its normal shape, propelling objects on top of it 30 feet into the air. It is an action to arm the Puck and it detonates whenever someone steps onto it or at the start of your next turn. After being used, roll {@dice 1d20}. On a roll of 1 or 2, the Puck snaps and becomes useless.

item.name: Puzzler's Conchs
entries: These four golden conches and be connected together to for a singular large amulet. While connected together, they can be used to search for secrets. A creature holding it can use an action to expend one charge and cast one of the following spells: {@spell detect magic}, {@spell comprehend languages}, or {@spell find traps}. The conch has 3 charges and regains all of them when you finish a long rest.

The conches can be disconnected, once disconnected a creature speaking through one conch can be heard through every other conch. This lasts for 1 hour, after which the conches need to be reconnected to regain this ability.

item.name: Quickdraw Bandolier
entries: Innovative Invention.
This multi-pouch strap can be worn over the chest. The Bandolier contains 5 front pouches and two back straps.
A back strap can hold a thrown weapon, like a spear or dagger, and the front pouches can hold objects such as potions, caltrops, acid vials and other small handheld trinkets.
Items in the bandolier can be drawn as a free action. Placing an Item in the bandolier uses an Item interaction.
Each Pouch can only contain one type of item but can hold up to 5 lbs.

item.name: Razorwood

customProperties.armorEffects: This material can be used by Druids for armor, and is non magnetic. Razorwood provides excellent resistance to bludgeoning and piercing damage, reducing all bludgeoning and piercing damage taken by 2. However, whenever you take slashing damage you take 1 more slashing damage.
customProperties.weaponEffects: This material can be used by Druids for armor, and is non magnetic. Razorwood weapon's are sharpened by magic. When you cast a spell that effects your weapon or requires a weapon attack as part of it, such as Shillelagh or Booming Blade, the weapon gains a bonus to damage equal to the spells level (minimum 1) until the end of your next turn.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Calligraphers tools made from Razorwood decrease the cost of writing spell scrolls by 5%, both gold and time. One must be proficient in Calligraphers to gain this benefit.

This weapon executes any creature you attack with it that is has remaining hit points equal to or less that your Proficiency Bonus, this value is doubled against Good Aligned Dragons.

item.name: Remedial Powder

description.chatFlavor: As an action, a creature can ingest this powder which heals the creature {@dice 1d4 +1} hit points.

entries: As an action, a creature can ingest this powder which heals the creature {@dice 1d4 + 1} hit points.

item.name: Revolver
entries: Barrel 6. A barrel is a chamber that holds a number of rounds. You can spend a Bonus Action to reload a single round in your barrel.

item.name: Ribbon of Return
entries: You can attach this ribbon to a weapon to grant it the Thrown property. This ribbon takes 1 Minute to apply or remove from a weapon. Once you give the weapon this property, it gains a thrown range of 15/45. Immediately after a thrown attack, the weapon flies back to your hand.

Additionally, this item has 3 charges. When you hit a creature with a thrown weapon attack using this item, you may expand a charge to teleport to a unoccupied space within 5 feet of that creature as a bonus action. Alternatively, you may throw your weapon with this ribbon attached at an unoccupied space withing range. To do so make an attack roll with this weapon. On a 12 or higher, the weapon lands on target, and you may expend a charge to teleport to that location as a bonus action. Otherwise, the weapon returns to your hand. This item regains {@dice 1d3} charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Rifle
entries: Clip 8. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

item.name: Riftgem (Feywilds)
entries: This gemstone is filled with magic from the Feywilds. So long as the portal it is connected to remains open, it remains magical. While attuned, you can use this as an Arcane Focus. Whenever you would cast a spell that expends a spell slot using this as a Focus, you can enhance the spell.

An enhanced spell is upcasted by 1 level. This may cause a Wild Magic Surge. Roll {@dice 1d2}, and on a 2, roll on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} Table. If the result is a spell that normally requires concentration, it doesn’t require concentration in this case; the spell lasts for its full duration.
Additionally, if the spell that was enhanced was an Enchantment spell, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Casting Modifier.
Finally, while within 60ft of the portal this gem is connected to, you gain a +1 to your Armor class and all saving throws.

entries.caption: Wild Magic Surge
rows: Roll on this table at the start of each of your turns for the next minute, ignoring this result on subsequent rolls.
For the next minute, you can see any {@condition invisible} creature if you have line of sight to it.
A {@filter modron|bestiary|source=mm|search=modron} chosen and controlled by the DM appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you, then disappears 1 minute later.
You cast {@spell fireball} as a 3rd-level spell centered on yourself.
You cast {@spell magic missile} as a 5th-level spell.
Roll a {@dice d10}. Your height changes by a number of inches equal to the roll. If the roll is odd, you shrink. If the roll is even, you grow.
You cast {@spell confusion} centered on yourself.
For the next minute, you regain 5 hit points at the start of each of your turns.
You grow a long beard made of feathers that remains until you sneeze, at which point the feathers explode out from your face.
You cast {@spell grease} centered on yourself.
Creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against the next spell you cast in the next minute that involves a saving throw.
Your skin turns a vibrant shade of blue. A {@spell remove curse} spell can end this effect.
An eye appears on your forehead for the next minute. During that time, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.
For the next minute, all your spells with a casting time of 1 action have a casting time of 1 bonus action.
You teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see.
You are transported to the Astral Plane until the end of your next turn, after which time you return to the space you previously occupied or the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
Maximize the damage of the next damaging spell you cast within the next minute.
Roll a {@dice d10}. Your age changes by a number of years equal to the roll. If the roll is odd, you get younger (minimum 1 year old). If the roll is even, you get older.
{@dice 1d6} {@creature flumph||flumphs} controlled by the DM appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of you and are {@condition frightened} of you. They vanish after 1 minute.

You turn into a potted plant until the start of your next turn. While a plant, you are {@condition incapacitated} and have vulnerability to all damage. If you drop to 0 hit points, your pot breaks, and your form reverts.
For the next minute, you can teleport up to 20 feet as a bonus action on each of your turns.
A {@creature unicorn} controlled by the DM appears in a space within 5 feet of you, then disappears 1 minute later.
You can't speak for the next minute. Whenever you try, pink bubbles float out of your mouth.
A spectral shield hovers near you for the next minute, granting you a +2 bonus to AC and immunity to {@spell magic missile}.
You are immune to being intoxicated by alcohol for the next {@dice 5d6} days.
Your hair falls out but grows back within 24 hours.
For the next minute, any flammable object you touch that isn't being worn or carried by another creature bursts into flame.
You regain your lowest-level expended spell slot.
For the next minute, you must shout when you speak.
You cast {@spell fog cloud} centered on yourself.
Up to three creatures you choose within 30 feet of you take {@damage 4d10} lightning damage.
You are {@condition frightened} by the nearest creature until the end of your next turn.
Each creature within 30 feet of you becomes {@condition invisible} for the next minute. The invisibility ends on a creature when it attacks or casts a spell.
You gain resistance to all damage for the next minute.
A random creature within 60 feet of you becomes {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 1d4} hours.
You glow with bright light in a 30-foot radius for the next minute. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of you is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.
You cast {@spell polymorph} on yourself. If you fail the saving throw, you turn into a sheep for the spell's duration.
Illusory butterflies and flower petals flutter in the air within 10 feet of you for the next minute.
You can take one additional action immediately.
Each creature within 30 feet of you takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage. You regain hit points equal to the sum of the necrotic damage dealt.
You cast {@spell fly} on a random creature within 60 feet of you.
You become {@condition invisible} for the next minute. During that time, other creatures can't hear you. The invisibility ends if you attack or cast a spell.
If you die within the next minute, you immediately come back to life as if by the {@spell reincarnate} spell.
Your size increases by one size category for the next minute.
You and all creatures within 30 feet of you gain vulnerability to piercing damage for the next minute.
You are surrounded by faint, ethereal music for the next minute.
You regain all expended sorcery points.

item.name: Riftgem (Plane of Fire)
entries: This gemstone is filled with magic from the Plane of Fire. So long as the portal it is connected to remains open, it remains magical. While attuned, you can use this as an Arcane Focus. You ignore Resistance to Fire Damage when dealing Fire Damage with a Spell cast through the Riftgem. Additionally, whenever you cast a spell that expends a spell slot through the Riftgem that would deal Fire Damage, you can have it Burst.

A Spell that Bursts deals additional Fire damage to all creatures within 5ft of those who were affected by the spell. This damage equals {@dice 1d6} for spells of 1st-2nd level, {@dice 2d6} for spells of 3rd-4th level, {@dice 3d6} for spells of 5th-6th level, {@dice 4d6} for spells of 7th-8th level, and {@dice 5d6} for spells of 9th level.
Finally, while within 60ft of the portal this gem is connected to, you gain resistance to Fire Damage.

item.name: Ring of *Splat*
entries: “You wanna piece of me?”
A ring that smells of rich cinnamon and sweet fruit, creating a unique scent that encapsulates the wearer, confusing creatures that rely on scent.

As a bonus action, the wearer of the ring can conjure a ghostly pie and attempt to smash it in the face of a creature within melee range (improvised weapon attack). On a hit, the pie explodes in the creature’s face, blinding them for one turn and dealing {@dice 1d4} force damage. If the attack misses and there’s a creature directly behind the original target, another attack is made against this new target.
The Ring of *Splat* contains five charges and regains {@dice 1d4} charges every day at dawn.
Ghost pie can only be eaten by ghosts. It goes well with ghost vanilla ice cream.

item.name: Road Syrup
entries: Preparation: Requires Cook's Tools to prepare.
Ingredients: X1 Common Meat, x1 Remedial Herb.
Effect: When you travel you can travel 50% longer before suffering any ill effects.

item.name: Road Tack

Ingredients: x1 Common meat, x2 Hiker's Bounty.
Effect: Road Tack prepares eight meals worth. A character that eats Road Tack is filled for the day.

customProperties.armorEffects: When under 25% of your maximum Hit Points, you gain a +3 to your armor class, and gain 3 temporary hit points at the start of your turn as long as you have at least 1 hit point.
customProperties.weaponEffects: When under 25% of your maximum Hit Points, you gain a +3 to damage rolls with this weapon and heal for the bonus damage dealt.

entries: Runesmithed

entries.name: Properties
entries: Base Metal: ???
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: Reduce your Max HP by 10% for 1 Month.
Armor Effects: When under 25% of your maximum Hit Points, you gain a +3 to your armor class, and gain 3 temporary hit points at the start of your turn as long as you have at least 1 hit point.
Weapon Effects: When under 25% of your maximum Hit Points, you gain a +3 to damage rolls with this weapon and heal for the bonus damage dealt.
Additional Effects:
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Sanguinity
entries: This tarnished, silvered bracer slides with ease onto any wrist. The bracer is made of Devil’s Mercury inlaid with Bloodsteel. No matter what form of bracer, it always retains an intricate design depicting a well crafted yet horrifying visage of the arts of Sanguine Alchemy.
This bracer punctures into the vital vein of the wearer, using their life essence to power its alchemy. Upon attuning to this item, a creature takes 5 points of piercing damage.
Once attuned, the wearer gains these following traits:

items: Clotted Regeneration: At the start of your turn, you can expend a use of your Hit Dice to gain Temporary HP equal to the amount rolled

Crimson Strike: As a bonus action, you can expend a number of hit dice equal to your level to add to the damage of your next attack (weapon or spell). When you expend these hit dice, roll half the amount of those dice (rounded up) and you take piercing damage equal to the number rolled. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.
Blood Shield: When you are hit with an attack, you can use your reaction to expend a Hit Dice and increase your AC by the amount rolled against that instance of attack.

Eldritch Claret: As an Action, you can expend an amount of Hit Dice equal to the highest Spell Slot you are able to cast, you then regain a spell slot equal to the amount of hit dice you expend. When you expend these Hit Dice, roll half of the amount expended (rounded up), and take piercing damage equal to the amount rolled. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

entries: Curse: Sanguinity is a cursed item. When a creature attunes to this bracer, they are unable to remove it unless a DC 20 Medicine Check is met as well as a cast of the {@spell Remove Curse} spell.

While the creature is attuned to the bracer, once every two weeks they must roll a DC 14 Wisdom Saving throw or become Blood Starved. While Blood Starved, the creature gains 1 point of exhaustion for every week they do not consume the blood from one humanoid creature (other than yourself). The amount of blood to consume must equal one or more pints.
By drinking blood, you are no longer Blood Starved. If you fail this save again without drinking blood, this effect stacks

item.name: Sash of Doluna
entries: Whenever you cast a spell that deals cold damage or restores hit points roll {@dice 1d12} and add it to the damage or healing. In addition, you gain resistance to cold damage, if you already have resistance you gain immunity, if you already have immunity cold damage instead heals you for half the damage dealt.
You gain a swim speed equal to 120 feet and can breathe underwater.

Curse. You require 12x as much water as others. If you go more than 4 hours without drinking at least 1 liter of water, you have disadvantage on all Strength and Constitution saving throws and ability checks until you drink and if you take fire damage you have disadvantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws and ability checks until the end of your next turn.

Form of the Tides As an action, you can set loose the spirit contained within the scarf to fight alongside you. The spirit takes on the form of an Elemental from the following list: {@creature Water Elemental Myrmidon|MPMM}, {@creature Giant Shark|MM|Giant Shark (type Elemental)}, or {@creature Water Elemental|MM}.
While the spirit is active and has more than 0 hit points, you gain the following benefits:

items: Creature that receive healing from you gain temporary hit points equal to the amount healed. While they have these temporary hit points creatures that damage those creatures suffer 5 cold damage if they are within 5ft of the damaged creature.

Whenever you cast a spell that deals cold damage, the surrounding area grows frigid. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or have their movement speed halved and suffer cold damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

When you restore hit points to a creature, you can also end one of the following conditions on that creature: {@condition poisoned}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition prone}, or {@condition stunned}.

entries: When the spirit drops to 0 hit points or 1 hour passes, it vanishes, and you lose the benefits listed above. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again for 90 days. As an action, you can cast a 5th level or higher spell that deals cold damage into the Sash to lower the time to wait by 1 day.

item.name: Satchel of Shinier Bait
entries: A small pouch containing Morenstar Lake's new special Shinier Bait, a glimmering gem-like item that has little value by itself, but is easily confused as valuable to the casual observer.

As a bonus action, a creature can remove one piece of bait and throw it up to 30 feet away. Alternatively, they can use their bonus action to attach it to a piece of ammunition, due to the Shinier Bait's higher durability.

If it lands within 30 feet of another creature, that creature must make a DC15 Wisdom saving throw at the start of their next turn. Beasts have disadvantage on this saving throw. On a fail, they must move up to their speed towards the bait and pick it up. The creature is not compelled to move in a way that obviously endangers them; for instance, over a cliff or through a known hazard. If the creature picks it up, succeeds on their saving throw, or if the bait is unreachable, they immediately discern it as a worthless item and are immune to this effect until the next dawn.
The bag contains up to 5 pieces of bait. {@dice 1d4+1} pieces of bait reappear in the bag each day at dawn.

item.name: Sawmace (Trick Weapon)
entries: Complex Invention.

This heavy {@item mace|PHB} and {@item shield|PHB} are built to slot together. In mace form it deals {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage as a one-handed weapon with shield, while in saw form it deals {@dice 1d12} slashing damage as a two-handed weapon. When a creature deals maximum damage on the {@dice d12} damage die in saw form, they can use their reaction to rev the sawblade, dealing an additional {@dice 1d12} slashing damage.

entries.name: Mace Form
entries: {@dice 1d6} Bludgeoning, Heavy
Functions as both a {@item mace|PHB} ({@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage) and {@item shield|PHB} when wielded together, granting a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Saw Form
entries: {@dice 1d12} Slashing, Two-handed, Heavy, Special
When you roll maximum damage on the {@dice d12} slashing damage die, you can use your reaction to rev the sawblade, dealing an additional {@dice 1d12} slashing damage.

item.name: Scintillating Orb
entries: Orbs are magic items found within Kima-at that can be applied to weapons, foci and armor, each granting unique effects. Orbs have 10 charges, which return at dawn.
You can only use one charge per orb, per turn. Up to 2 Orbs can be placed on a single item, which combines them and grants new effects.
Having 2 orbs on one weapon/armor/foci combines their charges, and allows you to use their abilities interchangeably. Using a Combo effect requires 2 charges spent
Combined Orbs: {@item Flaming Orb|TftJC} + {@item Bright Orb|TftJC}
Weapon Effect: Hit creatures have any {@condition Radiance|TftJC} doubled.
Armor Effect: You can end the Blinded Condition on yourself, and gain a +5 to Perception/Investigation checks for 1 minute.
Focus Effect: Creatures hit by or who fail a saving throw have any {@condition Radiance|TftJC} doubled.

item.name: Scope MK I
entries: Simple Invention.

the basic version of the scope is an attachment that can pe built and placed on a ranged weapon that allows the wielder to use a spyglass wile still holding the weapon (so the spyglass uses no hands) and can be used in tandem with the weapon to see far away targets

item.name: Sending Stones (Rare)
entries: Sending stones come in pairs, with each smooth stone carved to match the other so the pairing is easily recognized. While you touch one stone, you can use an action to cast the {@spell sending} spell from it. The target is the bearer of the other stone. If no creature bears the other stone, you know that fact as soon as you use the stone and don't cast the spell.
You can cast {@spell sending} through the stones 3 times until they can't be used again until the next dawn. If one of the stones in a pair is destroyed, the other one becomes nonmagical.

item.name: Shackles of Cavalkal
entries: You gain proficiency in Athletics, if you already have proficiency you gain expertise, if you already have expertise you gain a +3 to the check. When you make an Athletics check or force a creature to make a Strength saving throw to grapple or move a creature, you have advantage on the roll.
If you do not spend any movement on your turn your AC increases by 1 and you gain advantage on any checks or saving throws against effects that would move you.

When you force a creature to move through an attack or spell they move an additional 15ft and take {@dice 3d6} Bludgeoning damage. In addition, if the creature has a fly speed that speed is reduced to 0 until the start of their next turn.

entries.name: Cursed
entries: The heavy gauntlets weigh you down, your speed is decreased by 15ft in all forms. In addition, if you fall, you fall 2400 feet on your turn instead of 60 feet and take double falling damage.

entries.name: Form of the Mountain
entries: As an action, you can set loose the spirit contained within the shackles to fight alongside you. The spirit takes on the form of an Elemental from the following list: Earth Elemental Myrmidon, Xorn, Dust Hulk, or Earth Elemental.
While the spirit is active and has more than 0 hit points, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain resistance to bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage.
If you deal bludgeoning damage to a creature you can also move them 5ft, this can effect a creature only once a turn.
When a creature attempts to move you through any effect, it fails and the other creature suffers the movement instead, if applicable.

entries: When the spirit drops to 0 hit points or 1 hour passes, it vanishes, and you lose the benefits listed above. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again for 90 days. As an action, you can cast a 5th level or higher spell that deals piercing, bludgeoning, or slashing damage into the Shackles to lower the time to wait by 1 day.

item.name: Shade Goggles
entries: Simple Invention.
While wearing these Goggles, the strain of bright lights is diminished. Creatures with Sunlight Sensitivity and Sunlight Sickness no longer have the negative effects of sunlight affect their vision.

Additionally, creatures with Sunlight Sensitivity and Sunlight Sickness that wear these goggles during the day have a Brightvision now, with a range of 60ft. This acts the same way Darkvision allows creatures to see in darkness, but works for Sunlight instead. Seeing beyond your Brightvision incurs the same negative effects as detailed in your Sunlight Sickness or Sunlight Sensitivity.

item.name: Shard of Illumina
entries: This 1-foot-long shard of gold has veins of silver and platinum along its surface.
Empowered Magic. While holding this shard, you can use it as a spellcasting focus, and it gives a +1 bonus to your spell attack rolls.
Enhanced Intelligence. Your Intelligence score increases by 2 while the shard is on your person. The shard can't raise your Intelligence score above 22.
Curse. Attuning to this item extends it curse to you. You remain cursed until you are targeted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.
The shard's curse causes misfortune to befall you. When you roll 1 on an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, roll on the Shard Misfortunes table to determine your misfortune.

entries.caption: Shard Misfortunes table
rows: You accidentally cut yourself with the shard and are {@condition poisoned} until the next dawn.
You experience a vision of an ancient calamity—a beautiful city threatened by crumbling mountains and erupting volcanoes—and are {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.
For a few seconds, the ground shakes under you. You and each creature within 10 feet of you must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

The shard releases four glowing darts of magical force that target one random creature within 30 feet of you. If no such target exists, you become the target. Each dart hits automatically and deals 3 ({@dice 1d4 + 1}) force damage to the target.
Until the next dawn, you have -1 to all saving throws.
Nothing seems to go your way. Until the next dawn, you have disadvantage on ability checks.

item.name: Shell Blades
entries: Paired. Paired weapons has special features that only activate when you are wielding two of the same weapon with the paired property.
These blades have a heavily guarded hilt that protects the forearms of its wielder. While wielding two of these blades you gain a +1 to AC.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Shiverspike
entries: You gain a +1 to attack rolls and damage rolls with this weapon.

Whenever you would take or deal Cold damage, you gain Temporary Hit points equal to your Proficiency Bonus, as Ice crystals coalesce around you. Whenever you would hit a creature this weapon, you can remove any Temporary Hit points you have to cause the attack to deal additional cold damage equal to the temporary hit points removed.

item.name: Shotgun
entries: Loud Loud weapons produce more noise than the average firearm, which may attract or scare other creatures from distances up to 300ft away.

Pump 2. A pump ammo system stores a number of shots directly in the gun. You can reload the barrel with up to 2 slugs as a Bonus Action. Before making an attack with a pump weapon that has more than 1 pump, you can choose to fire up to two shots as a part of the same attack. The first target takes additional damage equal to the weapon's damage die. Pump firearms require a strength score of 13 to reload properly, without this reloading the Firearm is an Action.

item.name: Shuang Gou
entries: Paired. Paired weapons has special features that only activate when you are wielding two of the same weapon with the paired property.
When you are wielding two Shuang Gou you are considered to have reach.
If you use the reach property you can’t make an offhand attack that turn.
Additionally, you have advantage on attack rolls made to disarm opponents if you are wielding two Shuang Gou.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

customProperties.weaponEffects: Bypasses some damage resistances.

customProperties.weaponEffects: Thrown and Ranged weapons do not pose disadvantage at their long range, and have advantage to hit flying targets while in their normal range. Skaier always hovers an inch off earth.
