item.name: Sky Steel

customProperties.armorEffects: Sky Steel always hovers a foot off earth. While flying, your speed is increased by 30. You are immune to effects that would ground you or otherwise force or the effects of strong winds. In addition, you gain a hover speed of 5 feet and do not fall if knocked prone while flying.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Thrown and Ranged weapons do not pose disadvantage at their long range, and both ranges increased by 30, and have advantage to hit flying targets. Sky Steel always hovers a foot off earth.

entries: Runesmithed

entries.name: Properties
entries: Base Metal: {@item Skaier|TftJC}
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: 3rd Lvl Air Spell

Armor Effects: Sky Steel always hovers a foot off earth. While flying, your speed is increased by 30. You are immune to effects that would ground you or otherwise force or the effects of strong winds. In addition, you gain a hover speed of 5 feet and do not fall if knocked prone while flying.

Weapon Effects: Thrown and Ranged weapons do not pose disadvantage at their long range, and both ranges increased by 30, and have advantage to hit flying targets. Sky Steel always hovers a foot off earth.
Additional Effects: -
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Skybreaker's Ring
entries: While wearing this simple brass ring your Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution increases by 1. Removing and putting the ring back on allows you to change the bonus gained. This item only has an effect if you are wearing at least one other vestment.

This item is part of the {@item Vestments of the Skybreaker|TftJC}. While wearing at least one Vestment you can benefit from a single Vestment without it requiring attunement. If you put on more than one Vestment than they require attunement to function.

item.name: Slingsword
entries: Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Slippers of Hopping
entries: Fluffy and warm, these slippers add 10 feet to the base jump distance of the wearer, even from a standing position. Additionally, they grant the user +1 to all acrobatics checks.

Good Hare Day. Once per day, the wearer of the Slippers of Hopping may boop the noses of their footwear as a bonus action. When this happens, wearer casts Jump upon themselves and triples their jump distance for one minute. For the duration, long rabbit-like ears sprout from the head of the wearer, though the ears may be slicked back if the wearer has a receding hareline. Additionally, every jump is accompanied by a loud “BOING”!
Unfortunately, while wearing the Slippers of Hopping, the user is compelled to do the embarrassing action that bunnies are known for...twitch their nose.

item.name: Sniper Rifle
entries: Clip 6. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

item.name: Soulbane
entries: This Soul Steel dagger has destroyed the souls of heroes and Dragonlords alike. Attacks made with this weapon have a +3 to hit and damage rolls.

This dagger has 10 charges. When you hit with a melee attack using it, you can expend up to 3 of its charges. For each charge you expend, the targets takes an additional {@dice 1d6} force damage. The dagger regains {@dice 1d6+4} charges daily at dawn. Whenever you instantly kill a target with this blade it regains 3 charges.
While wielding this dagger you can use the Crimson Slash weapon form.

entries.name: Crimson Slash
entries: By grasping your weapon with both hands, you can use an action to place all your strength on a final gambit against your opponent. If you have advantage on the attack roll, you can attempt to end them in one strike. Make an attack roll without advantage, if the attack hits instead of taking damage, your opponent must make a Constitution saving throw with a +1 for every 10 hit points they have left. If they roll lower than your attack roll, they die instantly. Should they pass the saving throw, you gain one level of exhaustion and an additional level for every 5 above the check they passed.

customProperties.forgingConditions: Must be forged by someone with a total of 50+ points between INT, WIS and CHA.
customProperties.armorEffects: Soulsteel armor protects the wearing from instant death. If you are wearing soulsteel you are immune to effects that would instantly kill you, such a power word kill or finger of death. Soulsteel can only be made into armor and give no benefits as a shield.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Soulsteel weapons obliterate the slain's soul. A creature killed by a soulsteel weapon cannot be revived through any means short of the wish spell. Likewise, spells that influence the souls after death, such as soul cage, soul jar, or speak with dead do not work on a creature killed with a Soulsteel weapon

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Shadowfell
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: Must be forged by someone with a total of 50+ points between INT, WIS and CHA.

Armor Effects: Soulsteel armor protects the wearing from instant death. If you are wearing soulsteel you are immune to effects that would instantly kill you, such a power word kill or finger of death. Soulsteel can only be made into armor and give no benefits as a shield.

Weapon Effects: Soulsteel weapons obliterate the slain's soul. A creature killed by a soulsteel weapon cannot be revived through any means short of the wish spell. Likewise, spells that influence the souls after death, such as soul cage, soul jar, or speak with dead do not work on a creature killed with a Soulsteel weapon
Additional Effects: -
Runesmithing: X
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Spear of Thassa
item.reqAttune: by a follower of a Thassa
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you hurl it and speak its command word, it transforms into a torrent of water, forming a line 5 feet wide that extends out from you to a target within 120 feet. Each creature in the line excluding you and the target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 4d6} cold damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The torrent  turns back into a spear when it reaches the target. Make a ranged weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes damage from the spear plus {@dice 4d6} cold damage. This ability does an additional {@dice 2d6} cold damage when used underwater.
The spear’s property can't be used again until the next dawn. In the meantime, the spear can still be used as a magic weapon.
The Spear retains all properties from its Staff Form.

customProperties.armorEffects: At the End of your turn, roll 1d6. On a 6, you enter the Ethereal Realm. This lasts until the start or end of your next turn (your choice).
customProperties.weaponEffects: The weapon deals an additional 3 Lightning Damage to partially corporeal or incorporeal creatures, and can hit incorporeal creatures.
customProperties.additionalEffects: When Planeshifting and wielding/wearing this metal, there is a 5% chance to instead enter the Ethereal Plane instead of your intended plane.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Material
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Secondary Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: ?
Base Metals: {@item Copper|TftJC} + {@item Ghost Steel|TftJC}
Armor Effects: At the End of your turn, roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 6, you enter the Ethereal Realm. This lasts until the start or end of your next turn (your choice).
Weapon Effects: The weapon deals an additional 3 Lightning Damage to partially corporeal or incorporeal creatures, and can hit incorporeal creatures.
Additional Effects: When Planeshifting and wielding/wearing this metal, there is a 5% chance to instead enter the Ethereal Plane instead of your intended plane.
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Stabilized Uranium

customProperties.forgingConditions: Attempting to forge/smelt/refine Stabilized Uranium causes the forger to take Necrotic Damage equal to their Tools check x5. If this reduces the forger to 0 hit points, their body turns to ash.
customProperties.armorEffects: Cannot be crafted into a shield or Light armor. While wearing this armor, your maximum Hit points are Reduced by 25, and are reduced by another 25 for each consecutive week of use (these hit points return after a week without wearing the armor). You gain Immunity to Poison, Acid and Necrotic Damage. If you would take over 20 points of Thunder/Fire Damage, all creatures within 10ft of you (not including yourself) must make a DC 19 CON Save or have their Maximum Hit points reduced by the same amount. If this effect would kill a creature, they turn to ash.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Cannot be made into Ammunition or Light Weapons. While wielding this weapon, your Maximum hit points are reduced by 13, and are reduced by another 13 for each consecutive week of use (these hit points return after a week without wielding the weapon). This weapon doubles the effectiveness of any enchantment that increases its to hit and damage roll bonus (up to a +6). On a hit, this weapon reduces a creatures maximum hit points by half of the damage it dealt (bludgeoning/piercing/slashing only). Creatures killed by this weapon turn to ash.

entries: Runesmithed

entries.name: Properties
entries: Base Metal: {@item Unstable Uranium|TftJC}
Required Tool: Alchemist's Supplies

Forging Conditions: Attempting to forge/smelt/refine Stabilized Uranium causes the forger to take Necrotic Damage equal to their Tools check x5. If this reduces the forger to 0 hit points, their body turns to ash.

Armor Effects: Cannot be crafted into a shield or Light armor. While wearing this armor, your maximum Hit points are Reduced by 25, and are reduced by another 25 for each consecutive week of use (these hit points return after a week without wearing the armor). You gain Immunity to Poison, Acid and Necrotic Damage. If you would take over 20 points of Thunder/Fire Damage, all creatures within 10ft of you (not including yourself) must make a DC 19 CON Save or have their Maximum Hit points reduced by the same amount. If this effect would kill a creature, they turn to ash.

Weapon Effects: Cannot be made into Ammunition or Light Weapons. While wielding this weapon, your Maximum hit points are reduced by 13, and are reduced by another 13 for each consecutive week of use (these hit points return after a week without wielding the weapon). This weapon doubles the effectiveness of any enchantment that increases its to hit and damage roll bonus (up to a +6). On a hit, this weapon reduces a creatures maximum hit points by half of the damage it dealt (bludgeoning/piercing/slashing only). Creatures killed by this weapon turn to ash.
Additional Effects:
Druid Useable: Yes

item.name: Staff of Arachnid Domination
entries: The staff allows the wielder to control arachnids, such as spiders and ettercaps, within a certain range.

While holding the staff, the wielder can use an action target to any arachnid within 60 feet. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw against a DC of 15 or be charmed by the wielder for 1 hour. The wielder can use their bonus action on subsequent rounds to maintain control over the charmed creature, causing it to take any actions they desire.

Additionally, once per day, Target up to three creatures within 60 feet. The affected creatures must make a Wisdom saving throw against a DC of 15 or be magically {@condition restrained} for 1 minute while they struggle to untangle themselves from the web of lies and deceit. The affected creatures can make the save again at the end of their turn.
While attuned to the staff, the wielder gains resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws against poison effects.

item.name: Static Orb
entries: Orbs are magic items found within Kima-at that can be applied to weapons, foci and armor, each granting unique effects. Orbs have 10 charges, which return at dawn.
You can only use one charge per orb, per turn. Up to 2 Orbs can be placed on a single item, which combines them and grants new effects.
Having 2 orbs on one weapon/armor/foci combines their charges, and allows you to use their abilities interchangeably. Using a Combo effect requires 2 charges spent
Weapon Effect: Hitting a creature successfully with a weapon grants 1 {@condition Charged|TftJC}.
Armor Effect: -2 Lightning Damage, when you take lightning damage you can spend a charge to gain a stack of Charged.
Focus Effect: Hitting a creature successfully with a weapon grants 1 Charged, or 2 if the spell cast matches the Orb's element.

item.name: Storming Orb
entries: Orbs are magic items found within Kima-at that can be applied to weapons, foci and armor, each granting unique effects. Orbs have 10 charges, which return at dawn.
You can only use one charge per orb, per turn. Up to 2 Orbs can be placed on a single item, which combines them and grants new effects.
Having 2 orbs on one weapon/armor/foci combines their charges, and allows you to use their abilities interchangeably. Using a Combo effect requires 2 charges spent
Combined Orbs: {@item Chilling Orb|TftJC} + {@item Static Orb|TftJC}
Weapon Effect: Hit creatures have disadvantage on DEX saves until the end of your next turn.
Armor Effect: If you would lose Concentration on a Spell from damage, you can remake the Concentration saving throw with a +5.
Focus Effect: Creatures hit by or who fail a saving throw have disadvantage on DEX saves until the end of your next turn.

item.name: Sword of Hate
entries: This simple longsword has embedded in its hilt a rough hew red crystal. The Sword of Hate is a magical longsword, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

Whenever you have the choice to spar someone, choose mercy, or forgive someone, the sword whispers hateful things into your mind. If you still choose the merciful option, you must give the blade one hit die, which reduces your maximum hit dice by the same amount. If you choose to listen to the blade, the blade gains a stack of Malice. If you have no hit dice left, you cannot resist the blade and must choose the most violent option. At certain amounts of Malice the blade gains more abilities.
2 - The weapon bonus increases to a +2.
4 - The weapon bonus increases to a +3.
6 - The weapon’s critical range is increased by 1.
8 - The weapon deals an additional 1d8 (1d10 if held in two hands) slashing damage.

To regain hit dice consumed by the blade, you must cast a remove curse or similar spell on the blade. Each time this is cast, you regain one lost hit die. The creature casting the remove curse (or similar spell) must make a DC 13 + the number of held hit dice Charisma saving throw or have their alignment shifted down by one row, if it is already evil it is shifted one towards chaotic, if they are already chaotic evil                                                 .
The blade can hold a total of 20 hit dice.

item.name: Tamer's Feed
entries: Preparation: Requires Cook's Tools to prepare.
Ingredients: x1 Trailvine, x1 Common Meat.

Effect: Can only be fed to a creature with an intelligence of 3 or lower. When fed as an action it gives them disadvantage on checks to resist being charmed. When used in downtime, it grants a +1 bonus to the taming/training roll.

item.name: Tectonium
entries: Runesmithed

entries.name: Properties
entries: Base Metal: {@item Gravinite|TftJC}
Required Tool: Mason's Tools
Forging Conditions: 17 CON
Armor Effects: ???
Weapon Effects: ???
Additional Effects: ???
Druid Useable: Yes

item.name: Temporal Stabilizer
entries: Groundbreaking Invention.
Requires Tinkers Tools + 1 Tinker's Brass + 1 Absintium

This bracer allows the wearer to stabilize themselves in Time. Using the innate power within the Absintium, the wearer becomes immune to spells and magical effects that alter ones time, perception of time, or placement within time (Chronurgy magic, as well as spells such as Haste, Slow, Memento Poison, etc). The Bracer is considered magical, and can be dispelled by casting Dispel magic at 7th level or higher, removing its effects for 1 hour, as well as Anti Magic Fields nullify this effect.

Additionally, the Absintium can attune itself to a Time Rift within 30ft of it after completing a 10 minute ritual. The Absintium is then Entangled with the Time Rift, allowing the wearer to pass through at a predetermined point of their choosing. After which, the Time Rift creates a passageway from that point to the present, and that point cannot be changed. Time that passes within the present passes concurrently in the determined point for 1 year, after which time the Absintium is fully consumed and the Entanglement ends. Any and all changes within time happen simultaneously at once after the year ends.

customProperties.armorEffects: You gain resistance to Bludgeoning Damage. You have advantage on ability checks against being shoved, or athletics checks you make to end a grapple.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Critical hits made with this weapon add an additional die of weapon damage.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Earth
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: Enchanted Tools, Magnetic Sphere Spell
Armor Effects: You gain resistance to Bludgeoning Damage. You have advantage on ability checks against being shoved, or athletics checks you make to end a grapple.
Weapon Effects: Critical hits made with this weapon add an additional die of weapon damage.
Additional Effects: -
Runesmithing: X
Druid Useable: No

item.name: The Bunker Buster
entries: Groundbreaking Invention.

This 5ft x 5ft sphere contains enough firepower in it to level a town.  It weighs 75lbs and has large metal handles on the sides for easier carrying. It has an AC of 20, 100 hit points (immune to psychic/necrotic/poison, resist non-magical weapon damage). If its hit points drop to 0 it begins detonation (this does not expose the core, meaning it cannot be disarmed).
Detonation:

As an Action, a creature next to it can make a DC 15 Tinkers Tools check with INT to prepare it for detonation. The Bunker Buster then opens up to reveal a large core charged with arcane energy. Attacking the core in this state with a melee weapon that deals 20+ damage causes it to immediately detonate (AC 15, retaining same resistances and immunities). Otherwise, the core will detonate in 1 minute after the Detonation procedure begins.
Explosion:

When the core explodes, it emits a shockwave in a 300ft radius. Creatures must make a DC 19 Dexterity Saving Throw or take 25d8 Force Damage. Creatures within 100ft of it that are not behind full cover automatically fail the saving throw. The damage dealt by this explosion is doubled against structures. If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by this damage, for every 40 damage over their current hit points they took by this explosion causes them to fail 1 death saving throw (normal rules for death saving throws still apply). Creatures that die to this damage are turned to ash.
Disarming:

While the core is exposed, a creature can use an Action to attempt to disarm it. They must make 3 successful DC 20 Tinkers Tools check with INT. Failing this check causes the bomb's timer to speed up by 1d6 rounds (rolled by the DM and kept private).

item.name: The Dashers of Elitanith
entries: Your movement speed increases by 20 feet and you gain a fly speed equal to your speed. In addition, your speed cannot be reduced lower than 20 feet (unless it is reduced to 0).

entries.name: Stride of the Free
entries: You can use a bonus action on your turn to disengage. Once per turn, when you are suffering from the Grapple, Restrained, or Prone condition you can spend 5 feet of movement to end the condition. When you do this each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you must make a DC 15 Str save or be knocked back 15 feet.

entries.name: Cursed
entries: If you do not move your full movement on your turn you suffer {@dice 8d4} slashing damage as the agitated wind attacks you.

entries.name: Form of the Gales
entries: As an action, you can set loose the spirit contained within the boots to fight alongside you. The spirit takes on the form of an Elemental from the following list: Air Elemental Myrmidon, Invisible Stalker, Animated Breath, or Air Elemental.
While the spirit is active and has more than 0 hit points, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain immunity to lightning and thunder damage

Your speed increases to 120 ft if its lower and cannot be lowered (unless it is reduced to 0), your fly speed likewise increases to the same amount. You do not provoke attacks of opportunity for moving.
When you cast a spell that deals lightning or thunder damage, you may reroll any 1s or 2s rolled on the damage and take the higher result.

entries: When the spirit drops to 0 hit points or 1 hour passes, it vanishes, and you lose the benefits listed above. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again for 90 days. As an action, you can cast a 5th level or higher spell that deals lightning and thunder damage into the Dashers to lower the time to wait by 1 day.

item.name: The Forbidden Foci
entries: This skull is emboldened with the most ancient forms of magic. When used as an Arcane Focus, you gain a +2 to spell attack rolls and your Spell Save DC, this bonus is doubled for the Forbidden Spell. The Forbidden Spell is immune to Antimagic Fields, and checks to counterspell it/dispel it have disadvantage.

Upon finishing a Long rest, the Forbidden Spell can be wholly modified. You can change the School of Magic the Forbidden spell is considered, and depending on its school, it gains access to a new Arcana option which is always applied to it and does not count against the number that can typically be applied to it. Casting the Forbidden Spell at 6th level or higher allows you to instantly change the Spell School it is considered, but you cannot add the new Arcana type to that casting.

entries.name: Abjuration
entries: You gain resistance to 2 random damage types (roll 2d10, 1 - Cold, 2 - Fire, 3 - Lightning, 4 - Thunder, 5 - Poison, 6 - Acid, 7 - Radiant, 8 - Necrotic, 9 - Force, 10 - Psychic). Rolling the same number twice instead grants immunity to that type. This lasts for 1 minute. Recasting the Forbidden Spell allows you to reroll the d10s, potentially changing the resistances gained.

entries.name: Conjuration
entries: An Elemental of your choice with a CR equal to half of the Forbidden Spell's level appears and fights along side you, operating on your Initiative. They remain until reduced to 0 hit points, or after 1 minute passes.

entries.name: Divination
entries: You gain a +1 to all ability checks, attack rolls and saving throws until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Enchantment
entries: Creatures affected by the Forbidden Spell must make a Wisdom Saving throw to harm you, as if you were protected by the Sanctuary Spell. This lasts until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Evocation
entries: The Forbidden Spell's critical range is increased by 1.

entries.name: Illusion
entries: You become Invisible after casting the spell and can teleport up to 30ft within a point you can see.

entries.name: Necromancy
entries: Slaying a humanoid with this spell causes them to rise as an Undead under your control, with the Undead's CR equal to up to 1/3rd of that Humanoid's CR/Level. Must create an Undead they could physically be (DM Discretion).

entries.name: Transmutation
entries: The Creature must make a CON Save, and on a fail their damage resistances are removed until the end of your next turn.

item.name: The Mantle of Pyfrita
entries: While active this cloak sheds dim light for 30ft. Creatures that attack you while it's active have disadvantage and if they are within 5 feet of you when they hit take {@dice 3d6} fire damage. After being hit the cloak deactivates and must be reactivated with a bonus action.
Sage of the Forge. You gain proficiency in smith’s tools. If you already have smith’s tools proficiency you instead add twice your proficiency bonus to your rolls.

When you finish a long rest you can choose one metal weapon, suit of armor, or shield and enchant it with a fiery light. If it is a weapon it deals {@dice 2d6} extra fire damage on a hit, if it is a shield or suit of armor it grants fire and radiant resistance until your next long rest
Cursed. While wearing the cloak you are vulnerable to cold damage.

Form of the Pyre. As an action, you can set loose the spirit contained within the cloak to fight alongside you. The spirit takes on the form of an Elemental from the following list: Fire Elemental Myrmidon, Cinder Hulk, Salamander, or Fire Elemental.
While the spirit is active and has more than 0 hit points, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain immunity to fire damage.
Melee spell and weapon attacks deal 2d6 extra fire damage.
If you cast a spell that deals fire damage roll {@dice 1d6}, on a result of 6 the spell does not consume a spell slot.

entries: When the spirit drops to 0 hit points or 1 hour passes, it vanishes, and you lose the benefits listed above. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again for 90 days. As an action, you can cast a 5th level or higher spell that deals fire damage into the Mantle to lower the time to wait by 1 day.

item.name: The Red Blade
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
While wielding this blade, you can cast {@spell Hunter's Mark|PHB}, {@spell Ensnaring Strike|PHB}, {@spell Pass Without Trace|PHB} and {@spell Dust Devil|XGE} once per long rest, each.
Additionally, you no longer need to drink water, and have advantage on Constitution saving throws against overheating.
When you hit with a melee attack using this sword and reduce the target to 0 hit points, you gain 2d6 temporary hit points.
Your theft shall not be forgotten, and my vengeance shall be swift.

item.name: Thief of Grim Fates
entries: This black metal clawed gauntlet has five obsidians imbedded in the knuckles. The presence of this weapon puts people on edge, feeling as if they are about to have terrible luck. This weapon grants a +2 bonuses to attack and damage rolls made with it.

When you cast a spell of first level or higher that requires concentration, you can use your reaction to store it inside one of the obsidians on this gauntlet. When you do so, the spell does not require concentration, instead it lasts until the end of your next turn. This causes an obsidian on the gauntlet to glow. It continues to glow until you finish a long rest. If all five obsidians are glowing, you cannot use this feature.

When you hit a creature with this weapon, the target receives one stack of Grim Fate for each obsidian glowing. For every 5 points of Grim Fate, a creature has -1 on saving throws against spells and spell like effects. A creature with at least 1 stack of Grim Fate may make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of their turns. If they roll higher than the total number of stacks they have, they reduce their current stacks by half (min 1). If they fail, they reduce the number of stacks by 1.

item.name: Thieves Almanac Vol.
entries: These tomes contains the secrets to skullduggery and crime.

items: {@item Thieves Almanac Vol. I|TftJC}
{@item Thieves Almanac Vol. II|TftJC}
{@item Thieves Almanac Vol. III|TftJC}
{@item Thieves Almanac Vol. IV|TftJC}

item.name: Thieves Almanac Vol. I
entries: This tome contains the secrets to skullduggery and crime.
It can be read over 1 week to reduce the heat of a creature to 0 or reduce a buildings heat by 3. Additionally it can be read to gain a +1 bonus to on roll to avoid gaining heat.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Theft, Forger, Spy, or Gambling Wage Progression by 1.
Once this book has been used in this way 2 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Thieves Almanac Vol. II
entries: This tome contains the secrets to skullduggery and crime.
It can be read over 1 week to reduce the heat of a creature to 0 or reduce a buildings heat by 3. Additionally it can be read to gain a +3 bonus to on roll to avoid gaining heat.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Theft, Forger, Spy, or Gambling Wage Progression by 2.
Once this book has been used in this way 3 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Thieves Almanac Vol. III
entries: This tome contains the secrets to skullduggery and crime.
It can be read over 1 week to reduce the heat of a creature to 0 or reduce a buildings heat by 3. Additionally it can be read to gain a +5 bonus to on roll to avoid gaining heat.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Theft, Forger, Spy, or Gambling Wage Progression by 3.
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Thieves Almanac Vol. IV
entries: This tome contains the secrets to skullduggery and crime.
It can be read over 1 week to reduce the heat of a creature to 0 or reduce a buildings heat by 3. Additionally it can be read to gain a +7 bonus to on roll to avoid gaining heat.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Theft, Forger, Spy, or Gambling Wage Progression by 4.
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Thought Forge
entries: Thought Forges are installed in pairs, directly into the brains of two different creatures.

While those creatures are within 60 ft of them, the Thought Forges remain active. When either of the creatures makes an Intelligence saving throw or uses Intelligence to resist a harmful effect, they use the bonus of the creature with higher Intelligence. Whenever a creature makes an Intelligence saving throw in this manner, both creatures suffer psychic damage equal the difference in their Intelligence scores.

If both creatures have the same Intelligence, then instead they make Intelligence saving throws with advantage while within 60 ft of each other. If one of the characters fails the saving throw, both suffer the saving throw's negative effects, although not damage.

item.name: Throwing Star
entries: Special. After using a Throwing Star for your Attack Action, you can use your Bonus Action to throw an additional Star, provided you have another. You can hold up to three Stars in one hand at a time.
Special. Only Ninjutsu Rogues are able to gain proficiency with this weapon.

item.name: Throwing Star (Bundle of 10)
entries: Most commonly sold in bundles of 10 {@item throwing star|TftJC}.

customProperties.armorEffects: When hit by a critical hit the attack deals average damage instead of rolling.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Weapons always deal average damage (2,3,4,5, or 6 for D4, D6, D8, D10, and D12)
customProperties.additionalEffects: Material for Clockwork Amulet (1) or +1 Tinker's Tools (2).

Runesmithing: X

Once this book has been used in this way 2 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Tinker's Tome Vol. IV

It can be read over 1 week to gain +25 towards any tool check made in downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Carpentry, Sculptor, Smith, Teacher, or Tinkerer Wage Progression by 4
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Titanic Platemail
entries: This massive set of Platemail contains bulky shoulder plates that attach directly onto a helm that fully covers the face.
This also lowers your walking speed by 5, and your Dexterity score by 2.

item.name: Tonfa
entries: Paired. Paired weapons has special features that only activate when you are wielding two of the same weapon with the paired property.
When you are wielding two tonfa you gain a +1 bonus to your AC. If you make an attack with both Tonfa on your turn you lose the bonus to AC until the start of your next turn.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Toxic Orb
entries: Orbs are magic items found within Kima-at that can be applied to weapons, foci and armor, each granting unique effects. Orbs have 10 charges, which return at dawn.
You can only use one charge per orb, per turn. Up to 2 Orbs can be placed on a single item, which combines them and grants new effects.
Having 2 orbs on one weapon/armor/foci combines their charges, and allows you to use their abilities interchangeably. Using a Combo effect requires 2 charges spent
Weapon Effect: Hit creatures gain 1 {@condition Plagued|TftJC}.
Armor Effect: -2 Poison Damage, you can spend a charge when you gain a stack of Plagued to not gain it.
Focus Effect: Creatures hit by or who fail a saving throw gain 1 Plagued, or 2 if the spell cast matches the Orb's element.

item.name: Training Vol.
entries: These tomes contains the secrets on a variety of topics.

items: {@item Tinker's Tome Vol.|TftJC}
{@item Herbalist Helper Vol.|TftJC}
{@item Enchanting Catalogue Vol.|TftJC}
{@item Thieves Almanac Vol.|TftJC}
{@item Performer's Companion Vol.|TftJC}
{@item Muscle Magazine Vol.|TftJC}
{@item Guileless' Guide Vol.|TftJC}

item.name: Transmitting Orb
entries: Orbs are magic items found within Kima-at that can be applied to weapons, foci and armor, each granting unique effects. Orbs have 10 charges, which return at dawn.
You can only use one charge per orb, per turn. Up to 2 Orbs can be placed on a single item, which combines them and grants new effects.
Having 2 orbs on one weapon/armor/foci combines their charges, and allows you to use their abilities interchangeably. Using a Combo effect requires 2 charges spent
Combined Orbs: {@item Flaming Orb|TftJC} + {@item Static Orb|TftJC}
Weapon Effect: Removes 1 point of a condition applied by an Orb and applies it to the creature you hit.
Armor Effect: You can transfer up to 2 stacks of Orb effects to another creature within 15ft of you that is wielding/wearing an item imbued with an orb.
Focus Effect: Hitting a creature or having the fail a saving throw removes 1 point of a condition applied by an Orb and applies it to the creature you hit.

item.name: Traveler's Encyclopedia
entries: This book contains space for one to jot down their own notes. The book can be used to record ones thoughts for a total of 40 hours, after which the user can choose 1 skill or tool that they are proficient in and gain a permanent +1 to that skill.
Once used the book becomes non-magical.

item.name: Tricorne of the Seadog
entries: This Tricorne is filled with the strange magic that empowers the monstrous Pirates of the Western Sea. While wearing it, you gain the following effects:

items: You have a knack for treasure and coin, granting advantage on any checks to determine the value of an item.
You have advantage on saving throws against being forcibly moved or knocked prone while on the deck of a ship, and are immune to sea sickness.

Once per week, you can invoke the powers of the Tricorne to summon an undead crew of Pirates. 4 Skeletons wearing pirate garb appear within unoccupied spaces within 10ft of you, are friendly to you and follow your commands. They last for 10 minutes, or until they drop to 0 hit points. They require no corpse or skeleton to summon, and leave no trace that they were ever here once they are gone.

entries.name: Curse - Part of the Crew
entries: You cannot remove the Tricorne willingly. This effect can be temporarily removed by casting {@spell remove curse} on it, returning after wearing it again.

While cursed, when seeing gold or gemstones worth more than 1000GP, you must make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by it. The charm lasts for 1 hour after it leaves your sight. While charmed, you think only how you can take it and that you must have it. The charm can also end once you successfully claim the gold or gems.
You speak in a pirate accent, and commonly use words like 'Scallywag', 'Ahoy', 'Booty', etc.

customProperties.forgingConditions: Divine Intervention + Forged on Mount Celestia
customProperties.armorEffects: Armor reduces damage from Necrotic and Radiant by 10. After the armor reduces 50 damage, it bursts with energy, dealing 10 Radiant Damage to all creatures within 10ft of you (you do not take this damage).
customProperties.weaponEffects: This weapon deals Radiant damage instead of its normal damage type. Every 3rd attack made with this weapon that successfully hits causes it to deal an additional 15 Radiant Damage.
customProperties.additionalEffects: This is a crafting component for an Uprooting Spike.

Weapon Effects: This weapon deals Radiant damage instead of its normal damage type. Every 3rd attack made with this weapon that successfully hits causes it to deal an additional 15 Radiant Damage.
Additional Effects: This is a crafting component for an Uprooting Spike.

customProperties.weaponEffects: Every attack made with this weapon charges it. Every 5th attack hit with this weapon deals an additional 15 Force damage.

Weapon Effects: Every attack made with this weapon charges it. Every 5th attack hit with this weapon deals an additional 15 Force damage.
Additional Effects: -

customProperties.armorEffects: Armor reduces Cold, Thunder and Slashing damage by 5, and Lightning by 10. After reducing 25 damage, every creature but yourself within 5ft of you takes 5 Magical Slashing Damage.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Every 5th attack made with this metal deals an additional 15 Magical Slashing Damage.

Additional Effects: ?
Druid Useable: No

customProperties.forgingConditions: Requires STR, CON and CHA to be 14+, and Enchanted Tools.
customProperties.armorEffects: You gain resistance to Piercing Damage. You incur no penalties from moving on frozen terrains, slipping on ice or any negative effect on your movement on ice.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Weapons made from Tytantium have their damage die size increased by 1 tier (d4s -> d6s. If the damage die is either 1d12 or 2d6, it becomes 2d8).

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: 9 Hells (Cania)
Required Tool: Jeweler's Tools
Forging Conditions: Requires STR, CON and CHA to be 14+, and Enchanted Tools.
Armor Effects: You gain resistance to Piercing Damage. You incur no penalties from moving on frozen terrains, slipping on ice or any negative effect on your movement on ice.

Weapon Effects: Weapons made from Tytantium have their damage die size increased by 1 tier ({@dice d4}s -> {@dice d6}s. If the damage die is either {@dice 1d12} or {@dice 2d6}, it becomes {@dice 2d8}).
Additional Effects: -
Runesmithing: X
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Unruly Broom of Flying
entries: This wooden broom, which weighs 3 pounds, functions like a mundane broom until you stand astride it and speak its command word. It then hovers beneath you and can be ridden in the air. It has a flying speed of 50 feet. It can carry up to 400 pounds, but its flying speed becomes 30 feet while carrying over 200 pounds. The broom stops hovering when you land.

You can send the broom to travel alone to a destination within 1 mile of you if you speak the command word, name the location, and are familiar with that place. The broom comes back to you when you speak another command word, provided that the broom is still within 1 mile of you.
Unruly (Curse). Whenever you speak the command word for this broom, roll a {@dice 1d6}.

On a 1-3 the broom is unruly and to remain on it, you must make a DC 15 Acrobatics check at the start of your turn or fall off the broom. On a 4-5, the broom is malicious, while on it attack rolls against you have advantage on you, and you have disadvantage on all Dexterity saving throws and ability checks. On a 6, the broom is compliant and performs as normal.

A creature can use an action to make a DC 15 Animal Handling check on the broom. If the broom is Unruly or Malicious, it becomes compliant for the next hour, otherwise it cannot be changed until after an hour passes. While Unruly or Malicious, the broom may perform mischievous actions like knocking things off of shelves or attempting to trip the user. Unless the broom is compliant, it remains active for 1 hour, even if you say its command word.

customProperties.forgingConditions: Attempting to forge/smelt/refine Unstable Uranium causes the forger to take Necrotic Damage equal to their Tools check x5. If this reduces the forger to 0 hit points, their body turns to ash.
customProperties.armorEffects: Cannot be crafted into a shield or Light armor. While wearing this armor, your maximum Hit points are Reduced by 25, and are reduced by another 25 for each consecutive week of use (these hit points return after a week without wearing the armor). You gain Immunity to Poison, Acid and Necrotic Damage. If you would take over 20 points of Thunder/Fire Damage, all creatures within 10ft of you (not including yourself) must make a DC 19 CON Save or have their Maximum Hit points reduced by the same amount. If this effect would kill a creature, they turn to ash.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Cannot be made into Ammunition or Light Weapons. While wielding this weapon, your Maximum hit points are reduced by 13, and are reduced by another 13 for each consecutive week of use (these hit points return after a week without wielding the weapon). This weapon doubles the effectiveness of any enchantment that increases its to hit and damage roll bonus (up to a +6). On a hit, this weapon reduces a creatures maximum hit points by half of the damage it dealt (bludgeoning/piercing/slashing only). Creatures killed by this weapon turn to ash.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Material
Required Tool: Alchemist's Supplies

Forging Conditions: Attempting to forge/smelt/refine Unstable Uranium causes the forger to take Necrotic Damage equal to their Tools check x5. If this reduces the forger to 0 hit points, their body turns to ash.

Armor Effects: Cannot be crafted into a shield or Light armor. While wearing this armor, your maximum Hit points are Reduced by 25, and are reduced by another 25 for each consecutive week of use (these hit points return after a week without wearing the armor). You gain Immunity to Poison, Acid and Necrotic Damage. If you would take over 20 points of Thunder/Fire Damage, all creatures within 10ft of you (not including yourself) must make a DC 19 CON Save or have their Maximum Hit points reduced by the same amount. If this effect would kill a creature, they turn to ash.

Weapon Effects: Cannot be made into Ammunition or Light Weapons. While wielding this weapon, your Maximum hit points are reduced by 13, and are reduced by another 13 for each consecutive week of use (these hit points return after a week without wielding the weapon). This weapon doubles the effectiveness of any enchantment that increases its to hit and damage roll bonus (up to a +6). On a hit, this weapon reduces a creatures maximum hit points by half of the damage it dealt (bludgeoning/piercing/slashing only). Creatures killed by this weapon turn to ash.
Additional Effects: -
Runesmithing: {@item Stabilized Uranium|TftJC}
Druid Useable: Yes

item.name: Uprooting Spike
entries: This javelin is made of a sturdy yet strangely fragile alloy that combines True Metal and Celestial Gold known as Truelight, while being shaped like a trammel to shatter crystal.

entries.name: Catalyst of Destruction
entries: Using this weapon to attack a Crystal Tree causes it to splinter. If the damage is more than 20, the Javelin gains 1 charge. Upon gaining 3 charges, the next attack made with the javelin against a Crystal Tree, Fiend, Focused Humanoid, or Creature made from the Crystal tree's gems takes an additional 25 Radiant Damage, and in the case of the Crystal Tree, it is utterly destroyed down to the root. If the Spike destroyed a Crystal Tree, it too is destroyed with it.
This item cannot be sold because of its place of divinity and not widely known on the Material Plane.

entries.name: Crafting Conditions
entries: Material Components: 1000gp, 1 Javelin made from Truelight, Smith's Tools, blessed by Clerics/Paladins whose levels equal 30+ (Aasimars count for half of their total levels, rounded down).

item.name: Urumi
entries: Special. If you roll a natural 1 while using the Urumi you deal 1d8 slashing damage to yourself.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Vestments of the Skybreaker
entries: The Vestments of the Skybreaker are a set of five magical items that when combined gift the wearer the powers of Lysander the Skybreaker. While wearing at least one Vestment you can benefit from a single Vestment without it requiring attunement. If you put on more than one Vestment than they require attunement to function.

entries.name: Set Bonus
entries: While wearing all five of the Vestments you gain the following bonus:

When you make an attack using the Attack action and hit, you may make an additional attack with the same weapon and against the same target. If the attack hits, it does its normal damage roll, but the target takes half that amount as force damage. Whenever you deal damage to a creature with a ranged attack, you gain +5ft of movement speed until the end of your turn.

item.name: Victory of Thuum
entries: This massive set of Platemail contains bulky shoulder plates that attach directly onto a helm that fully covers the face.
This also lowers your walking speed by 5, and your Dexterity score by 2.

This set of Titanic Platemail has been enchanted with the unbreakable will of Thuum, servant of Alsorn. You have a +2 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. The eyes of this armor always glow with a deep red light, granting you advantage on Intimidation checks while wearing it.

As an action while wearing this armor, you can cause the armor to grow. Your size increases to Large and you gain advantage on all Strength checks and saving throws while you are Large from this armor. This bonus lasts for 1 hour or until you use a bonus action to turn it off. Once you use this ability, it cannot be used until you finish a long rest.
Orion is a deadly duelist, quick and strong wielding a great sword and heavy shield. His horns have both been replaced with crystals, granting him supernatural defenses.

item.name: Viktor's Quill of Intellect
entries: This magical quill contains the ability to condense the learned experience of the most intelligent individuals. If a creature with 17 or more intelligence uses the quill to sign their name, the book receives an amount of their intellect. Upon reaching 20 signatures, the tome can be transformed into a Tome of Clear Thought with Viktor's assistance.
Only signatures from those who have access to knowledge that is not modernly available can sign the book for it to count towards the total needed.

item.name: Vilenite

customProperties.forgingConditions: While Ashenite is active, forge with fire. While working, take 1d4 fire damage per 10 minutes.
customProperties.armorEffects: You have resistance to fire damage. When you take fire damage, you regain 1 hit point.
customProperties.weaponEffects: This weapon deals an additional 1d4 fire damage.
customProperties.additionalEffects: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws against extreme heat.

entries: Runesmithed

entries.name: Properties
entries: Base Metal: {@item Ashenite|TftJC}
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: While Ashenite is active, forge with fire. While working, take {@dice 1d4} fire damage per 10 minutes.
Armor Effects: You have resistance to fire damage. When you take fire damage, you regain 1 hit point.
Weapon Effects: This weapon deals an additional {@dice 1d4} fire damage.
Additional Effects: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws against extreme heat.
Druid Useable: No

customProperties.armorEffects: Cannot be crafted into a shield or Light armor. This armor is sentient, with an INT of 2, WIS of 8 and CHA of 12 (LE). While wearing this armor, your maximum Hit points are Reduced by 25, and are reduced by another 25 for each consecutive week of use (these hit points return after a week without wearing the armor). You gain Immunity to Fire and Necrotic Damage. Taking Fire Damage Increases your AC by an amount equal to 1/10th (min 0) of the damage you would have taken (before immunity/resistances) until the end of your next turn.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Cannot be made into Ammunition or Light Weapons. This weapon is sentient, with an INT of 2, WIS of 8 and CHA of 12 (LE). While wielding this weapon, your Maximum hit points are reduced by 13, and are reduced by another 13 for each consecutive week of use (these hit points return after a week without wielding the weapon). This weapon doubles the effectiveness of any enchantment that increases its to hit and damage roll bonus (up to a +6). You gain a bonus to Intimidation checks equal to the Enchantment Bonus with this weapon while wielding it. As a reaction to making an attack roll with this weapon, you can make an Intimidation Check, and gain a bonus to the d20 roll equal to 1/10th of the value rolled. If this makes the die value over your Critical Hit threshold, it is a Critical Hit.
customProperties.additionalEffects: If left unwielded for 1 month, the Armor/Weapon gets up and leaves, looking for a new host. Makes you sick ):

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Material
Required Tool: Alchemist's Supplies
Secondary Tool: Glassblower's Tools
Forging Conditions: ?
Base Metals: {@item Living Lava|TftJC} + {@item Unstable Uranium|TftJC}

Armor Effects: Cannot be crafted into a shield or Light armor. This armor is sentient, with an INT of 2, WIS of 8 and CHA of 12 (LE). While wearing this armor, your maximum Hit points are Reduced by 25, and are reduced by another 25 for each consecutive week of use (these hit points return after a week without wearing the armor). You gain Immunity to Fire and Necrotic Damage. Taking Fire Damage Increases your AC by an amount equal to 1/10th (min 0) of the damage you would have taken (before immunity/resistances) until the end of your next turn.

Weapon Effects: Cannot be made into Ammunition or Light Weapons. This weapon is sentient, with an INT of 2, WIS of 8 and CHA of 12 (LE). While wielding this weapon, your Maximum hit points are reduced by 13, and are reduced by another 13 for each consecutive week of use (these hit points return after a week without wielding the weapon). This weapon doubles the effectiveness of any enchantment that increases its to hit and damage roll bonus (up to a +6). You gain a bonus to {@skill Intimidation} checks equal to the Enchantment Bonus with this weapon while wielding it. As a reaction to making an attack roll with this weapon, you can make an {@skill Intimidation} Check, and gain a bonus to the d20 roll equal to 1/10th of the value rolled. If this makes the die value over your Critical Hit threshold, it is a Critical Hit.
Additional Effects: If left unwielded for 1 month, the Armor/Weapon gets up and leaves, looking for a new host. Makes you sick ):
Druid Useable: Yes

customProperties.armorEffects: Creatures of a CR lower than you cannot determine your alignment or creature type through magic or class features.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Weapons deal an additional 2 psychic damage if the target is concentrating on a spell, or was affected by a spell within the last round.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Material for Far Realm Shard (3 Plates)

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Far Realms
Required Tool: Mason's Tools
Forging Conditions: Proficiency in Deep Speech
Armor Effects: Creatures of a CR lower than you cannot determine your alignment or creature type through magic or class features.
Weapon Effects: Weapons deal an additional 2 psychic damage if the target is concentrating on a spell, or was affected by a spell within the last round.
Additional Effects: Material for Far Realm Shard (3 Plates)
Runesmithing: {@item Cosmic Ebony|TftJC}
Druid Useable: Yes

item.name: Void Orb
entries: Orbs are magic items found within Kima-at that can be applied to weapons, foci and armor, each granting unique effects. Orbs have 10 charges, which return at dawn.
You can only use one charge per orb, per turn. Up to 2 Orbs can be placed on a single item, which combines them and grants new effects.
Having 2 orbs on one weapon/armor/foci combines their charges, and allows you to use their abilities interchangeably. Using a Combo effect requires 2 charges spent
Combined Orbs: {@item Chilling Orb|TftJC} + {@item Charging Orb|TftJC}
Weapon Effect: Hitting a creature successfully grants you 10 temporary hit points.
Armor Effect: When you fail a Saving Throw, you can repeat the Saving Throw. If you fail again, you take an additional 10 Necrotic damage.
Focus Effect: Hitting a creature successfully or having them fail a Saving Throw grants you 10 temporary hit points.

item.name: Volcanic Quartz

customProperties.forgingConditions: 3rd level or higher Evocation Spell that deals fire damage and Smith's Tools Proficiency
customProperties.armorEffects: Can only be made into Heavy Armor. Requires 23+ Strength to wear. Grants 1 more AC than normal armor of the same type.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Can only be made into heavy weapons. Deals 1 step higher damage dice. Requires 23+ Strength to wield.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Material for +1 Alchemist, Brewer's, or Glassblower's Tools (2 Plates).

entries: Runesmithed

entries.name: Properties
entries: Base Metal: {@item Ash Quartz|TftJC}
Required Tool: Jeweler's Tools
Forging Conditions: 3rd level or higher Evocation Spell that deals fire damage and Smith's Tools Proficiency
Armor Effects: Can only be made into Heavy Armor. Requires 23+ Strength to wear. Grants 1 more AC than normal armor of the same type.
Weapon Effects: Can only be made into heavy weapons. Deals 1 step higher damage dice. Requires 23+ Strength to wield.
Additional Effects: Material for +1 Alchemist, Brewer's, or Glassblower's Tools (2 Plates).
Druid Useable: Yes

item.name: Vow of Overkin
entries: When uncorked this vial releases a sentient pool of water named Overkin. Overkin's power is sealed by seven seals.
1st Seal: Take the heart of the fallen and bathe it in the glow of the light of the sea.

customProperties.forgingConditions: Requires Proficiency in WIS Saving Throws, and Enchanted Smith's Tools.
customProperties.armorEffects: The wearer gains proficiency in Perception and gains a blindsight of 10ft.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Hitting a creature with an opposite alignment as you forces that creature to make a DC17 WIS Save, and on a fail incur a Short Term Madness for a number of rounds equal to Half of your Proficiency Bonus (rounded down).
customProperties.additionalEffects: Can be used to Craft Titanic Platemail.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: 9 Hells (Malbolge)
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: Requires Proficiency in WIS Saving Throws, and Enchanted Smith's Tools.
Armor Effects: The wearer gains proficiency in Perception and gains a blindsight of 10ft.

Weapon Effects: Hitting a creature with an opposite alignment as you forces that creature to make a DC17 WIS Save, and on a fail incur a Short Term Madness for a number of rounds equal to Half of your Proficiency Bonus (rounded down).
Additional Effects: Can be used to Craft Titanic Platemail.
Runesmithing: X
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Warriors Might Mutagen
entries: A creature can use an action to inject this mutagen into their brain stem. The creature doing the injection must make a DC 30 Medicine check on a failure the injected creature suffers one level of exhaustion and an additional level for every 5 below the DC.

Once injected, the creature's Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution scores all increase by 1 up to 20. The creature gains Vulnerability to Psychic damage. The effect lasts until removed by a wish or magic that remakes a creature's body such as Reincarnate or Wish.

item.name: Waxy Pie
entries: This tasty pie can be shared with up to 4 other people. If shared during a short rest each person that eats it can add {@dice 1d4} to one hit die spent during the short rest. The pie magically reappears each day at midnight.

item.name: Wirelauncher
entries: There are the following versions:

items: {@item Wirelauncher MK I|TftJC}
{@item Wirelauncher MK II|TftJC}

item.name: Wirelauncher MK I
entries: Simple Invention.

A creature can spend 1 minute attaching a javelin to this device. The javelin retains any properties it had before, such as enchantments and rare metal abilities. While attached, the javelin now connects to a canister containing 50ft of thick rope.

The javelin's maximum range cannot exceed how many ft of rope the canister contains. Hitting a creature with the javelin carries the rope with it, allowing you to hold a rope on that creature so long as the javelin remains stuck in the creature. The creature can remove the javelin as an action by making a DC 10 Strength or Dexterity Check.

item.name: Wirelauncher MK II
entries: Innovative Invention.

A creature can spend 1 minute attaching a javelin to this device. The javelin retains any properties it had before, such as enchantments and rare metal abilities. While attached, the javelin now connects to a canister containing 75ft of thick rope.

The javelin's maximum range cannot exceed how many ft of rope the canister contains. Additionally, as a Bonus Action, you can set a maximum length limit to the rope, so that the rope only goes out a number of feet up to this amount. You can change or remove the length limit as a Bonus Action on a subsequent turn.

Hitting a creature with the javelin carries the rope with it, allowing you to hold a rope on that creature so long as the javelin remains stuck in the creature. The creature can remove the javelin as an action by making a DC 15 Strength Check. While the javelin remains embedded in the creature, their walking/swim/flying speeds are lowered by 10.

item.name: Wyrm Platinum

customProperties.armorEffects: Dragons will be innately more aggressive towards you and have advantage on attack rolls against you. You have advantage on Charisma checks when bartering. The price for material components for spells is discounted by 10% while wearing this armor.
customProperties.weaponEffects: Once per turn, when you hit with this weapon you can add your Proficiency Bonus to the Damage, or twice your Proficiency Bonus to damage against dragons. Dragons will be innately more aggressive towards you and you have disadvantage on attack rolls against dragons.
customProperties.additionalEffects: Dragon's gold Cartographer's tool can be used to create spell scroll of Locate Object, or Locate Creature. When used in this way the gold cost to make such scroll is reduced by 75%. You can make and cast these scrolls even if they aren't on your spell list or you don't have the spell slot.

entries: Runesmithed

entries.name: Properties
entries: Base Metal: {@item Dragon's Gold|TftJC}
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: 15 CHA, 20 if smith is Draconic.

Armor Effects: Dragons will be innately more aggressive towards you and have advantage on attack rolls against you. You have advantage on Charisma checks when bartering. The price for material components for spells is discounted by 10% while wearing this armor.

Weapon Effects: Once per turn, when you hit with this weapon you can add your Proficiency Bonus to the Damage, or twice your Proficiency Bonus to damage against dragons. Dragons will be innately more aggressive towards you and you have disadvantage on attack rolls against dragons.

Additional Effects: Dragon's gold Cartographer's tool can be used to create spell scroll of Locate Object, or Locate Creature. When used in this way the gold cost to make such scroll is reduced by 75%. You can make and cast these scrolls even if they aren't on your spell list or you don't have the spell slot.
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Yushanti's Secret Sauce
entries: Preparation: Requires Cook's Tools to prepare.
Ingredients: x3 Golden Clover, x10 Ironoak Berries, x1 Solar Harpflower, x1 Rock Gum Root, x2 Draconic Ivy, x1 Rusty Sprig, x5 Shaded Milkweed
Effect: Must be eaten with another meal, grants both its effect and the other meals effects. When consumed you gain one use of a Legendary resistance.

item.name: Zapping Orb
entries: Orbs are magic items found within Kima-at that can be applied to weapons, foci and armor, each granting unique effects. Orbs have 10 charges, which return at dawn.
You can only use one charge per orb, per turn. Up to 2 Orbs can be placed on a single item, which combines them and grants new effects.
Having 2 orbs on one weapon/armor/foci combines their charges, and allows you to use their abilities interchangeably. Using a Combo effect requires 2 charges spent
Combined Orbs: {@item Static Orb|TftJC} + {@item Static Orb|TftJC}
Weapon Effect: Hitting a creature successfully with a weapon or spell attack grants 2 {@condition Charged|TftJC}.
Armor Effect: -4 Lightning Damage, as a Reaction to taking Lightning Damage you can expend 2 charges to gain resistance to Lightning damage until the start of your next turn.
Focus Effect: Creatures hit by or who fail a saving throw grants you 2 {@condition Charged|TftJC}, or 3 if the spell cast matches the Orb's element.

item.name: Zar's Fancy Boots
entries: These boots were hand made to your specification by Zar'ryath. While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 5 feet.

customProperties.armorEffects: If you do not have resistance/immunity to Fire, you take 5 Fire Damage at the start of your turn while wearing this armor. Creatures Grappling you or creatures you grapple take 5 Fire Damage when the grapple starts, or when the grappler starts their turn.
customProperties.weaponEffects: If you do not have resistance/immunity to Fire, you take 5 Fire Damage at the start of your turn while wielding these weapons. Zuigni Weapons deal an additional 1d6 Fire Damage on a hit, and ignore resistance to Fire Damage. Additionally, Zuigni Weapons can cast Absorb Elements (Fire Only) thrice per dawn.

entries.name: Properties
entries: Plane of Origin: Fire
Required Tool: Smith's Tools
Forging Conditions: Immolation Spell, 17 STR

Armor Effects: If you do not have resistance/immunity to Fire, you take 5 Fire Damage at the start of your turn while wearing this armor. Creatures Grappling you or creatures you grapple take 5 Fire Damage when the grapple starts, or when the grappler starts their turn.

Weapon Effects: If you do not have resistance/immunity to Fire, you take 5 Fire Damage at the start of your turn while wielding these weapons. Zuigni Weapons deal an additional {@dice 1d6} Fire Damage on a hit, and ignore resistance to Fire Damage. Additionally, Zuigni Weapons can cast {@spell Absorb Elements} (Fire Only) thrice per dawn.
Additional Effects: -
Runesmithing: X
Druid Useable: No

item.name: Zyrial, Heart of the Sea
entries: While wearing or holding this magical gem you can commune with the spirit trapped within to create a powerful magical implement. As an action, you can target one non-magical weapon, armor, or spellcasting focus that you are holding and wearing and cause it to become encrusted with magical gemstones.

Encrusted Weapon. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this now magical weapon. In addition, you deal {@dice 1d6} cold damage on a hit. On scoring a critical hit you deal {@dice 3d6} cold damage to each creature of your choice within 5 feet of the original target.

Bejeweled Armor. You gain a +2 bonus to your AC while wearing the bejeweled armor. In addition, when you take radiant or force damage you take {@dice 1d6} less of that damage. Upon dropping to zero hp points you instead drop to zero and regain {@dice 2d6} hit points. Once this feature has been used the armor becomes non-magical and Zyrial ceases to function for 1 week.

Dazzling Focus. A spell cast with this spell-casting focus gains a +2 to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC. In addition, when you deal cold, force, or radiant damage you deal an additional {@dice 1d6} slashing damage. Spells that deal cold, force, or radiant damage to a single target score a critical hit on a 19 or 20.

Crystal of the Sea. As an action or as a reaction to taking cold damage, you can cause Zyrial to manifest a suit of crystal armor that engulfs your entire body. This armor sets your AC to 18, 20 if Zyrial was active as Bejeweled Armor, and imposes disadvantage on stealth checks, this armor counts as heavy armor and you are proficient with it while wearing it. This armor lasts for 10 minutes or until you use an action to dismiss it. While active you are immune to cold damage. After using this feature you cannot manifest this armor again until you finish a long rest.
If you use your action to encrust another object the enchantment on a currently encrusted object fades as the crystals fall away.
Sentience. Zyrial is a sentient neutral good object with an Intelligence of 12, Wisdom of 12, and a Charisma of 16. It has hearing and blindsight out to a range of 30 feet.
This object can speak, read, and understand Common and Aquan, and can communicate with its wielder telepathically.

trait.name: Water Rejuvenation
entries: After spending 1 minute submerged in water, the Kelpglider regains all of its hit points and removes any negative conditions from itself.

action.name: Druidcraft
entries: The Kelpglider casts {@spell Druidcraft}

monster.name: Minion

hp.special: 2 + your Charisma bonus + three times your warlock level (the minion has a number of Hit Dice [d6s] equal to your warlock level)

languages: Common and all the languages you speak

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting(Warlock)
entries: The minion's innate spellcasting ability is charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components. Its spell casting level is equal to your warlock level.
At will: two Warlock cantrips of your choice.

trait.name: Unfocused Follower
entries: Unless the minion is within 60 feet of its master is has disadvantage on all attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Natural Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} slashing damage.

reaction.name: Protect Master
entries: While within 10ft of its master, the minion can use its reaction to add + your proficiency bonus to its Master's AC against one attack, if the attack misses, the attack hits the minion instead.

object.name: Ballista Magazine
entries: Innovative Invention.
This wide magazine allows for quicker reloading of a Ballista. Once crafted, it must be installed on the ballista, which takes 10 minutes.

It has an AC of 15 and 20 hit points. The Magazine can hold up to 14 Ballista Sized Bolts, and while the magazine is loaded with ammunition the Ballista only requires a Bonus Action to reload. All other rules about a Ballista remain the same.
To reload the Magazine, you can spend an Action to place a bolt into the magazine.

optionalfeature.name: A Change of Plans
entries: You can forgo one attack to give an ally nearby the chance to push their advantage on their next turn. Choose one ally within 30ft, on their next turn they can use a bonus action to make one weapon attack, Disengage, Dash, or Use an Item.

optionalfeature.name: Adept
entries: Tier 1 Arcana. You may add your Intelligence Modifier + the spell level to the damage of The Forbidden Spell.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Battery
entries: When a creature casts a spell within 30ft of you that deals damage, you can further enhance it with your own magic. Using your reaction to expend a spell slot you add additional force damage to one of the damage rolls of the spell equal to {@dice 2d8} per spell slot expended + half your warden levels. This is added to the spell's damage, meaning spells that save for half damage also halve this additional force damage.

optionalfeature.name: Armor Piercing Rounds

feature: Cannot be used with Explosive or Gas

entries: The firearm gains a +2 to-hit against creatures wearing armor, wielding a shield or using cover.

optionalfeature.name: Barrier
entries: Tier 1 Arcana. After casting The Forbidden Spell, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence Modifier + the spell level.

optionalfeature.name: Battle Herald
entries: You've learned to fight by leading the charge and inspiring your allies. While allies are within 30 feet of you and you succeed on a saving throw or score a critical hit you can use your reaction to grant a number of allies equal to your proficiency bonus temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Bayonet

feature: Two-Handed, cannot be used with Gunblade

entries: You attach a blade at the end of the weapon, which can be used as a martial melee weapon that deals {@dice 1d8} piercing damage on a hit. The Bayonet is not considered a firearm.

optionalfeature.name: Befuddling Strike
entries: As part of an attack, you strike a creature and confuse its senses. When you use this technique to attack a creature, that creature must make an Intelligence saving throw even if the attack misses. If the target fails, they become confused and on their next turn take one of the following actions of your choice, and then end their turn:

items: Make one attack against a creature of your choice within range.
Use all their movement and use the dash action to move in a direction of your choice, avoiding obvious dangers.
Drop what it's holding and end its turn.

optionalfeature.name: Birdshot
entries: You gain a +2 to hit and gain 20 normal range when attacking flying creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Blade Guard

feature: Pact of the Blade and Master Warlock

entries: You and your minion can cast warding bond once per long rest. When you cast it using this evocation the target must be either the minion or master and you do not need to provide the material component.

optionalfeature.name: Blasting Parry
entries: As a Reaction, you can use this weapon to parry incoming damage, rolling its weapon damage and reducing damage taken by that amount (consumes a bullet).

optionalfeature.name: Blockade
entries: You forgo an attack to instead brace yourself and up to one other creature within 10ft of you, allowing them to use their reaction to use the dodge action, as well as taking the Dodge action yourself. Until the end of your next turn, you and an ally that takes the dodge action using their reaction gains advantage against any effects that would physically force that creature’s movement. Any creature that enters your or your affected allies threat range immediately provokes an attack of opportunity without using your reaction. You lose the bonus if you are ever more than 10ft apart from the target.

optionalfeature.name: Bounty Hunter
entries: You can cast the hunter’s mark spell once per day without expending a spell slot by expending 50gp. By default, it is cast at 1st level, you can expend 100gp to increase the level of the spell by 1. When you kill a creature affected by hunter’s mark cast from this invocation you gain gold equal to 150% of the gold spent casting this spell. Once you have received gold in this way you cannot receive more gold from this invocation until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Burst
entries: Tier 3 Arcana. Creatures affected by The Forbidden Spell explode with its power, dealing half of its damage to creatures within a 5ft radius of it (excluding itself).

optionalfeature.name: Call the Pack
entries: As part of an attack that hits a single creature, you can call your allies to join in on the fight. Until the start of your next turn, each creature of your choice within 5 ft. of you gains advantage against the target you struck and the first attack from a creature other than you deal extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Charging Bull
entries: You forgo an attack to move in a straight line, up to 15ft towards a creature, for each ally that you pass within 5ft of they gain 10ft of movement on their next turn, each enemy that you pass within 5ft of losses 10ft of movement on their next turn. At the end of the charge you can make a shove action against a creature within range. If you succeed on the shove, the target is pushed up to 15ft away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Concussive Round
entries: Once per turn, your firearm can concussively Stun a creature you hit with it. They must make a Constitution Saving Throw (DC = 8 + prof + DEX) and on a fail are {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Contact
entries: Tier 1 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's range is reduced to touch, and for every 30ft of range the Forbidden Spell would have had instead grants one additional damage die.

optionalfeature.name: Cost
entries: Tier 3 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell is upcasted by two levels, and then your maximum hit points are reduced by {@dice 3d6} until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Countershot
entries: As a reaction to a spell being cast that you can see within your firearm's short range, you can attempt to counterspell it by making a Dexterity check with your firearm. You can do so a number of times per long rest equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Covering Fire
entries: You forgo an attack to lay down a command of covering fire over an area. Choose a 15ft cube within your ranged weapon's short range. Until the start of your next turn, whenever a creature moves into or exits that area, you or any of your allies within 60ft of the cube can use their reaction to make a single ranged attack against that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Crippling Shot
entries: Hitting a creature with this weapon causes them to lose 5ft of their movement speed until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Crushing Pursuit
entries: As a bonus action, you can Dash. When you finish your movement on this turn, each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw or take bludgeoning damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus + 1/20th of your Maximum Hit points. On a successful save, they take half damage.

optionalfeature.name: Custom Gunblade
entries: Can be applied to any Melee Weapon, which grants it the Gunblade feature and considers it a firearm.

optionalfeature.name: Damascene
entries: When using the firearm for a Charisma check, you have advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Distance
entries: Tier 1 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's range is increased by 10 per Spell Slot it is cast at.

optionalfeature.name: Door of Shadow
entries: You may cast the dimension door spell once per day without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Double
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. You can cast The Forbidden Spell again this turn as a Bonus Action, but it must be cast using a lower level spell slot (which is still spent).

optionalfeature.name: Double Barrel
entries: When using your bonus action to make an attack with a light firearm, you can make two attacks as a part of the same bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Double Chamber
entries: Increases Pump by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon's Breath
entries: The firearm deals an additional {@dice 1d8} fire damage. If the firearm activates pump, this damage is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: Drain
entries: Tier 1 Arcana. Creatures hit by The Forbidden Spell have their speed reduced by 10ft until the end of their next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Drift
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. Immediately after or before casting The Forbidden Spell, you may teleport up to 15ft to an unoccupied space you can see.

optionalfeature.name: Drum Upgrade
entries: All of this firearm's clips are converted into drums, which each triple their ammunition capacity.

optionalfeature.name: Element
entries: Tier 1 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's damage type becomes either Fire, Cold, Acid, Lightning or Poison (you choose when you select this Arcana).

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Munitions
entries: When you use your Burst Strike feature, you may choose the damage type of the extra damage. Your choices are Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder.

optionalfeature.name: Empower
entries: Tier 3 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's damage die uses d8s instead of d6s.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Healing
entries: When you cast a spell that restores hit points, you can use this technique to increase the potency of the healing. The targeted creature regains additional hit points equal to your Constitution modifier, and you regain hit points equal to your Warden Level plus the spells level.

optionalfeature.name: Envelop
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's damage die is lowered by 2, but it becomes a Dexterity Saving Throws affecting creatures in a 15ft radius.

optionalfeature.name: Etched Pentagram
entries: As a bonus action, you can summon this firearm into your hand. As a bonus action, you can dismiss the firearm into a pocket dimension.

optionalfeature.name: Exhaust Engine
entries: Your Burst Strike damage is increased by {@dice 1d10}. +1 Misfire Score.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Rounds

feature: Gunner: Demolitionist, Cannot be used with Gas

entries: This weapon's attacks gain Explosive 10, or add 10 explosive to their value.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Barrel
entries: The firearm's normal range increases by 10, and its long range increases by 40.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Belt
entries: Belt capacity is increased by 20.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Clip
entries: The firearm's clips can store twice the normal amount of rounds.

optionalfeature.name: Failure
entries: Tier 3 Arcana. Creatures affected have disadvantage on the next saving throw they would make until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Flintlocked
entries: Your weapon attacks deal additional Fire damage on a hit equal to half of the number of Modifications on this weapon (rounded down).

optionalfeature.name: Foregrip
entries: You can wield this weapon with two hands, increasing its damage die by 1 step.

optionalfeature.name: Friction Holster
entries: When drawing this light firearm, you can draw another one as a part of the same action.

optionalfeature.name: Full Auto
entries: The Firearm gains the Auto feature, allowing it to make an additional attack each turn.

optionalfeature.name: Full Camo
