entries: As an Action, you turn Invisible until the end of your next turn. When the invisibility ends, you can immediately make a Stealth check to create a new Hidden Perch.

optionalfeature.name: Full Metal Jacket
entries: Increases the firearm's Damage Die by 1 step.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Darkness
entries: You learn the darkvision spell and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. In addition, when cast in this way the darkvision granted by the spell allows the target to see through magical darkness.

optionalfeature.name: Gloom
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. Creatures affected by The Forbidden Spell must instead make a Wisdom saving throw, and on a fail are {@condition frightened} rather than subtracting {@dice 1d4}, for 1 minute or until they succeed the saving throw by repeating it at the end of their turns.

optionalfeature.name: Gold Standard
entries: Once per turn, when you hit with a firearm but before you roll damage, you can double the weapon's damage dice you would deal.

optionalfeature.name: Grasp
entries: Tier 3 Arcana. Creatures affected by The Forbidden Spell are no longer subtract {@dice 1d4}, but now they must instead then make a Strength Saving Throw, and on a fail become {@condition Restrained} for 1 minute, or until they succeed on the saving throw by repeating it at the end of their turns.

optionalfeature.name: Hexed Cylinder

feature: Gunner: Hexlock, Other Hexed Bullets cannot be loaded into this weapon. Cannot be restricted by your spellcasting option.

entries: When you install this modification, choose one known Tier 1 Hexed Bullet. Bullets fired from this gun always apply that effect.

optionalfeature.name: Hidden Track
entries: The firearm gains the hidden property.

optionalfeature.name: High Velocity Rounds
entries: You can attack creatures through walls up to 5ft thick, so long as you know they are there.

optionalfeature.name: Hollow Point Rounds

feature: Gunner: Quickdraw, Cannot be used with Explosive or Gas

entries: When you critically hit with the firearm, you can roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit.

optionalfeature.name: Horizon
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's range is doubled, but it deals one less damage die.

optionalfeature.name: Immortal Shield
entries: You forgo one attack and instead command your Legionnaires to protect one creature within 30 feet of you. Any Legionnaires within 60 feet of you can move up to 15ft towards a target of your choice, until the end of that target’s turn when it takes damage, that damage is reduced by 1 for each Legionnaire or yourself within 5ft of it.

optionalfeature.name: Immortal Spear
entries: As part of an attack, you also command your Legionnaires to attack one creature within 30 feet of you. Any Legionnaires within 60 feet of you can move up to 15ft towards a target of your choice, until the end of that your next turn, whenever you hit a creature with an attack it takes 1 additional damage for each Legionnaire within 5ft of it.

optionalfeature.name: Immortal Wall
entries: You command your Legionnaires to form an unbreakable wall. Select one Legionnaire or yourself. Any Legionnaires within 60 feet of you or the selected Legionnaire can move up to 15ft towards you, Legionnaires that end their movement adjacent to yourself or another Legionnaires have their AC increased by 4 and become tangible. Attacks cannot pass through or above the Legionnaires (up to 10 feet above and below them) and creature that try and move through the Legionnaires must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and have their movement stopped. This effect ends at the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Belt Feed
entries: The firearm's misfire score is reduced by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Incendiary Rounds
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, they are lit on fire for a number of rounds equal to your Prof bonus, and take {@dice 1d6} Fire damage at the start of each of their turns. They can be doused in water or use an action to put themselves out.

optionalfeature.name: Interceding Strike
entries: As a reaction, when a creature hits the subject of your Honor Bond with an attack, and you are within 5ft of the attacker, you can make an attack against them. If the attack hits, you reduce the damage of the offending attack by the damage you deal.

optionalfeature.name: Ironsight
entries: The firearm gains a +1 to-hit.

optionalfeature.name: Kevlar Strap
entries: Removes the Two Handed property.

optionalfeature.name: Larger Barrel
entries: The barrel can hold an additional 2 rounds.

optionalfeature.name: Laser Sight
entries: You gain a +3 to hit against creatures not in direct light.

optionalfeature.name: Leaded Rounds

feature: Cannot be used with Explosive or Gas

entries: Creatures hit by this weapon cannot heal until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Leader's Venir
entries: Your minion’s attacks become magical for the purposes of overcoming damage resistance and deal additional damage equal to your Charisma modifier if you have hit the target this turn.

optionalfeature.name: Loot Explosions
entries: If you kill a creature with an eldritch blast, they will spew coins out of their mouth (or another applicable orifice) when they die. The amount of coins they divulge is equal to their hit dice and is of the type of coin you used for the material component of the eldritch blast which killed them.

optionalfeature.name: Mark of Denial
entries: As part of an attack, you mark one creature and protect your allies from it. When you use this technique to attack a creature, that creature must make a Wisdom saving throw even if the attack misses. If the target fails the saving throw, it cannot take reactions until the end of your next turn, and any creature leaving its threat range for the first time can move an extra 10ft on their turn.

optionalfeature.name: Modularity
entries: The Firearm can be disassembled and reassembled within 1 minute for concealed carry.

optionalfeature.name: Money Talks
entries: You can cast the magic mouth spell once per day without expending a spell slot or requiring a material component. The object of the spell must be a coin.

optionalfeature.name: Motion Stabilizers
entries: So long as you don't move on your turn, you can add your Wisdom Modifier to the to hit bonus of this weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Night Scope
entries: The firearm can be used in darkness without disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Origin
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's damage type becomes either Necrotic, Radiant or Thunder (you choose when you select this Arcana).

optionalfeature.name: Otherworldly Summons
entries: You can cast summon celestial using a warlock spell slot. Once you do so you can’t cast the spell again until you finish a long rest. While the celestial is summoned, creatures of your choice within 10 feet of it gains +1 to all saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Overheat
entries: When using Shoot to Thrill, your Proficiency Bonus is considered 2 higher for both your to hit bonus and damage. +1 Misfire score.

optionalfeature.name: Overpressure

feature: Cannot be used with Explosive or Gas

entries: The firearm's attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d6} damage. +1 Misfire score.

optionalfeature.name: Overwhelm
entries: Tier 1 Arcana. Creatures affected by The Forbidden Spell must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Passage
entries: Tier 1 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's range is halved, but it becomes a Dexterity Saving throw affecting creatures in a 5ft line.

optionalfeature.name: Piercing
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. Creatures affected by The Forbidden Spell gain a -1 penalty to its Armor Class until the end of their next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Pin Them Down
entries: You can forgo one attack to instead make a grapple check. When you do this, you can choose one ally within 5ft of the target, if that creature has proficiency in Athletics you add twice your Strength bonus to your Athletics check to grapple the target. If you successfully grapple the target and the target is no more than 1 size larger than you, you instead pin the creature, Restraining it until you move more than 5ft from the target. The creature can use an action to attempt to break free from the restraint, making a Strength saving throw against your Technique save DC, breaking free on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Pistol Stock

feature: Light, cannot be used with Hidden

entries: The pistol gains 20 normal range.

optionalfeature.name: Potato Cannon
entries: You can fire objects of up to 6" in diameter that are not ammunition with this weapon. Objects instead deal {@dice 1d4} + your dexterity modifier in bludgeoning damage on a hit, and may apply other effects based on the object's effects.

optionalfeature.name: Provoking Strike
entries: As part of an attack, you goad one creature into paying attention to you. When you use this technique, the creature must make a Charisma saving throw even if the attack misses. If the target fails the saving throw, the creature makes all attacks against targets other than you with disadvantage until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Pump Charge
entries: When you take the attack action, you can forgo an attack to overpressure your firearm, causing its next attack to deal double damage die.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Mag
entries: Once per turn, you can replace a Clip in this weapon as a Free Action.

optionalfeature.name: Quickdraw Mark
entries: Attacking a creature Marks them, making each subsequent attack deal 1 additional damage. The Mark lasts until the end of your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Quickened Belt Feed
entries: The Belt firearm makes three attacks instead of two per each attack it could make. +1 Misfire score.

optionalfeature.name: Rakish Fighting
entries: You learned to fight on the streets and use everything you can to your advantage. As a bonus action you can attempt a dirty trick. One creature within 10 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Str or Dex, or become {@condition blinded} until the start of their next turn. In addition, whenever you hit a creature you have advantage on you deal {@dice 1d6} extra damage.

optionalfeature.name: Rallying Call
entries: You forgo an attack to rally your allies within 30ft of you, granting them temporary hp equal to half your warden level + your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Recovery
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell deals one less damage die, and one ally within range of the Forbidden Spell's attack range regains half of the damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Regress
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. Creatures affected by The Forbidden Spell instead subtract {@dice 2d4} from their next roll.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless Vigor
entries: As a reaction to failing a saving throw, expend 1 hit die and roll it. You take necrotic damage equal to twice the number rolled which cannot be reduced in any way. You may then reattempt the saving throw with advantage. You may still use Heat of Battle after using this Technique, even if you succeed on the saving throw on the reattempt.

optionalfeature.name: Reliability
entries: The firearm gains the reliable property, lowering its misfire by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Renewal
entries: Tier 3 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's damage die is lowered by 2, but you regain an expended spell slot of 3rd or lower. This must be cast with a spell slot of 4th or higher to use this Arcana.

optionalfeature.name: Repeating
entries: Tier 3 Arcana. You make an additional attack with this spell at another creature within range.

optionalfeature.name: Riot Blast Shield
entries: While wielding the Firearm, you gain a +2 to your AC and Dexterity Saving Throws.

optionalfeature.name: Roulette Barrel
entries: Once per turn, when you attack with this weapon you can roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 6, you can make an additional attack with this weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Runick Chamber
entries: As a bonus action you can attune damage type, from Force, Radiant, or Necrotic. Once per turn when you hit with this firearm, the weapon deals extra damage of that type equal to your Intelligence Modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Sawed Off
entries: Reduces the range for the firearm by 10, but increases the shotgun cone by 5 feet. Misfire is also increased by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Scatterslug
entries: Creatures within your Shotgun's cone take full damage.

optionalfeature.name: Scope
entries: The firearm does not pose disadvantage when firing at long range.

optionalfeature.name: Scrap Shrapnel

feature: Gunner: Demolitionist, Cannot be used with Gas

entries: This weapon deals an additional 2 piercing damage to other creatures within 5ft of it.

optionalfeature.name: Semi Auto
entries: Allows the Deadeye to override its restriction to extra attack, can be turned off/on as a Bonus Action.

optionalfeature.name: Shared Comprehension

feature: Pact of the Tome and Master Warlock

entries: Your minion can cast the cantrips you have in your Book of Shadows. If you gain the ability to cast rituals your minion can also cast those rituals and together you can both cast the same ritual to lower the time it takes to complete by half.

optionalfeature.name: Sharpened Edge
entries: Attacks made have their critical hit range expanded by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Shield Wall
entries: You forgo one attack to instead brace your charge for incoming attacks. To use this technique, you must be wielding a shield. For the next minute, whenever your Honor Bound is within 5ft of you, they gain the AC benefits of your shield and can add your shield bonus to any Dexterity saving throws they make. The effect ends if you drop your shield or become incapacitated.

optionalfeature.name: Shuffle the Board
entries: You forgo an attack to move up to five other creatures within 30ft of you 5ft. If the creature does not want to move and is within 5ft of you, they must make a Strength saving throw to resist the effect. Creatures that aren’t within 5ft of you cannot be forced to move, but can willing move.

optionalfeature.name: Silencer

feature: Cannot be used on an Explosive or Gas firearm

entries: The firearm produces a quarter of its normal noise. For the average firearm, it becomes nearly silent. Removes the Loud Trait.

optionalfeature.name: Smoke Canister Launcher
entries: You can forgo an attack on your turn with a Smoke Canister, firing it within your firearm's short range. It then explodes, dealing no damage but heavily obscuring a 10ft radius around it. Can be used a number of times per Short rest equal to your Prof Bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Spell Battery
entries: When you critically hit with this weapon, you regain an expended Pact Slot.

optionalfeature.name: Spell Sharing
entries: When you cast a spell that targets only you, you can use this Technique to grant one other creature within 5ft of you the effects of the spell. If the spell lasts for a duration, it lasts on the secondary creature for a number of rounds equal to the duration of the spell or equal to half your proficiency modifier (rounded down) whichever is lower.

optionalfeature.name: Subjagation
entries: You forgo one attack to instead intimidate one target. Select 1 creature within 60ft of you, they must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they are {@condition Frightened} of you. As long as the creature is {@condition frightened}, their movement speed is halved, and you gain Temporary Hit Points at the start of your turn equal to your Proficiency Bonus. On a success, their movement speed is halved until the end of their next turn. The {@condition frightened} creature can remake the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

optionalfeature.name: Support Strap
entries: The heavy weapon can be used by small sized creatures with no issue.

optionalfeature.name: Team Strike
entries: When you make an attack roll, you can allow the subject of your Honor Bond to also make an attack. Your Honor Bound can use its reaction to immediately make one attack, adding {@dice 1d4} to the to hit roll.

optionalfeature.name: Teamwork in Servitude

feature: Pact of the Chain and Master Warlock

entries: Your minion, familiar, and any creatures summoned through the use of a conjuration spell gain the Pact Tactics feature but only in relation to each other and you.

optionalfeature.name: The Bank
entries: You gain a sapphire worth 1,000gp that can be used as a material component for the spell instant summons, which you learn when you take this invocations. This sapphire is not consumed when you end the spell, instead, the spell simply ends, and you can reuse the sapphire on another cast of instant summons.If you lose this sapphire you can expend 1,000gp from your Deep Pockets to produce a new one, doing so causes the other to vanish.

optionalfeature.name: Thermal Scope
entries: Looking through this scope allows you to see all creatures within your firearm's short range, even hidden behind cover so long as that creature produces heat.

optionalfeature.name: Tripod
entries: You can deploy this as a Bonus Action on a surface. If you do not move on this turn, the Firearm gains a +3 to hit if attacking a target who did not move in their last round.

optionalfeature.name: Umbral Armour
entries: When you begin combat while wearing medium armour you gain {@dice 1d4} + Charisma modifier temporary hit points. This bonus increases to {@dice 1d6} at 9th level, {@dice 1d8} at 13th, {@dice 1d10} at 17th level, and {@dice 1d12} at 20th level.

optionalfeature.name: White Phosphorous
entries: Fire damage dealt by this weapon ignores Fire resistance.

optionalfeature.name: Wither
entries: Tier 3 Arcana. Creatures affected by The Forbidden Spell have their Strength and Dexterity scores halved until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Age
entries: Darfellan can grow to be 130 years old, reaching maturity around 25.

entries.name: Size
entries: Darfellan are 6-7ft on average, being quite bulky. Your Size is medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Darfellan have darkvision in a range of 60ft, seeing things in darkness in shades of deep blues.

entries.name: Language
entries: Darfellan speak, read and write Common and Aquan.

entries.name: Darfellan Skills
entries: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Perception}, or {@skill Survival}. Darfellan are all also proficient the {@item net|phb}, {@item trident|phb}, {@item javelin|phb}, and {@item spear|phb}.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your tough skin provides you a Natural Armor Class of 13 + Your Dexterity Bonus. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield’s benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Ice Diver
entries: You take no penalties from swimming in freezing water. Additionally, you can hold your breath a number of hours equal to their Constitution Modifier + 1 (minimum 1).

entries.name: Age
entries: Imps mature after 3 months and can live for up to 50 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Imps grow up to 1ft in height. Your Size is small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 20ft, and you have a flying speed of 40ft.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: Imps are Fiends.

entries.name: Language
entries: Imps speak, read and write Common and Infernal.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Imps have 60ft of Darkvision, and see in shades of crimson.

entries.name: Age
entries: Modrons are born fully mature. Modrons die after exactly 298 years, to the nanosecond.

entries.name: Size
entries: Modron vary precisely in size, depending on their classification. Your Size is determined by your number of sides.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30ft.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: Modrons are Constructs.

entries.name: Language
entries: Modron speak, read and write Common and Modron.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Modrons are Proficient in Tinker’s Tools.

entries.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries: Modron’s minds are regimented, granting them advantage on Saving Throws against being Charmed. Creatures also have disadvantage on Deception checks against you to lie.

entries.name: Primus’ Legacy
entries: Modrons can be made in various ways, and depending on the type of Modron you are, you gain different features. When you select this race, select one of the below options. Additionally, when your Proficiency Bonus Increases as a part of leveling up, you can choose another option and replace these features with that.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Myconids are pacifist and lean towards Neutrality on most occasions.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is small, but you're a fast grower. You start out anywhere between 1 and 2 feet tall. You become a Medium Creature when you become a Myconid Adult, growing to 5ft. You grow to just under 7ft as a Sovereign.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 25ft. Your speed increases to 30ft when you become a Myconid Adult.

entries.name: Fungal Growth
entries: Myconids go through a process of evolution as they mature. At level 1, you are a Myconid Sprout. At level 4, you become a Myconid Adult. At level 7, you become a Myconid Sovereign. Your features change based off what stage of life you are in.

entries.name: Sunlight Sickness
entries: While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws.

entries.name: Melding Rest
entries: Myconids don’t need to sleep. Instead, they release calming spores, remaining semiconscious for 6 hours a day. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

entries.name: Underdark Vision
entries: You have darkvision in a range of 120ft.

entries.name: Fungal Resilience
entries: Your fungal body has an easy time adapting to strange airborne toxins. You face no negative effects of polluted air, and have advantage on saving throws against harmful gases and vapors, such as {@spell Cloudkill}..

entries.name: Spores
entries: As your Myconid matures, they learn ways to use their spores. As a Sprout, you can use your Rapport Spores. As an Adult, you can use Pacifying Spores. The Sovereign learns Hallucination Spores.

entries.name: Rapport Spores (1/day)
entries: A 10-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren’t undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

entries.name: Pacifying Spores (1/day)
entries: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + prof + CON) or be stunned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Hallucination Spores (1/day)
entries: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + prof + CON) or be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target is incapacitated while it hallucinates. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Sovereign
entries: When you become a Sovereign, you gain the Powerful Build feature and have advantage on all checks to communicate with other Myconid, as they see you as someone to be respected.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Myconid can write and understand Common and Undercommon. Myconids can speak any language they can understand by expelling spores at a creature.

reward.name: Angel Skin
entries: Gain resistance to radiant damage and grants additional +1 to all magical healing received
Evil aligned creatures have advantage on attack rolls against you

reward.name: Blessing of the Four Winds: Eastern Archer
entries: Each boon can be activated as a bonus action once every 30 days. Once used five times the blessing fades as the spirit of the sage moves on.

entries.name: Eastern Archer
entries: As a bonus action, you can call upon the spirit of Eurus, Sage of the East wind, to guide your shots. For the next minute if you miss a ranged weapon attack, you can immediately remake the attack, no expending a new piece of ammunition, with disadvantage. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again for 30 days.

reward.name: Blessing of the Four Winds: Northern Sentinel
entries: Each boon can be activated as a bonus action once every 30 days. Once used five times the blessing fades as the spirit of the sage moves on.

entries.name: Northern Sentinel
entries: As a bonus action, you can call upon the spirit of Borealis, Sage of the Northern Wind, to protect yourself and allies. For the next minute, ranged attacks against you and allied creatures within 10ft of you have disadvantage and if you are hit by a melee weapon attack the damage is reduced by 1d4. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again for 30 days.

reward.name: Blessing of the Four Winds: Southern Slayer
entries: Each boon can be activated as a bonus action once every 30 days. Once used five times the blessing fades as the spirit of the sage moves on.

entries.name: Southern Slayer
entries: As a bonus action, you can call upon the spirit of Notus, Sage of the Southern Wind, to bolster your blows with the strength of storms. For the next minute, if you hit with a melee weapon attack, your weapon deals 1d6 extra thunder damage. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again for 30 days.

reward.name: Blessing of the Four Winds: Western Winds
entries: Each boon can be activated as a bonus action once every 30 days. Once used five times the blessing fades as the spirit of the sage moves on.

entries.name: Western Winds
entries: As a bonus action, you can call upon the spirit of Zephyrus, Sage of the Western Wind, to speed your step. For the next minute, you gain 10 feet of speed in all forms and your jump speed is doubled. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again for 30 days.

reward.name: Boon of Minor Combat Might
entries: You have overcome mighty foes in the arena, and have been granted power beyond this.
The first time you would drop to 0 hit points, you instead drop to 1. You can only use this feature once per week.
Additionally, rolling a 19 on a Death Saving Throw now makes you stand with one hit point.

reward.name: Draconic Elemental Affinity (Dragonborn)
entries: You gain Damage reduction equal to your Proficiency Bonus for your Dragon breath weapon element.
Your breath weapon is now a recharge of 6 (not affected by the dragon's breath dragon jelly transformation).

You additionally have advantage on saving throws against terrain effects created by a mature dragon of your elemental type's territory/lair, such as extreme heat from a red dragon's volcano or acid pools in a black dragon's swamp.

reward.name: Draconic Elemental Affinity (Kobold)
entries: You gain resistance to the damage type of your associated colour.
Your breath weapon is now a recharge of 6 (not affected by the dragon's breath dragon jelly transformation).

You additionally have advantage on saving throws against terrain effects created by a mature dragon of your elemental type's territory/lair, such as extreme heat from a red dragon's volcano or acid pools in a black dragon's swamp.

reward.name: Dragon's Breath
entries: You gain a breath weapon. If you are not draconic, its type is random.
If you already have a breath weapon, you either gain an additional usage of it per rest, or its recharge die is lowered by 1.

reward.name: Dragon's Claws
entries: Your unarmed attacks deal {@dice 1d6} + STR slashing damage.
You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

reward.name: Dragon's Heart
entries: Advantage against Frightened and Charmed conditions.
Once Per Long rest, you can automatically succeed against a Charm or Frighten Effect

reward.name: Evolved Frontal Lobe
entries: You are considered to be always under the effect of {@spell detect thoughts}, and have advantage on insight checks made when done in this way. When probing deeper into a targets mind the DC is determined by your choice of Int, Wis, or Cha. If you are in a situation where you cannot concentrate on a spell, ie Rage, this is suppressed.
At the start of each turn where you are within 5 feet of five or more creatures and the effect is not suppressed, you must pass a DC 15 insight check or lose your action that turn.

reward.name: Hell Bound Soul
entries: Your body has been infused with the influence of the Nine Hells. Your creature type is now humanoid (fiend) allowing you to be effected by effects that would normally only effect fiends.

You are unable to deal radiant damage, any time you would deal radiant damage you deal necrotic damage instead. In addition, your Divine Smite feature now deals an additional damage die to Celestials but not Fiends.
Celestials find you distasteful and you have disadvantage on any Charisma checks made towards Celestials.

reward.name: Increased Eyesight
entries: You gain Blindsight of 5ft, and your Darkvision is increased by 30ft.

reward.name: Leech Lungs
entries: Can breath in any environment. When dealing damage with a spell that does psychic damage as its base damage type. deal additional damage equal to your prof bonus. (The leeches scream)
Disadvantage on saving throws against inhaled poisons or similar spells and effects. Must feed the leeches one pint of blood every day or suffer exhaustion.

reward.name: Primordial Champion
entries: While within 60ft of another champion, you gain a +1 to all saving throws for each additional champion besides yourself. In addition, once per turn when you deal damage with a spell or weapon attack you deal additional damage equal {@dice 1d6} of the damage type of each other champion (fire for Pyfrita, cold for Doluna, acid for Cavalkal, lightning for Elitanith).

reward.name: Speaker of the Wind
entries: This creature has been attuned the energies of Sky Titan and the Plane of Air. They gain the following features.
They learn to read and write Druidic.
Once per long rest the creature can cast Feather Fall without expending a spell slot.
At 5th level, they gain the ability to cast Warding Wind without expending a spell slot.
At 9th level they gain the ability to cast Wind Wall without expending a spell slot.
Once they have casted any of the three spells with this feature they cannot do so again until finish a long rest.
Your casting ability for these spells is Wisdom.

reward.name: Tough Scales
entries: While Unarmored, your AC is equal to 10 + DEX + Proficiency Bonus.
Creatures grappling you take damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus in piercing damage at the start of their turns.

reward.name: Troll Stomach
entries: Immune to effects of ingested poisons, gain damage absorption for ingested poisons
Must consume a days worth of food every hour awake or take a level of exhaustion

reward.name: Virulent Grung
entries: Through various Poisons being absorbed, your toxins have reached their pinnacle. Your DCs for all of your poisons are 19. Some Grung features are modified due to your Poisons.

entries.name: Poisonous Skin - Crawler Mucus
entries: Any creature that grapples you or otherwise comes into direct contact with your skin must succeed on a CON saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature no longer in direct contact with you can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a Creature poisoned by you remains in contact with you for over a round, they must repeat the saving throw and on another fail are then Paralyzed until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Fermented Toxins - Purple Wurm Poison
entries: Any time you deal Poison Damage, it is increased by an amount equal to your CON Modifier.

entries.name: Poisonous Spit - Midnight Tears/Memento Poison
entries: Once per turn, you can replace an attack and expel Midnight Tears or Memento Poison to a creature within 5ft of you. They must make a CON Save or be affected by Midnight Tears. You can use this feature Prof Bonus / LR.

entries.name: Toxic Secretions
entries: You can also apply a poison to any piercing weapon as part of an attack with that weapon. Your weapon attack deals an additional 2d4 Poison damage, and you can select 1 Poison at the Start of your turn, and all weapon attacks that deal Piercing Damage gain the following effect.

items.name: Death's Kiss
items.entry: The target must succeed on a CON saving throw or take an additional 2d6 Necrotic Damage damage. If they fail this save by 5 or more, their hit point maximum is reduced equal to the Necrotic Damage taken until they complete a Long Rest. On a Success, they take half of this amount.

items.name: Midnight Tears
items.entry: The target must succeed on a CON saving throw or take 4d6 Poison Damage, or 8d6 if it is within 1 hour of Midnight.

items.name: Purple Wurm
items.entry: The target must succeed on a CON saving throw or have their resistance to Poison Damage removed for 1 Minute. They can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of their turns.

entries.name: Madness of Time Confusion
entries: You always feel somewhat out of your body. You cannot tell time passage, and have disadvantage on saving throws against spells that would shunt you in time, freeze you in time, affect time in any way for you, or Chronurgy Spells. Failing a saving throw or otherwise being affected by a Time-related effect causes you to to take psychic damage equal to the spells level x 1d6. You also learn the Gift of Alacrity Spell (doesn't count against spells known, always prepared).

spell.name: Aqua Whip
entries: You lash out with a watery strike 5 feet wide and 15 feet long. Creatures within the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, and on a fail take {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage and are knocked prone. You can also use this to pull a loose object that isn't worn or carried within the spell's range to you
entriesHigherLevel: This spell’s damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level {@dice 2d4}, 11th level {@dice 3d4}, and 17th level {@dice 4d4}.

spell.name: Arcane Barrage
entries: Your body becomes enveloped in arcane energy. You shed bright light for 15ft, and dim light for another 15ft. Your movement speed becomes 0, you cannot benefit from movement in any way while this spell is active, and you have disadvantage on Dexterity Saving throws. While in this form, you gain access to a Ranged Spell attack roll, which deals {@dice 4d4} force damage + your casting modifier, with a range of 300 ft. As an Action, you can fire up to three of these Ranged Spell attacks while in this form. You can use an Action to regain your ability to move and your movement speed for the turn but lose the ability to make the aforementioned Shots, after which you can use a Bonus Action to reactivate this form, losing your movement once again.
When the spell ends, you have disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution Saving throws and Ability checks until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level slot or higher, you can fire an additional shot for every slot above 6th.

spell.name: Artist's Touch

components.m: a paint bruch, quill or similar artistic tool

entries: You conjure from the tip of your brush or quill a single magical effect as a manifestation of your artistic spirit. You can create one of the following effects:

items: You instantly cause a message no more than 25 words in length to appear on a surface within range. The message appears in ink or paint and remains for 1 hour.

You touch unsculpted clay, a bottle of paint, or an ink pot and immediately shape it into an artistic work no larger than 2ft in any dimension. The work is fair but unimpressive to any discerning eye. The work remains for 1 hour.

You draw or sculpt a simple object worth no more than 1 gp and it becomes real. The object is brittle and breaks under heavy use, close inspection reveals it to be made of worthless paste. If you have an example of an object on you when you cast the spell you can duplicate it, such as a specific key, otherwise the objects are generic. The object lasts for 1 hour or until it breaks.

You summon forth a splash of ink or paint at one target within 15 ft attempting to blind them. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded|PHB} until the end of their next turn.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action. If you cast a new one the oldest effect ends.

spell.name: Blade Halo

components.m: one miniature blade worth 5gp for each blade you summon

entries: A circle of four shimmering blades appears in your space, spinning around your body. The blades follow you if you move. As a bonus action on your turn, you can hurl one of the blades at a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack, on a hit the target takes {@dice 2d8} magical slashing damage. The blade is then destroyed. You can instead of hurling the blade, grasp it, and make a melee spell attack which does {@dice 2d10} magical slashing damage on hit. For each blade remaining creatures that end their turn within 5ft of you take {@dice 1d4} magical slashing.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot, you summon one additional blade.

spell.name: Bramble Barrier
entries: A mass of thick brambles and vines rapidly grows from a point within range. The brambles form into a tough dome with a diameter of 15ft, a height of 10ft and a thickness of 1ft. The dome has an AC of 13, has 30 hit points, with vulnerability to fire and immunity to psychic and poison. The brambles remain for the duration or as long as they have hit points. When casting the spell, you can choose to concentrate on it.

While concentrating on this spell, the brambles heal 5 hit points at the start of your turn. If you would lose concentration, the brambles remain for the remainder of their duration or once their hit points reach 0. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or higher, the brambles are conjured with an additional 10 maximum hit points.

spell.name: Brilliant Spectre
entries: You transmute a lantern's flame into a Will-o'-Wisp. The Will-o'-Wisp is friendly to you, and remains for the spell's duration or once its hit points become 0. As a bonus action on your turn, you can command the Will-o'-Wisp to perform an action. Additionally, you can give the Will-o'-Wisp a command once a certain event happens, like 'Notify me if anyone enters this area' or 'Attack any undead you see'. You can have up to three Will-o'-Wisp under your control at a time from this spell's effects. If you already have three Will-o'-Wisps under your control and you cast this spell again, that new Will-o'-Wisp becomes hostile towards you.

spell.name: Chains of the Black Bloom
entries: You create a flurry of black petals and launch them at a creature within range. Make a spell attack roll against that creature, and on a hit they take {@dice 4d10} slashing damage as rapidly moving petals tear around them. If this attack hits a creature, that creature is also {@condition restrained}, as the petals turn to solid chains. If the spell hits, then all creatures of your choice within 10ft of that creature must make a Dexterity Saving throw, or also be {@condition restrained}. Creatures {@condition restrained} by this spell are freed at the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you deal an additional {@dice 1d10} damage for every slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Conjure Armory
entries: You pull forth a magical weapon rack. You additionally create up to 5 magical weapons of your choice and one suit of armor of your choice. If you create a weapon that requires ammunition, you also create 20 pieces of its type of ammunition. The rack, weapons, armor, and ammunition last for the duration, after which they vanish into dust.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you create one additional weapon per slot above 3rd, and 1 additional set of armor for every two slots above 3rd.
If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or higher, the weapons are +1.
If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or higher, the weapons are +2.
If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th or higher, the weapons are +3.

spell.name: Decay
entries: You select a creature within range, as their body begins to rapidly rot. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, and on a fail the target takes {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage and deals half damage with all weapon attacks that use strength until the end of your next turn.
This spell’s damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level {@dice 2d6}, 11th level {@dice 3d6}, and 17th level {@dice 4d6}.

spell.name: Deja Vu
entries: You slap a creature within range. They must make an Intelligence Saving throw, and on a fail, forget what happened in the past 6 seconds. If you or your allies had attacked this creature 10 minutes prior to casting the spell, they have advantage on the Saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or 4th level, the creature forgets the contents of the occurred up to 1 minute ago.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or 6th level, the creature forgets the contents of the occurred up to 10 minutes ago.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or 8th level, the creature forgets the contents of the occurred up to 1 hour ago.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the creature forgets the contents of the occurred up to 1 week ago.

spell.name: Dungrin's Light Spire
entries: You create a light spire within range, a glowing tree-like object that has a height of 10ft. It gives off dim light in a 30ft radius, and bright light within a 10ft radius. Creatures of your choice standing within its bright light gain a +1 to all saving throws. Creatures within the dim light do not benefit from being {@condition Invisible} Creatures can only benefit from one Light Spire at a time.

spell.name: Dying Gasp
entries: When a creature dies, you can grasp its dying energies to force it to make an attack against one creature within its reach. If it has a weapon the attack deals that weapon’s damage but uses your Spell Attack bonus for the attack and damage roll, if it does not have a weapon it deals 1d4 for a Tiny creature, 1d6 for small, 1d8 for medium, 1d10 for large, 1d12 for huge, and 2d8 for gargantuan.

spell.name: Elvinus' Ward of Conflux
entries: You conjure a ward of primal energy that surrounds your body and protects you from elemental magics. Choose one element from fire, cold, lightning, thunder, or acid damage. You gain resistance to that damage type. When you take damage from one of the listed damage types you can use your reaction to gain resistance to that damage type for the rest of the duration of the spell including the inciting instance of damage. Every time you use your reaction to switch resistances it replaces the previous resistance. In addition, any melee attacks that you hit with deal an extra {@dice 2d10} of the element you are currently resistant to.

spell.name: Epoch Shift

components.m: an egg, ashes of a creature, and an hourglass worth at least 250gp all of which the spell consumes

entries: You pick a point within range and in a 20ft radius around that point you wrest control of the time there. Choose one of the following effects from below to take effect:

entries.name: Accelerate
entries: Each creature in the radius has its speed doubled. It gains an additional action on each of its turns which can only be used to Attack (one weapon attack), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use and Object. In addition any effects on the creature progress their durations twice at the start of their turns, including effects that would damage them such as being on fire or poisoned. Creatures age twice as fast while in the area.

entries.name: Arrest
entries: Arrest: You halt the natural flow of time in the area. Effect that would take place at the start or end of a creatures turn do not take effect. Creatures do not age in the area. If you use this effect on an area where time does not normally flow, such as the Astral Sea, or an area effected by this spell or Time Lock you can return time to its normal flow.

entries.name: Decelerate
entries: Each creature in the radius has its movement speed halved. They receive a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and can’t use reactions. At the start and end of a creatures turn roll 1d2, on a 2 effects that would normally occur at that point do not occur. Creatures in the radius age at half the normal rate.

As a bonus action on your turn after the initial casting, you can alter the effect to one of the other effects. When changed any creature in the radius can make a Wisdom saving throw, on a success the new effect does not take effect until they end their turn in the radius.

spell.name: Fate Sealed
entries: You dash 30 feet forward pulling everything in your path and within your weapon’s reach on either side. Each creature hit must make a dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 5d8} force damage, or half as much on a fail. Those that fail are also left prone after being knocked into the air

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level slot or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every slot above 5th.

spell.name: Final Crescendo
entries: Running your fingers down the bowstring a beam of silver light springs towards your target and music fills the air. Select a creature within range, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a fail, you make them the target for a barrage of sonic attacks. On a success, they are still targeted but take half damage from any future effects. ...the creature. Each additional time you use your bonus action in this way you deal {@dice 2d8} additional thunder damage. Once you reach 8d8 damage your bonus action instead deals {@dice 8d8} thunder damage in a 5ft radius around the target, each creature, including the target, must make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, they take half damage. After this happens the spell ends. The spell ends early if you use your bonus action to do anything other than continuing the spell or if you are {@condition restrained} or disarmed of the spellcasting focus.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot, the damage increase by {@dice 1d8} for every spell slot above 4th.

spell.name: Frozen Winds of the Tomb
entries: You blow a freezing wind which envelops creatures in a 15 ft cone in front of you. All creatures but those with resistance or immunity to Cold Damage must make a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failed save, ice begins to grow around their body. As an action, you can blow more freezing wind during the spell's duration. Creatures that fail subsequent saving throws have the freezing effect amplified. If a creature leaves the spell's cone, all effects of the spell are removed from them

items: (1 fail) Their speed is halved until the start of your next turn.
(2 fails) Previous effects, and the creature has disadvantage on all skill checks.
(3 fails) Previous effects, and attack rolls they make before the start of your next turn have disadvantage.
(4 fails) Previous effects, and the creature becomes {@condition restrained} until the start of your next turn.
(5 fails) The creature becomes petrified in ice for 10 minutes. Any physical changes that occur while petrified carry over once they return to their original state.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the length of the cone increases by 5 feet for every spell slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Globes of the Land
entries: You designate two 15ft radius spheres within range and swap the contents of them. Each creature in the sphere moves to a new location in the other sphere of your choice along with everything they are wearing and carrying. An unwilling creature must make a Charisma saving throw, on a success they are not moved. Objects are also moved unless they are affixed to the ground, such as a plant, or are not fully inside the radius, such as a cart that is halfway into the radius.

spell.name: Grasp of the Interred
entries: Skeletal hands erupt from the ground and grasp at creatures in the radius of the spell. Each creature must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 4d12} necrotic damage and become {@condition restrained}. On a success, they take half damage and are not {@condition restrained}. For the duration of the spell, the area becomes difficult terrain and a creature that ends its turn inside must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 2d12} necrotic damage, half as much on a success. When the spell ends, the difficult terrain vanishes and any {@condition restrained} creatures are released.

spell.name: Headlong Rush
entries: You embolden yourself with heroism. For the duration, your speed and jump distance/height is doubled when moving directly towards a hostile creature. After finishing moving, you can use your action to immediately make a melee weapon attack against a creature. On a hit, they take {@dice 2d8} bludgeoning damage + your spellcasting modifier and are knocked prone.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you deal an additional {@dice 1d8} bludgeoning damage for every slot above 1st.

spell.name: Hero's Helping Hand
entries: You give a hand to an injured creature. They regain {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting modifier in hit points. If the creature was at 0 hit points, they immediately stand up if they were prone, and restore the highest number of hit points possible for the die rolled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the creature regains an additional {@dice 1d4} hit points for every slot above 1st.

spell.name: Invigorating Word
entries: You speak a magical word that fills a creature with strength and energy. Choose one creature other than yourself within range that can hear you and understands at least one language you speak. Immediately after you cast the spell, that creature can use its reaction to make one action. This action can only be used to take the Attack action (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage (and move 5 feet), or Use an Object.

spell.name: Knox's Devious Door
entries: You conjure a plane of force into existence that fills one door or passageway within range. If the passageway or doorway is more than 15 feet in any dimension, the spell fails. Otherwise, the plane of force fills the space and is 1 inch thick. Any creatures you designate when you cast the spell can pass through the plane but other creatures cannot.

The plane has 50 hit points with 5 AC and vulnerability to force damage, immunity to poison and psychic and resistance to all other forms of damage. A creature can attempt a DC 20 Strength check to force their way through the plane. On a success, they pass through the plane.

spell.name: Knox's Numerous Platforms
entries: You summon a pane of magical force 10ftx10ft and 1 inch thick. The pane can appear in an unoccupied space within range and be oriented in any direction. The pane can be opaque or transparent or somewhere in the middle. For the duration of the spell you can summon another pane as an action or move up to three summoned platforms up to 30ft. If you summon more panes than the spell slot used to cast the spell one pane of your choice vanishes. The panes can support 1000lbs of weight each, if more weight than this is applied to one it shatters

Nothing can physically pass through the panes. They are immune to all damage but force and cannot be dispelled by {@spell dispel magic}. Each pane has an AC of 10 and 25 hit points. If a platform is destroyed it does not count against the number of summoned platforms.

spell.name: Last Light
entries: A burst of brilliant light ushers from you, each creature of your choice in a 20ft radius must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn. You shed bright light in a 20ft radius. At the start of you next turn the light vanishes and a burst of necrotic energy dealing {@dice 2d8} necrotic damage to each creature that was {@condition blinded} by this spell and still within range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the range increases by 5 feet and the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level past 1st.

spell.name: Light Charge
entries: You launch forth an intense ball of light. Creatures within its radius have their movement speed halved. As a Bonus Action on a subsequent turns after casting the spell, you can cause the light burst, which ends its effects. Creatures within the cube must make a Constitution Saving Throw, and on a fail take {@dice 4d6} radiant damage, or half as much to creatures that pass the saving throw. Each turn you are concentrating on the spell, it deals an additional {@dice 1d6} radiant damage when it bursts. If you would lose concentration on the spell at any time, it immediately bursts

spell.name: Light's Embrace
entries: A creature of your choice within range begins to glow with brilliant light, which causes them to shed bright light for 5ft, and dim light for another 5ft. During the spell's duration, creatures that can see the light have disadvantage on attack rolls that target that creature.

spell.name: Lightning Rush
entries: Your body becomes enveloped in lightning. You become immune to lightning damage, you can squeeze through a space as small as 1 inch, and your movement speed is doubled. While this spell is active, you can take the Dash action as a bonus action, you don’t provoke attacks of opportunity, and any creatures you move through must make a DEX Save. On a fail, they take {@dice 3d6} lightning damage and are knocked prone, or half as much on a success. When the spell ends, your hair becomes frizzy.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every slot above 4th.

spell.name: Luminescent Lazerbeam
entries: A shining line of light fires out from your hands in a line 150 feet long and 5 feet wide in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Constitution Saving throw. Creatures made of darkness, shadows, or smoke have disadvantage on the Saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 6d6} Radiant damage on a failed save and is {@condition blinded} until the end of their turn, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every slot above 4th.

spell.name: Lunar Lance
entries: You conjure moonlight above your head and fire it in a spray of razor-sharp lances. For each creature in 100 feet long and 5 feet wide line make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, you deal {@dice 5d8} radiant damage and the next creature hit takes one less d8 of damage. The spell ends if it reaches 0 d8's of damage or hits its maximum range. If any creature in the line is {@condition invisible} you ignore the disadvantage imposed by not seeing them and if you hit, their {@condition invisibility} ends

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot beyond 3rd.

spell.name: Magic Conduit

components.m: a spell scroll of a level 3 or lower spell slot, which is consumed

entries: A circle of arcane glyphs and runes appears on the ground within range. The circle has a 10ft radius and gives off faint light. While standing within the circle, yourself and those other creatures can use a Bonus Action to draw power from the circle, making the next spell they cast as an Action this turn upcasted by one level. They must remain in the circle while casting the spell for the increase to take effect. The conduit has 8 charges, and absorbing its power consumes a charge.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot, the conduit gains an additional 2 charges per every spell slots above 4th.

spell.name: Magnetic Sphere

components.m: a small magnet worth 10gp, which is consumed

entries: You conjure a reflective metallic sphere in range. The sphere is 1ft in radius and hovers 5ft above the ground. It emits a magnetic force in a 45ft radius of the sphere that pulls in metal objects. Upon casting the spell, entering its zone for the first time, or starting your turn within its zone,loose metal objects within the magnetic force are flung towards the sphere and stick to it for the duration of the spell. Metal objects that are held require the wielder to make a Strength Save, and on a fail the objects are flung towards the sphere and stick to it. To retrieve an object stuck on the sphere, a creature must make a Strength Check equal to the spell save DC to successfully remove them from the sphere.

Creatures wearing metal armor are more susceptible to its effects. A creature wearing medium armor made primarily of metal must make a Strength Save, and on a fail, their body is flung towards the sphere and will then be stuck to it. A creature wearing light armor also makes the save, but with advantage. A creature wearing heavy armor makes the save with disadvantage. While stuck to the sphere, the creature is considered {@condition restrained}. A creature may attempt an {@skill Athletics} check to remove itself or another creature stuck to the sphere. The same advantages and disadvantages as detailed above depending on the armor type applies to this check.

Creatures that are pulled to the centre of the sphere by its effect take fall damage equivalent of the range traveled. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level, when casting the spell you can instead have the orb repulse objects made of metal. Objects are then instead flung outwards of the sphere’s zone of magnetism. Creatures wearing armor are still affected by the same advantages and disadvantages as detailed above.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level slot or higher, its radius is doubled and the caster can alternate between its two modes as a Bonus Action.

spell.name: Minor Magnetism
entries: You affect an item made of metal that you can see with a small magnetic force. You generate one of the following effects:

items: You move the object up to 30 feet.
You bend a piece of non magical metal up to 45 degrees.

entries: Creatures cannot be damaged by the movement of the object affected by the spell, nor can the spell move more than 15 pounds at a time. This cannot affect an item currently wielded by a creature, unless the creature willingly allows it to be moved or the item is not.

spell.name: Minor Smite
entries: A weapon you are holding becomes cloaked in divine light. The next attack you make with the weapon during the duration uses your casting modifier to calculate its to-hit bonus and its damage bonus, instead of your strength. If you hit a creature with this weapon, they must make a Wisdom saving throw, and on a fail they either cannot take reactions until the start of your next turn or are knocked prone (your choice).

spell.name: Molten Cascade
entries: You conjure molten magma from your hands and launch it from you in a 20ft long and 10ft wide line. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity Saving Throw, and on a fail take {@dice 4d8} Fire Damage. Creatures that fail are then {@condition restrained}, and on a subsequent turn must make a Strength Check against your Spell Save DC to break free from the now cooled rock that has encased them. Creatures that succeed take half of this damage and are not encased in rock. Another creature can use their action to break free someone trapped in the cooled rock.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot beyond 3rd.

spell.name: Orb of Recall
entries: You conjure an arcane orb that flies out in a straight line. All creatures that the orb passes through must make a DEX Save, and on a fail take {@dice 2d6} force damage. At the end of your turn, the orb flies back to your position, then dissipates. If the orb would pass through the same creature twice, they are unaffected by the 2nd pass

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every slot above 1st.

spell.name: Overload
entries: A pulse of arcane energy launches out from your hand at a creature within range. Make a spell attack roll, a target hit by this takes {@dice 1d4} force damage. If you cast a spell in the same turn as casting this cantrip, you take force damage equal to the level of that spell slot expended, a cantrip deals 1 damage.

spell.name: Recurring Remedy
entries: You generate a consistent stream of healing. Select a creature within range. For the duration, at the start of each of their turns they heal {@dice 1d4} hit points so long as they are conscious.

spell.name: Reveal
entries: With a wave of the hand and a magic word you bring to light that which is hidden. When you cast the spell choose one creature, object, or 10-foot cube within range. Any illusion spell of 2nd level or lower inside that area or effecting a creature or object immediately ends, if the spell is {@spell Invisibility} or {@spell Greater Invisibility} the spell ends regardless of level. For each spell of 3rd level or higher in the area, make an ability check with your spell casting ability. The DC for this check is 10 + spell's level. On a success the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the leave of the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Scribe

components.m: a silver feathered quill worth at least 50gp and a blank sheet of parchment.

entries: You touch a passage of text that is no larger than 5 square feet and transfer it instantly onto a nearby piece of parchment. The text is copied exactly including signatures, mistakes, or any other oddities within the original text. A DC 25 Investigation check can reveal the subtle markings that reveal magic was used in creating the text but does not necessarily reveal it to be a fake

spell.name: Scurry of Quicklings
entries: You create seven illusory copies of quicklings around you, as you too change your appearance to look like a quickling. All quicklings are indistinguishable from another, and if a creature attempts to attack an illusory quickling it puffs into purple smoke. As a part of casting this spell, you can have all seven quicklings to move in any separate direction you desire up to 120ft. Additionally, your walking speed becomes 120ft for the duration. At the end of the spell's duration, all quicklings will attempt to hide where ever they can. If they cannot hide anywhere, they puff into purple smoke.

spell.name: Shadow Self
entries: You create a shadowy duplicate of yourself that appears within 5ft of you. As a bonus action, you can perceive through the duplicate’s senses, causing your body to go blind and deaf until you use another bonus action to switch back. The duplicate can move 30ft on your turn, but must remain within 60ft of you, or the spell ends. Once, while the spell is in effect, you can swap places with the duplicate as a reaction. You can also take this reaction when you are hit with an attack, causing the attack to miss. Once you swap with the duplicate, it disappears and the spell ends.

spell.name: Sinister Return
entries: You touch a creature with Necromantic energy. Make a spell attack roll, and on a hit the creature takes {@dice 6d6} Necrotic Damage. A hit humanoid must then make a Constitution saving throw, and on a fail become cursed. If the cursed creature dies before completing three Long Rests, they rise as a zombie under your control.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot beyond 3rd.

spell.name: Strike Reflect
entries: As a reaction to taking damage from a melee weapon attack, you strike back at your foe with magical force. You gain resistance to that attacks damage and the attacker then takes force damage equal to the damage you took, and then the attacker must make a Strength Saving Throw. On a fail, they are pushed back 15ft.

spell.name: Tempest
entries: A tornado up to 30ft in a straight line. Creatures that enter the tornado or start their turn within the tornado must make a Strength Saving throw, and on a fail are flung up into the air inside of the tornado. Creatures affected by the tornado take {@dice 5d4} bludgeoning damage when they fail the saving throw, and cannot concentrate on spells, fail dexterity saving throws, cannot use a fly speed if they have one and are deafened. Creatures affected are flung a number of feet into the air equal to {@dice 1d10} x 10 when they start their turn. If a creature goes higher than the top of the tornado, they are shot out of the top of the tornado in a random direction and fall. They fly a number of feet equal to the remaining distance they would have travelled upwards.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level slot or higher, the cube size is increased by 5ft per spell slot above 5th level.

spell.name: The Forbidden Spell
entries: You lash out with magical energy at a creature within range. Make a spell attack roll against them, and on a hit they take {@dice 1d6} Force Damage. That creature also removes {@dice 1d4} from their next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.
This spell can also be cast as a leveled spell, dealing an additional {@dice 2d6} per casting slot level used.
This spell's base damage increases by {@dice 1d6} at 5th level, 11th, and 17th level.
If someone casts Wish and attempts to recreate this spell it is cast at 9th level, and the caster incurs the penalties described in using Wish to do anything but cast a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell can also be cast as a leveled spell, dealing an additional {@dice 2d6} per casting slot level used.

spell.name: Time Lock

components.m: a small doll and an hourglass worth 25gp

entries: You reach out with grasping magical forces to freeze a target in time and space. Choose one target in range, that target must make a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition stunned}. While {@condition stunned} in this way the target is not aware of its surroundings and is immune to all damage. The target cannot be moved from its current location, even remaining airborne if the ground beneath it is removed. At the end of each of its turns the target can make a Wisdom saving throw, on a success the spell ends. When the spell ends, including if they succeed on the saving throw, the target can only take an action or bonus action and has their movement speed halved until the end of their next turn.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher you can target one additional creature.

spell.name: Toxic Earth
entries: You place your hand on the ground and pour corruptive energies into it turning the very earth toxic to those that touch it. The poisoned area consists of up to 5 15ft cubes, which you can arrange as you wish. Each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube. The area inside each cube is difficult terrain and each time a creature starts its turn inside one of the cubes it must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 4d10} poison damage and become poisoned until the start of its next turn, while poisoned in this way the creature’s speed is halved. On a successful save it takes half as much damage and is not poisoned.

spell.name: Warrior's Epitaph
entries: Choose a location in range. A shimmering magical banner appears at that location. Each creature of your choice within 30ft of the banner gains advantage on all attack rolls made until the end of their next turn. In addition, whenever an ally starts its turn within 15 feet of the banner, they gain {@dice 1d4} + your spell casting ability mod in temporary hit points. A creature can pick up the banner and move it after it has appeared

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or 5th level slot, the amount of temporary hit points gained at the end of each turn increases to {@dice 1d6}, at 6th or 7th level it increases to {@dice 1d8}, and at 8th or 9th it increases to {@dice 1d10}.

spell.name: Wayfinder's Monument

components.m: a small tower built from nearby materials.

entries: You create a small monument, which creates a magical connection to you. During the spell's duration, you always know where the monument is, how far you are from the monument, if creatures of one certain type (your choice when you cast the spell) has passed within a 15ft radius of the monument, or if the monument is destroyed, which can be done by toppling the tower. Additionally once per 24 hours, you can channel for 10 minutes to transfer your senses into the monument, while your body becomes {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to your surroundings. You can see, hear and smell from the monument, but you cannot speak through it. The connection ends when you choose to end it, or when you take damage.
If you cast this spell on the same area every day for 6 months, it becomes permanent until destroyed or dispelled.

spell.name: Whirlpool
entries: You conjure a rapid pool of twisting water at a point within range. Creatures within a 15ft cube must make a strength saving throw. On a fail, they take {@dice 3d10} bludgeoning damage and are moved as close to the centre of the cube as they can. If they would knock into another creature, both creatures take {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage. If this spell is cast affecting creatures in water, they have disadvantage on the saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell deals an additional {@dice 1d10} damager per spell slot above 2nd level.

spell.name: Wishing Star
entries: You utter a magical prayer. At the beginning of your second turn after casting this spell, select up to 3 creatures within range. A comet flies by them, as they heal 45 hit points split between them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot or higher, it takes one less turn to complete.

subclass.name: Path of the Mechanical Menace
subclassFeatures: Path of the Mechanical Menace|Barbarian|PHB|Mechanical Menace|TftJC|3

subclass.name: College of the War Poet
subclassFeatures: College of the War Poet|Bard|PHB|War Poet|TftJC|3

subclass.name: College of Tomfoolery
subclassFeatures: When The Fool Fools You, Who Is The Fool?|Bard|PHB|Tomfoolery|TftJC|6

subclass.name: Circle of the Iron Heretic
subclassFeatures: Circle of the Iron Heretic|Druid|PHB|Iron Heretic|TftJC|2

subclass.name: Way of the Divergent Body
subclassFeatures: Way of the Divergent Body|Monk|PHB|Divergent Body|TftJC|3

subclass.name: Way of the Four Elements 2.0
subclassFeatures: Way of the Four Elements 2.0|Monk|PHB|Four Elements 2.0|TftJC|3

subclass.name: Way of the God Hand
subclassFeatures: Way of the God Hand|Monk|PHB|God Hand|TftJC|3

subclass.name: Oath of the Masked Rider
subclassFeatures: Oath of the Masked Rider|Paladin|PHB|Masked Rider|TftJC|3

subclass.name: Immortal Guard
subclassFeatures: Master of the Gilded Arts|Warden|TftJC|Immortal Guard|TftJC|7

subclassFeature.name: Dasher Weapons
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, you gain access to two different types of weapons. Working for one minute, you can imbue a pair of shortswords or a pair of whips with your Artificer magic transforming them into either the Flip Swords or Silver Tethers, respectfully (you are proficient in these weapons). You can only either have one of these options active at a time. If you would imbue one of these weapons with an Infusion, both are affected by the same infusion (this only counts as one infusion being active).

entries.name: Flip Swords
entries: These blades now have curved handles and guards, allowing you to hold them in a reversed grip so that the blades protect your forearms. While wielding both of the Blades, you gain the following features.

items: You gain a +1 to your AC.
Creatures hit by your blades lose 5ft of their walking speed per hit until the start of your next turn.
You can add your ability modifier for damage dealt with your off handed weapon.

entries.name: Silver Tethers
entries: These whips now have retractable metal lines.

items: The whips have a reach of 10ft and deal 1d6 slashing damage. They gain an additional 5ft of reach at 5th, 9th, 13th, and 17th level.

While wielding the whips, you gain a climb speed equal to your walking speed, as you can use them similar to grappling hooks. They are strong enough to support your weight plus one additional medium or smaller creature.
You can cast Artificer spells originating from the ends of your Tethers, allowing you to cast spells up to the reach with the Tethers.

subclassFeature.name: Derby Blades
entries: At 3rd level, you learn to invent Derby Blades. Derby Blades are a magical set of shoes that you can create as an action on any set of shoes you are currently wearing, provided you have your Cobbler's Tools in hand.
You gain the following benefits while wearing the Derby Blades:

items: Your walk speed is increased by 5 at 5th level, 10 at 9th level, 15 at 13th level, and 20 at 17th level.
You can use your Derby Blades as an Arcane Focus for your Artificer Spells.

For every 5ft you move in a straight line without turning before making a melee attack with a Derby Dasher weapon, you deal an additional 1 Damage, capping the maximum damage up to your Artificer level + your INT Modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Derby Dasher Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Derby Dasher Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, and they don’t count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Derby Dasher
entries: Derby Dasher is a newer specialization found in the world of inventing, who specializes in hi-tech mobility and movement. Their ability for generating high velocity strikes and quick escapes makes them powerful infiltrators and skirmishers. To help with their abilities, they have invented new pieces of gear to help them get in, and dash out.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency in Cobbler's Tools. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: At 5th level, you can attack twice rather than once whenever you take the Attack action on you turn.

subclassFeature.name: Shocking Strikes
entries: At 9th level, you generate static along your weapons. Weapon attacks made by you deal an additional 1d6 lightning damage. Additionally, you Dasher weapons gain bonus effects.

entries.name: Flip Swords
entries: Creatures hit by two attacks made by your Flip Swords in one turn have their walking speed set to 0 until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Silver Tethers
entries: Creatures hit by your main and and off hand Silver Tethers in one turn must make a Strength Save against your DC, and on a fail are restrained until the end of your next turn, or you move beyond your Tethers Maximum reach.

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Instincts
entries: At 15th level, your Derby Blades move faster than your enemies reactions. When you would be attacked by an enemy within 5ft of you, or subjected to a Saving Throw to which you are in the area of, you can use your reaction to move your movement. For melee attacks, you would no longer be in range of their attack. If this would move you out of the area of the effect of the Saving Throw, you are considered outside of its area of effect. You can use this feature a number of times per long rest equal to your Intelligence Modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Ghost-Shell
entries: In a flurry of Psionic Blasts and shining metal, a duo fight in Tandem with perfect precision. The Inventor who readies plans and their ultimate creation, an extension of their newfound powers and will. Combining the innovations in modern Construct Creations with latent Psionic ability, Ghost-Shell Artificers' connection to their creations is their most powerful asset. Seen as an extension of Body and Mind, these innovators come equipped with a powerful mechanical force tied to its master's brainwaves.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Power
entries: You harbor a wellspring of psionic energy within yourself. This energy is represented by Psionic Energy dice, which are each a d6. You have a number of these dice equal to twice times your proficiency bonus, and they fuel various psionic powers you have, which are detailed below.

Some of your powers expend the Psionic Energy die they use, as specified in a power’s description, and you can’t use a power if it requires you to use a die when your dice are all expended. You regain all your expended Psionic Energy dice when you finish a long rest. In addition, as a bonus action you can regain two expended Psionic Energy dice, but you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

When you reach certain levels in this class, the size of your Psionic Energy dice increases: at 5th level (1d8), 11th level(1d10), and 17th level (1d12). The powers below use your Psionic Energy dice.

entries.name: Shell Walk
entries: As a bonus action you can pull your shell 30ft closer to yourself or pull yourself closer to your shell. When you move in this way you do not provoke attacks of opportunity and your shell emits a burst of lightning either before or after it moves or before or after you move towards it.
