entries: Starting at 1st level, your skin becomes hard as steel, or shards of metal hover around you. While you aren't wearing armor, your AC equals 10 + your Constitution modifier. As a part of a short rest, you can disassemble suits of armor to increase your AC. Light armor provides 11 AC base, Medium provides 12 and heavy provides 13. If the armor you have disassembled has bonus effects, such as enchantments, you gain those effects. You can only hold one disassembled set of armor with this feature at a time.

subclassFeature.name: Power Core
entries: At 6th level, you can select a unique way to manifest your magical powers. Select either Molten Core or Static Core, and you gain features based off what you selected.

entries.name: Molten Core
entries: You gain resistance to Fire damage. You learn the Heat Metal spell, it counts as a Sorcerer spell for you, and can cast it a number of times equal to your Charisma Modifier per long rest. Creatures of your choice that would be moved or disarmed by Magnetic Surge take {@dice 2d4} Fire Damage, as the metal burns them.

entries.name: Static Core
entries: You gain resistance to Lightning damage. Whenever you cast a Sorcerer spell that deals Lightning Damage, your Magnetic Surge's weight maximum is doubled and creatures affected by it have disadvantage on the Strength Saving Throw. Creatures of your choice that would be moved or disarmed by Magnetic Surge take {@dice 2d4} Lightning Damage, as the metal shocks them.

entries.name: Static Core
entries: You gain resistance to Acid damage. Creatures of your choice that would be disarmed or moved by your Magnetic Surge, you can reduce their Armor class by 1d4 or their attack rolls by 1d4, so long as you are targetting armor/weapon made of metal. This reduction lasts until the start of your next turn. Creatures of your choice that would be moved or disarmed by Magnetic Surge take {@dice 2d4} Acid Damage, as the metal burns them.

subclassFeature.name: Magnetic Hover
entries: At 14th level, you can accurately control magnetic fields under you to cause you to fly. As an Action, you gain a fly speed and maximum fly height based on the terrain that is under you.
You can fly with this feature for 10 minutes at a time, and can do so a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Magnetic Singularity
entries: At 18th level, your control over magnetism is at its peak. The weight moved by your Magnetic Surge Feature is tripled. As an Action, you can create a field of powerful magnetism in a 15ft radius centred around you. No metal objects can enter that field under any circumstances. If a metal object is teleported inside of the field, it is immediately pushed outwards past the end of your radius. While this is active, you can select one object composed of metal within 100ft of you as a Bonus Action and launch it with your magnetism. The object can weigh no more that 100 lbs. It is launched 100ft in a direction you choose, and all creatures in its path must make a Dexterity Saving throw, or take 3d10 Bludgeoning damage. This lasts for 1 minute, and can only be used once per Long Rest, or by spending 5 Sorcery Points.

subclassFeature.name: Bright Night
entries: At 1st level, when you hit a creature with a spell that deals Radiant or Psychic damage, or they fail the saving throw, they become {@condition blinded} until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Fabrics of the Night
entries: At 1st level, your blessing gives you an innate understanding of the vexing nature of the moons and their magic. Illusions and enchantments come naturally to you: you learn the Friends or Minor Illusion cantrip. In addition, when you reach certain levels in this class you may learn the following spells without having them count against your spells known, if they are not on the sorcerer spell list, they are added to your spell list:

subclassFeature.name: Lunar Blessing
entries: The moon is a magical force. When full the world blooms with magic, creatures, forces, and phenomena unseen. When they fade from the sky darkness overtakes the world and magic wanes. While all people and creatures feel the waxing and waning of magic from the moon, you feel it much more acutely. Your magic comes and goes with the phases of the moon. Your unique blessing allows you to pull at the fabric of reality wrapping darkness and light around you with your hands and mind.

subclassFeature.name: Rune of the Moons
entries: When you take this bloodline at 1st level, the magic of the moons that runs in your blood allows you to innately understand the languages of Fey. You can read, speak, and write Sylvan.

subclassFeature.name: Weave of Midnight
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to perform a ritual to render yourself and other creatures invisible. The ritual takes 1 minute to perform at the end of which up to your Charisma modifier number of creatures within 10 feet of you are turned invisible as if the invisibility spell had been cast. The invisibility lasts for 1 hour, until any invisible creature attacks or casts a spell, or you enter an area of bright light. You can only conduct this ritual at night.
You also learn the Transmute Spell Metamagic (not counting against your known metamagics), and gain the ability to transmute spells into Psychic and Radiant Damage.

subclassFeature.name: Wax and Wane
entries: At 14th level, you have begun to absorb the powers of the moon into your magic. Once per long rest when you expend the last spell slot for a spell level you can regain 1 spell slot of any level lower than your last expended level. In addition, whenever you use sorcery points you can use your reaction to deal radiant damage equal to your proficiency score to any creatures of your choice within 10ft.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Moons
entries: At 18th level, a shimmering veil of moonlight always covers you granting you the following benefits:

items: At the end of a long rest you gain temporary hit points equal to your sorcerer level.
You have resistance to radiant damage.
When you hit a creature with a spell you deal additional radiant damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
You can expend 2 sorcerer points as a bonus action to teleport up to 60 ft to a point you can see.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Fortitude
entries: The intense experiments done on your body have left you hardier than normal. At 1st level your hit point maximum increases by 2 and increases by 2 again whenever you gain a level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Runebound Spells
entries: At 1st level, the runes inside your body activate when you are actively channeling magic. Once per turn when you deal damage with a weapon or spell attack you deal bonus force damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
When you fail a concentration check you can spend a hit die, roll it and add it to the result, potentially allowing you to maintain concentration.
Additionally at 6th level, while you are concentrating on a sorcerer spell you gain temporary hit points equal to the spells level + your proficiency bonus at the start of each of your turns

subclassFeature.name: Runebound
entries: Runebound are not made, but crafted. Most Runebound are not willing vessels for the vast power that they gain but hapless victims of those seeking to create a perfect soldier. Runebound gain their power from the runes etched into their body, either tattooed permanently onto their skin, etched into their bones, or emblazoned on their very souls.

Runebound are often created to serve the whims of an arcanist or military. When created Runebound often do not have full control over their body and mind serving the whims of the ones that created them. When their original master dies or the Runebound manufactures their own means of escape they are loosed on the world with the immense power they hold. While most Runebound are made unwillingly, rarely someone will volunteer for the experiment in the hopes they can use the abilities granted for their own purposes.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: At 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. Moreover, you can cast one of your cantrips in place of one of those attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Runic Power
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to imbue your strikes with powerful magical impacts. When you hit with a melee weapon attack or melee spell attack you can expend two sorcery points to manifest one of the following effects:

items: You deal {@dice 2d8} extra damage of your choice from fire, cold, lightning, acid, or thunder damage.
The creature must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked back up to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Magical Siphon
entries: At 14th level, your runic power has manifested fully as a physical rune on your body. You can choose where the rune appears. Your rune becomes a siphon for magical power, as a reaction when you are hit with a spell of 1st level or higher you can use your reaction to draw power from the spell. Make a Spell Casting ability check with a DC equal to 10 + twice the spells level. On a success you regain sorcery points equal to half the spells level, minimum 1.

subclassFeature.name: Runes of Power
entries: At 18th level, your runes have grown to cover large areas of your body. If you are concentrating on a spell and cast another spell that requires concentration you can spend 3 sorcery points to store the second spell in your runes, allowing you to concentrate on both at once. When you take damage you must make a saving throw for both spells and the DC increases for both by an amount equal to the highest spell level you are concentrating on. Each round you must spend one sorcery point to continue concentrating on the spells, if you cannot or do not spend a sorcery point one spell of your choice ends. You can only ever concentrate on two spells at once.

subclassFeature.name: Best Laid Plans
entries: When you take this tract at 3rd level, you gain the careful insight and planning needed to prepare for battle. When you finish a long rest, you can make battle plans to grant yourself and your allies a boon for the coming day. Choose from one of the following effects which last until you finish a long rest or are used:

items: You grant one ally of your choice that finished the long rest with you the ability to use one of your techniques. They use their own Ability Scores when determining the DC or bonuses granted. Once they use the technique, they cannot use it again.
The first time you roll initiative, you and all your allies may move up to 10ft before combat begins, provided you are not surprised.

One ally of your choice that finished the long rest with you gains proficiency in a saving throw they are not already proficient in. Once they make a successful save of that type, they lose the proficiency.

entries: If a creature with one of these abilities finishes a long rest, they lose their current ability.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Techniques
entries: When you take this tract at 3rd level, you gain one technique from the list below. Whenever you gain a new technique, you can choose from this list as well.

entries.name: Mark of Denial
entries: As part of an attack, you mark one creature and protect your allies from it. When you use this technique to attack a creature, that creature must make a Wisdom saving throw even if the attack misses. If the target fails the saving throw, it cannot take reactions until the end of your next turn, and any creature leaving its threat range can move an extra 10ft on their turn.

entries.name: A Change of Plans
entries: You can forgo one attack to give an ally nearby the chance to push their advantage on their next turn. Choose one ally within 30ft, on their next turn they can use a bonus action to make one weapon attack, disengage, dash, or use an item.

entries.name: Befuddling Strike
entries: Befuddling Strike. As part of an attack, you strike a creature and confuse its senses. When you use this technique to attack a creature, that creature must make an Intelligence saving throw even if the attack misses. If the target fails, they become confused and on their next turn take one of the following actions of your choice.

items: Make one attack against a creature of your choice within range.
Use all their movement and use the dash action to move in a direction of your choice, avoiding obvious dangers.
Drop what it's holding and end its turn.

subclassFeature.name: The Commander
entries: Trained in the command of people these wardens lead those that follow them towards war, battle, and victory. A commander is often formally trained, either by an institution, a family mentor, or a rite of passage. For a commander victory is the final goal, but not at any cost. The protection of their allies is just as important as victory in the field.

Commanders learn that careful preparation is as important if not more so than strength in the field. In order to better protect themselves and their allies they must use whatever means necessary, every ounce of strength and every bit of wit. A commander is defined just as much by their losses as their victories, for every loss is another lesson learned.

subclassFeature.name: Commander's Mind
entries: At 7th level, you reinforce your mind against assaults on the battlefield. You gain proficiency in a Charisma saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Peace in War
entries: At 7th level, you become a masterful negotiator when it comes to violence, either causing it or stopping it. You gain proficiency in either Persuasion or Intimidation. When you make a Persuasion or Intimidation check to prevent violence or to convince someone to commit a violent act, you can add your Strength or Constitution modifier to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Beneficial Cooperation
entries: Starting at 15th level, you have learned to bolster those that aid you on the battlefield. When a creature is involved in one of your Techniques you can choose to restore a number of hit points equal to your Constitution modifier to them. Additionally, you can choose to forgo the healing and instead end one condition affecting them from the following list: prone, stunned, charmed, or frightened.

subclassFeature.name: Masterful Tactician
entries: Starting at 20th level, you have mastered your skills for planning to get the most out of your battle preparations. You can now apply the first and third benefits of Best Laid Plans to a number of creatures equal to your Charisma modifier + 1 (minimum 1). When your allies use the techniques granted by this ability, they regain hit points as per your Beneficial Cooperation ability. Additionally, any creatures that benefit from the second point of Best Laid Plans also gains advantage on all attacks made in their first round of combat.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Techniques
entries: When you take this tract at 3rd level, you gain one technique from the list below. Whenever you gain a new technique, you can choose from this list as well.

entries.name: Spell Sharing
entries: When you cast a spell that targets only you, you can use this Technique to grant one other creature the effects of the spell. If the spell lasts for a duration, it lasts on the secondary creature for a number of rounds equal to the duration of the spell or equal to half your proficiency modifier (rounded down) whichever is lower.

entries.name: Enhanced Healing
entries: When you cast a spell that restores hit points, you can use this technique to increase the potency of the healing. The targeted creature regains additional hit points equal to your Constitution modifier, and you regain hit points equal to your Constitution modifier plus the spells level.

entries.name: Arcane Battery
entries: When a creature casts a spell within 30ft of you that deals damage, you can further enhance it with your own magic. Using your reaction to expend a spell slot you add additional force damage to one of the damage rolls of the spell equal to 2d8 per spell slot expended + half your warden levels. This is added to the spell's damage, meaning spells that save for half damage also halve this additional force damage.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: When you reach 3rd level, through either sheer luck, careful study, or heavy modifications your body has become a conduit for errant magical energies. See Spells rules for the general rules of spellcasting and the Spells Listing for the wizard and paladin spell list.

Spell Slots.The Conduit Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest. For example, if you know the 1st-level spell shield and have a 1st-level and 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast shield using either slot.

Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher. You know three 1st level wizard or paladin spells of your choice, you must choose from the abjuration, transmutation, or evocation spells on the wizard spell list or any paladin spell. The Spells Known column of the Conduit Spellcasting table shows when you learn more spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be an abjuration, transmutation, or evocation spell of your choice if you are choosing a wizard spell or any paladin spell and must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the spells you know with another spell of your choice from the wizard or paladin spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and it must be an abjuration, evocation, or transmutation spell if it is a wizard spell.

Spellcasting Ability. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your spells, by channeling raw energies through your body. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier

subclassFeature.name: The Conduit
entries: A conduit is a bastion of protection against errant magical energies. Your ability to control magical energy comes from perhaps the luck of your birth, careful study, or heavy modification done to your body through other magical or scientific forces. A conduit is an expert at protecting their allies from harmful magic, while also using their latent magical abilities to bolster themselves and other spellcasters.

To a conduit, magic is a neutral force, an energy neither good nor evil. It is how the magic is used that defines if a being is good or ill. A conduit's magic is focused towards the reinforcement, defense, and restoration of their allies, although some use their magic for much more destructive pursuits.

subclassFeature.name: Battlefield Casting
entries: At 7th level, you become a master at dealing with magic while in the thick of battle. When you make a Concentration check, you add twice your Constitution modifier to the roll. In addition, if you lose concentration on a spell as the result of failing a Concentration check the spell instead ends at the start of your next turn, or the end of the spell's duration whichever is shorter.

subclassFeature.name: Conduit's Mind
entries: At 7th level, you reinforce your mind against assaults on the battlefield. You gain proficiency in a Intelligence saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Conduit
entries: At 15th level, you become a lightning rod for arcane energies, causing them to arc towards you rather than your allies. You can use your Warding Presence ability on any spell that deals damage to multiple creatures, when you use the ability in this way you automatically fail the spell's saving throw to grant a number of creatures within 10 feet, up to your Constitution modifier, resistance to the spell's damage.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Breaker
entries: At 20th level, you become an expert at rebuking harmful magical effects from yourself and allies. Once per day, you can burn your magical energies to create a powerful nullifying field around yourself. Using an action to expend one spell slot, you gain the following effects for a number of rounds equal to the level of the spell slot expended.

items: You and creatures within 30ft of you of your choice gain advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
When a creature within 30ft of you takes damage from a spell, you can reduce the damage they take by an amount equal to your Constitution modifier.
If you succeed on a saving throw against a spell that only targets you, you gain temporary hit points equal to twice that spell's level.

entries: While in this state, you can use a bonus action to expend another spell slot to extend the duration of the effects. When the effect ends, you deal force damage to any creatures of your choice within 30ft of you equal to four times the number of rounds it was active.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Techniques
entries: When you take this tract at 3rd level, you gain one technique from the list below. Whenever you gain a new technique, you can choose from this list as well.

entries.name: Immortal Wall
entries: You command your Legionnaires to form an unbreakable wall. Select one Legionnaire or yourself. Any Legionnaires within 60 feet of you or the selected Legionnaire can move up to 15ft towards you, Legionnaires that end their movement adjacent to yourself or another Legionnaires have their AC increased by 4 and become tangible. Attacks cannot pass through or above the Legionnaires (up to 10 feet above and below them) and creature that try and move through the Legionnaires must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and have their movement stopped. This effect ends at the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Immortal Shield
entries: You forgo one attack and instead command your Legionnaires to protect one creature within 30 feet of you. Any Legionnaires within 60 feet of you can move up to 15ft towards a target of your choice, until the end of that target’s turn when it takes damage, that damage is reduced by 1 for each Legionnaire or yourself within 5ft of it.

entries.name: Immortal Spear
entries: As part of an attack, you also command your Legionnaires to attack one creature within 30 feet of you. Any Legionnaires within 60 feet of you can move up to 15ft towards a target of your choice, until the end of that your next turn, whenever you hit a creature with an attack it takes 1 additional damage for each Legionnaire within 5ft of it.

subclassFeature.name: Immortal Guard
entries: In the hallowed halls of the Golden Empire, the Immortal Guard protected the nation and its emperor with fervor and might. They commanded the endless legions of Gilded to conquer and rule with the empire’s will. These powerful warriors could command their soldiers even after they had fallen in battle, calling upon their spirits to serve even beyond death.

Those of the Immortal Guard command an inexhaustible army of loyal spirits that they can summon to fight alongside themselves. Even after Kim-at’s fall, they could call upon the countless souls lost in the calamity to fight in new lands. While most of the Immortal Guard draw their power from the lineage of Kim-at, some have found new ways of accessing this power, be it divine or otherwise.

subclassFeature.name: Immortal Legion
entries: When you take this tract at 3rd level, you gain the ability to summon the spirit of the fallen Legions of Kim-at. You can summon a Legionnaire in two ways:

Whenever you use a Technique, you can conjure a spectral Legionnaire at a point you can see within 30ft of you. At the start of your turn while your Inspiring Aura is active, you can create one Legionnaire within 10ft of you or move a Legionnaire within 10ft of you up to 30ft instead of using any of the other effects of Inspiring Aura.
Your Legionnaires count as you for the purposes of your Techniques.

Your Legionnaires are magical, shadowy creatures that have your Armor Class, 1 hit point, immunity to all conditions, and automatically fail any saving throws. If they drop to 0 hit point, they vanish. Your Legionnaires cannot move, except for from your class abilities, occupy their space (but can be passed through by creatures, although they cannot end their movement there), and cannot take actions. You can have a number of Legionnaires present at a time equal to twice your proficiency bonus. Legionnaires vanish after 1 minute.

When you take the attack action, you can replace any number of those attacks with attacks from your Legionnaires. Your Legionnaires use your Strength or Dexterity plus your Proficiency bonus to hit, and on a hit deal 1d8+your Proficiency bonus in force damage. For each other Legionnaire or yourself within 10ft of the attacking Legionnaire, it deals an additional 1 damage, up to a max equal to your levels in Warden.

subclassFeature.name: Master of the Gilded Arts
entries: At 7th level, you’ve gained an appreciation for not just the art of war but for other artistic pursuits as well. You learn one of the following Artisan Tools: Mason’s, Painter’s, Calligrapher’s, Jeweler’s, or Woodcarver’s.
In addition, you can expend a use of your Inspiring Aura feature to gain proficiency in one skill or tool you do not have proficiency in for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Unending Command
entries: At 7th level, you can summon even greater forces to fight on your behalf. Whenever you summon a Legionnaire, you summon two instead. In addition, when you use a Technique granted from this subclass that only effects you and your Legionnaires, it does not consume a use of your Techniques.

subclassFeature.name: Last Standing
entries: At 15th level, you ensure that you are the last one to fall in any battle. When you would drop to zero hit points, you can destroy any number of Legionnaires within 30 feet of you. For each Legionnaire you destroy in this way, reduce the damage taken by 2. If this kept you from dropping to zero hit points, you can immediately use your reaction to use Heat of Battle, even if you do not have any remaining uses left.

subclassFeature.name: We Are Legion
entries: At 20th level, your command of the endless legions becomes supreme. Whenever you make an attack roll and hit, you may summon one Legionnaire to a point you can see within 30 feet.
In addition, there is no longer any limit on the number of Legionnaires you can have at one time.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Techniques
entries: When you take this tract at 3rd level, you gain one technique from the list below. Whenever you gain a new technique, you can choose from this list as well.

entries.name: Crushing Pursuit
entries: As a bonus action, you can Dash. When you finish your movement on this turn, each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw or take bludgeoning damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus + 1/20th of your Maximum Hit points. On a successful save they take half damage.

entries.name: Relentless Vigor
entries: As a reaction to failing a saving throw, expend 1 hit die and roll it. You take necrotic damage equal to twice the number rolled which cannot be reduced in any way. You may then reattempt the saving throw with advantage. You may still use Heat of Battle even if after using this Technique, even if you succeed on the saving throw on the reattempt.

entries.name: Subjugation
entries: You forgo one attack to instead intimidate one target. Select 1 creature within 60ft of you, they must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they are Frightened of you. As long as the creature is frightened, their movement speed is halved, and you gain Temporary Hit Points at the start of your turn equal to your Proficiency Bonus. On a success, their movement speed is halved until the end of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Unstoppable Force
entries: When you take this tract at 3rd level, you gain an unrelenting anger just waiting to be unleashed. After taking damage, the next weapon attack you hit with in the next minute does extra weapon damage equal to your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Unyielding Body
entries: At 7th level, your unyielding mind extends to your body as well. After taking damage, your movement speed cannot be reduced in any way (except to 0) until the end of your next turn.
In addition, whenever you critically strike a creature, that creature becomes frightened of you until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Unyielding Mind
entries: At 7th level, your mind has grown so accustomed to battle, it refuses to yield to it. Whenever you have to remake a saving throw against the Charmed or Frightened conditions, you can choose to make the saving throw with Constitution, regardless of the original saving throw. You can use this ability a number of times per long rest equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Unshackled
entries: At 15th level, your body refuses to submit to the shackles of others, be they physical or magical. When you are subjected to a Paralyzed, Petrified, Restrained, or Stunned condition, you may immediately end the effect on yourself and can move your full movement towards the creature that prompted the condition on you. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Furious Overlord
entries: At 20th level, your hatred can bolster your body turning you into an unstoppable juggernaut. As an action, you can become enraged for 1 minute. While enraged, you gain the following effects:

items: The effects of Unstoppable Force and Unyielding Body are always active during that minute.
Any damage you take is reduced by your Proficiency Bonus.
You gain an additional 15 feet of movement speed.
You are immune to the charmed and frightened conditions.

entries: These effects last for 1 minute or until you fall unconscious. After this ability ends, you gain two levels of exhaustion and cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Techniques
entries: When you take this tract at 3rd level, you gain one technique from the list below. Whenever you gain a new technique, you can choose from this list as well.

entries.name: Interceding Strike
entries: As a reaction, when a creature hits the subject of your Honor Bond with an attack, and you are within 5ft of the attacker, you can make an attack against them. If the attack hits, you reduce the damage of the offending attack by the damage you deal.

entries.name: Shield Wall
entries: You forgo one attack to instead brace your charge for incoming attacks. To use this technique, you must be wielding a shield. For the next minute, whenever your charge is within 5ft of you, they gain the AC benefits of your shield and can add your shield bonus to any Dexterity saving throws they make.

entries.name: Team Strike
entries: When you make an attack roll, you can allow the subject of your Honor Bond to also make an attack. Your Honor Bound can use its reaction to immediately make one attack, adding {@dice 1d4} to the to hit roll.

subclassFeature.name: Honor Bond
entries: When you take this tract at 3rd level, you gain the ability to make a vow of protection towards one creature. As a bonus action you vow to protect one creature within 30ft of you making them your Honor Bound. Until you choose another target, you and the subject of your oath gain the following benefits:

items: Whenever you use the Help action on that creature, they roll {@dice 1d4} and add it to the result.
When within 30ft of each other, you both gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws.
If you finish a short rest and have access to that creature for the full duration of the rest, they can add half your proficiency modifier to any hit dice they spend during that rest.

entries: Once you use a bonus action to designate a target, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest. If a creature is already part of an Honor Bond, they cannot benefit from a second one.

subclassFeature.name: The Protector
entries: To the protector, their bond of protection is the most important thing in the world. To the one they vow to protect they are a guardian and a mentor, not just a protector in battle but a teacher and a friend. Proper guidance in life is as important as a strong shield to protect them in combat. When a protector vows to keep one safe, that bond is unshakable as a mountain.

The longer one serves to protect the same creature, the greater their ability to work together with that creature becomes. A protector and their charge in time become a well-oiled machine, working seamlessly together both in combat and outside it. For a protector, the greatest sin is to let the one they protect die.

subclassFeature.name: Protector's Mind
entries: At 7th level, you reinforce your mind against assaults on the battlefield. You gain proficiency in a Wisdon saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Ward's Charge
entries: At 7th level, you gain the ability to support your Honor Bound not just inside combat but in all areas of their life. When you finish a short rest with a subject of your Honor Bond, you can choose to grant them proficiency in one skill or tool of your choice that you are proficient in. They retain the proficiency until you choose another Honor Bound or grant them a different proficiency with this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Line of Defense
entries: At 15th level, your bond with your Honor Bound has grown strong enough that the two of you can work together in perfect fluidity. When you use a Technique gained through the Protectors Bonus Techniques that involves the subject of your Honor Bond, and no other allies, you do not need to expend a use of your Technique.

subclassFeature.name: Last Bastion
entries: At 20th level, you become an unyielding guardian when it comes to protecting your charge. While you have the subject of your Honor Bond within 30ft, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain resistance to bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage.
Whenever you make a saving throw, you can add {@dice 1d6} to the roll.
If the subject of your Honor Bond drops to 0 hit points, you can immediately take a full turn. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Fleshwarper lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: The Cost of the Fleshwarper
entries: At 1st level, your Patron demands more from you than the average Warlock. You lose an arm, and cannot have it replaced nor regrown. As a Bonus Action, you can pull from your Patron's well of power, summoning a magical weapon in place of your missing arm, in which you are always proficient. All summoned weapons use your Charisma to calculate to-hit and damage bonuses. You decide which weapon you summon from a list below. You cannot be disarmed or drop conjured weapons, nor can you wear Medium or Heavy armor while a weapon is conjured. Any weapon you conjure can be selected for the 'Pact of the Blade' feature.

entries.name: Blade
entries: You conjure a Blade in place of your arm. It deals 1d10 Slashing damage. Your walking speed increases by 10 feet while the Blade is active. While in Blade form, you subtract 1d4 from Concentration checks.

entries.name: Cannon
entries: You conjure a Cannon. This acts as an Arcane Focus. Whenever you cast a Cantrip, you can increase its damage. It deals an additional die of damage, or for Eldritch Blast, gains another beam. Doing so knocks you back 10 feet. You cannot cast the same cantrip next turn. You have disadvantage on Strength checks and Saving Throws.

entries.name: Shield
entries: You conjure a Shield in place of your arm. Your walking speed decreases by 10 feet. You provide half of the AC bonus from this shield to creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you. Furthermore, you have advantage on saving throws made to maintain Concentration.

subclassFeature.name: The Fleshwarper
entries: Some Patrons want influence, some want chaos. But the most truly twisted Patrons want a level of devotion like no other. One so powerful that a mortal would give up a part of their being for a well of their powers.

subclassFeature.name: Bodily Enhancements
entries: At 6th level, your body is more accustomed to transforming. You gain resistance to Necrotic Damage, but this resistance is lost while a weapon is conjured. Furthermore, your weapons are stronger.

entries.name: Blade
entries: Your walking speed whilst the Blade is summoned is now increased by 15 feet. You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and you can take the Dash action as a Bonus action

entries.name: Cannon
entries: If you damage a creature with a Cantrip, you have advantage on the next different cantrip attack you make against them. This bonus is lost after 1 minute.

entries.name: Shield
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to your Armor Class provided by your Shield, and you can add the Armor Class Bonus from this shield to Dexterity Saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Larger Arsenal
entries: At 10th level, you gain access to more weapons. Additionally, you gain the ability to incorporate magical weapons into your conjured weapons. Whenever you attune to a magical sword, shield, bow or heavy weapon, it can be absorbed into your body. Unattuning from an absorbed weapon makes it reappear in an unoccupied space next to you. Your conjured Blade, Shield, Bow and Hammer can take on properties from magical swords, shields, bows and two handed heavy weapons, respectively. When conjured, they gain any bonuses the magical weapon provides, like a +1 to hit and damage rolls, new damage types, spells they can cast, etc. They retain their original damage die, and cannot gain the versatile property.

entries.name: Bow
entries: You conjure a massive bow that doesn't require two hands to shoot. You can make a ranged weapon attack while the Bow is conjured. It deals 3d8 Piercing damage, and has a range of 600 feet.

entries.name: Energy
entries: Your conjure an arm made of unstable energy. This acts as an Arcane Focus. Whenever you cast a spell that forces a creature to make a Saving throw, you can roll 1d6. If the number rolled is equal to or higher than the level of spell you are casting, the creature making the saving throw has disadvantage.

entries.name: Hammer
entries: You conjure a massive Bludgeoning weapon. Your walking speed is lowered by 10 feet. It only requires your Conjured arm to lift and wield effectively. It deals 3d6 Bludgeoning damage. You have resistance to Piercing, Bludgeoning and Slashing damage

subclassFeature.name: Dual Wield
entries: At 14th level, when you conjure a Weapon, you can replace your other arm with a different weapon than the first conjured. Conjuring multiple weapons is a painful process, and thus gives a point of Exhaustion once the weapons are dismissed. You also gain one final form to conjure.

entries.name: Dark Flesh
entries: You create an arm. While conjured, you retain your resistance to Necrotic Damage from your Bodily Enhancements feature. Furthermore, you have advantage on Death Saving Throws. This form can remain conjured for up to 8 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: Master lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Minions
entries: At 1st level, one of the creatures devoted to you has found you and dedicated itself to your service. Your minion takes the shape of a small humanoid, beast, elemental, or monstrosity with the following stat block which increases with your level.
When you summon a minion or get one for the first time assign its abilities scores using the values below: 16, 14, 10,10, 8, 4.

The minion obeys your general commands as best it can. It takes its turn on your initiative. On your turn, you can verbally command your minion where to move (no action required by you). You can use a bonus action to command it to take the Attack, Dash, Disengage, Help, or Cast A Spell actions. If you don’t issue a command the minion takes the dodge action and will try to get within 10 feet of you.
When you choose a Pact at 3rd level your minion is transformed to better suit your new found skills:

entries.name: Pact of the Blade
entries: Your minion gains the Blade action.

entries.name: Pact of the Tome
entries: Your minion learns one 1st and 2nd level spell from the Warlock spell list. They can cast each of these spells once per long rest.

entries.name: Pact of the Chain
entries: Your minion now fights better on its own. It loses the Unfocused Follower feature and gains the Bolstered Follower feature.

entries.name: Pact of the Talisman
entries: Anyone holding your talisman is counted as the master of the minion for the purposes of this class’s features.

The minion won’t obey commands that put it in obvious danger, such as jumping off a cliff or walking into a fire. However, you can choose to push a command making a Persuasion or Intimidation check. The DC for this check is equal to 25 - your levels in this class.

If your minion dies, you can summon forth a new one by spending 8 hours in a magical ritual, the new minion must be of the creature type you chose when you took this class. If you don’t summon a new minion within 7 days a new one will magically find you.

subclassFeature.name: The Master
entries: The relationship between a Warlock and their patron is a two way street, one granting power and the other service. For some , however, through some great fortune, or misfortune, they have been haphazardly granted the title of patron without the means to back it up. These warlocks have been the recipients of some cosmic misunderstanding that has caused a creature or group of creatures to believe that they can grant them otherworldly power. Most warlocks in this circumstance find themselves in an uneasy position. Either use the blind faith of their minions to their advantage and hope they don’t see through the deception or hope that you can somehow convince them you aren’t who they think you are and that when they do they don’t turn their ire on you.

subclassFeature.name: Patron's Bond
entries: At 6th level, the bond between you and your minion is strengthened to the point where you can share magical effects. When you heal hit points through the casting of a spell your minion regains an equal amount and vice versa. Likewise when you cast a spell that targets only self, it affects your minion as well if they are within 30 feet when you cast it.
Your minion can become medium and any future minions you summon can be medium as well.

subclassFeature.name: Blood of the God
entries: At 10th level, you can sacrifice your minion to save your own life. When you fail a death saving throw and your minion is within 60 feet of you they can use their reaction to sacrifice themselves and save you. You do not fail the death save and instead regain a number of hit points equal to your Warlock level, your minion immediately dies.
In addition, your minion gains a benefit based on its type:

entries.name: Pact of the Blade
entries: While your minion is within 10 feet of you both gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws.

entries.name: Pact of the Tome
entries: Your minion gains a 3rd and 4th level spell from the Warlock spell list, they can cast these once per long rest

entries.name: Pact of the Chain
entries: When your minion makes an attack they can attack twice instead of once.

entries.name: Pact of the Talisman
entries: Your minion gains the ability to use the Help action with a range of 30 feet. In addition, when it uses its action to help its master the master can add 1d4 extra to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Might of the Master
entries: At 14th level, your minion's power is permanently linked with yours. When you are affected by a spell you can choose to share the effect with your minion as long as it is within 30 feet of you. Also when you fail a saving throw against a negative effect from a spell, such as hold person, and your minion is within 30 feet both you and your minion can use your reactions to have the spell take effect on your minion instead.
Your minion can become large and any future minions can be large as well.

subclassFeature.name: Deep Pockets
entries: Starting at 1st level, the pockets and pouches of all your clothes are magically enchanted as you put them on. Any pocket or pouch that you are wearing can hold an infinite amount of coins. It can only hold coins. When you remove clothing, the coins are locked in a pocket plane until you don new clothing. When you pull coins out of this dimension, they are of any denomination you wish, regardless of what you put in as long as removing that coin would not be worth more than what is in the pocket plane.
In addition, whenever you finish a long rest you gain {@dice 1d4}+warlock level gp, added directly into your pocket dimension.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: Opulent lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Gifted Prowess
entries: Starting at 1st level, you gain the eldritch blast cantrip if you did not have it already. However, it now has a material component that is consumed when used. The material component can be 1cp, 1sp, 1ep, 1gp, or 1pp.
When you cast the spell, the damage is determined by the material component. {@dice 1d4} for 1cp, {@dice 1d6} for 1sp, {@dice 1d8} for 1ep, {@dice 1d10} for 1gp, and {@dice 1d12} for 1pp.

subclassFeature.name: The Opulent
entries: Occasionally, through great luck or great skill, a mortal is able to gain the favor of a being of undeterminable wealth and opulence. These creatures are often fickle things, beings well beyond the moral understanding of wealth, collecting things such as people, souls, or even world to add to their hordes. Servants such as yourself are often little more than tools, tools to expand their ever-expanding greed and lust. In some twist of fate, you have struck a bargain, sealed a deal, sunk the goose and now you are beholden to all such terms and conditions that apply. The creature that you bargained with cares about one thing and one thing only, coin. The fact is that for you, everything has a price, just hope that price isn't too high…

subclassFeature.name: Bang For Your Buck
entries: Starting at 6th level, whenever you cast a spell that requires a material component that has a GP cost of greater than 1gp you can double all dice rolled as part of that spell, however the spell consumes twice the material component even if it does not regularly. You can use this feature a number of times per long rest equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Cutpurse's Confounding
entries: Beginning at 10th level, whenever you take damage from an attack or fail a saving throw you can use your reaction to either take half damage from the attack or reroll the saving throw. To do so you must expend 100gp, which vanishes in a puff of smoke. You canmake use of this feature until the total amount of gold pieces spent reaches 1000gp. This total resets when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Opulent Appearance
entries: Starting at 14th level, the amount of gold that you carry enhances your body and empowers your mind. For each 10,000gp of gold that you have on your person all your ability scores increase by 1 to a maximum of 22. Should the amount of gold you are carrying every drop below 10,000gp you gain disadvantage on all ability checks, saving throws, and attack rolls until it is over 10,000gp. In addition, you can ignore the gold cost of any material components that are not consumed.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: Shadowsworn lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Gifted Prowess
entries: At 1st level, you gain the ability to use shortswords, longswords, scimitars, and medium armor.

subclassFeature.name: Sweep the Darkness
entries: Starting at 1st level, your patron bestows upon you the power to control light and darkness. You gain the {@spell light} cantrip. In addition, as an action you can target any number of light sources within 30 feet of you. If they are fires or other natural sources of light they are extinguished. If they are magical sources and if their spell level is less than 1/3 of your current total level, they are dispelled.
While your target is in dim light or darkness, your weapon and spell attacks deal additional damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

subclassFeature.name: The Shadowsworn
entries: Lurking in the recesses of the universe where no light ever shines are creatures of such vile ambition that many shudders at the mere thought of their existence. Some of these creatures' bare known names, Shades, Nightwalkers, Raven Queens, Vachninos, and Skull Lords. Others are beyond knowing, as old as darkness itself.

For whatever reason you have bound your fate with one of these creatures, vile as it might be. Many give their power freely seizing any chance to spread their darkness and death. Others hold greater machinations, dreams of endless nights and a still dead world. Those that serve the shadows will often find their own lives growing dark, the toll of taking life and living in shadows wearing upon even the firmest of souls.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow's Edge
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can dodge death for a short while. When you are reduced to 0 hit points you are instead reduced to a dark shadowy form. This form has the same effect as the spell gaseous form except you are immune to all damage except radiant. If you take any damage in this form you fail 1 death saving throw. At the end of your next turn you revert to your normal form regaining hit points equal to 1 + your warlock level. Once you use this feature you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Stepping Umbra
entries: Beginning at 10th level, whenever you hit a creature with a melee attack you can use your bonus action to teleport up to 30ft to a point you can see within range. In addition, when you are struck by a ranged attack or spell you can teleport up to 30ft to a point you can see within range. After using this feature, you become resistant to all non-magical damage until the start of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus. You regain all uses on a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Eclipse Soul
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can use your action to burn necrotic and radiant energies within your own body. When you activate this ability, you take damage equal to your level in this class, this damage cannot be reduced in any way, and for the next minute you gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to necrotic and radiant damage.
Whenever you deal damage with a spell or attack you deal additional radiant or necrotic damage equal to your Charisma modifier. This damage can only apply to one damage roll per spell or attack.
Creatures that hit you with melee attacks take {@dice 1d8} necrotic or radiant damage.
The range of your Stepping Umbra ability is doubled to 60 and during the duration of this ability it does not consume uses.

subclassFeature.name: Aurumancy Savant
entries: At 2nd level, your magic can combine with Gold in new ways. Wizard spells that detail a material reagent with a gold cost, can now be cast simply by paying the Gold cost using coins, rather than having that spell exact material.

subclassFeature.name: Pyramid of Power
entries: At 2nd level, you can create an Aurumancy Transmitter by completing a 1 hour ritual and expending 100gp. The Aurumancy Transmitter is a tiny Golden Pyramid which hovers around you. Its Armor Class is equal to 12 + your Intelligcence Modifer + Proficiency Bonus, with hitpoints equal to twice your Wizard Level and resistance to all damage. You can expend a spell slot to heal it a number of hitpoints equal to the spell's level x5.

It can move up to 30ft on your turn without requiring an action to command it. It hovers no further than 15ft from you, and will begin to follow you if it gets further than that. Until it returns to your proximity, it cannot grant any benefits. If its path is blocked and you leave its range, it becomes inert, falling to the ground and losing its magic until you return to its proximity or create a new one, at which time the original transmitter is destroyed.
Your transmitter allows you to cast spells from its location. You can also see and hear through it.

When you cast a spell that expends a spell slot, your Transmitter activates for a number of rounds equal to half of your Prof Bonus (rounded down), or full Prof Bonus if you casted a Transmutation spell, and provides the following benefits:

entries.name: Aurum Boost
entries: Creatures of your choice within 5ft of it add half your proficiency bonus (rounded down) to one of either Strength, Dexterity, Intelligence or Wisdom checks. As a Bonus Action, you can change which benefit it provides.

subclassFeature.name: School of Aurumancy
entries: The magic found within gold was a part of everyday life within the Golden Empire, but since its ruination, their arts have been lost. Through dedicated study and ample amounts of the metal, Aurumancy has been reborn.
You carry a legacy of an empire. Your magic, ancient and forgotten. Upon your gilded shoulders rests the knowledge of Kima-at, and their most beloved art.
*Origato wer Aurix zhren*.
Let the Gold flow.

subclassFeature.name: Extended Transmission
entries: At 6th level, you can operate your Transmitter with increased range. Its maximum range becomes 30ft, and its movement increases to 45ft per turn. Your Aurumany Transmitter also gains new features it can use (following other rules in Pyramid of Power). Only one of these features can be active at a time, which can be changed as a Bonus Action:

entries.name: Aurum Barrier
entries: Creatures of your choice within 5ft of it gain advantage on saving throws from magical effects and spells of a lower level used to activate the transmitter.

entries.name: Aurum Strike
entries: Creatures of your choice within 5ft of it can add your Proficiency Bonus in Force damage to their weapon or spell damage rolls, once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Golden Magic
entries: At 10th level, your connection with Gold empowers your spells. You can expend Gold in order to empower your spells, and can spend 100gp to upcast a spell by 1 level. This can only be done once per spell, per round.
Additionally, yout Transmitter gains a new feature (following other rules in Pyramid of Power).

entries.name: Aurum Replication
entries: You can cast a Wizard spell that takes an action to cast into your transmitter, allowing it to absorb it. When The Transmitter activates or you use a Bonus Action to change its function, it casts that spell using your Spell Save DC and Spell attack bonus. If it requires concentration, you begin concentrating on it. If the spell absorbed in the Trasmitter isn't cast after 24hrs, it is lost.

subclassFeature.name: Multi Transmission
entries: At 14th level, you are able to operate multiple Transmitters. You can control up to 2 transmitters at once. When you expend a spell slot, you select which Transmitter activates. Both transmitters can be active at the same time, but each require their own spell slot expended. When using a Bonus Action to change the benefits they grant, that action can change both Transmitters effects to unique effects. No creature can gain the benefits from both of your transmitters at once.

subclassFeature.name: Ancient Knowledge
entries: At 2nd level, you have acquired once forgotten knowledge. You gain proficiency in the History skill, and whenever you make a History or Arcana check with advantage, you can roll {@dice 3d20} and take the highest result

subclassFeature.name: Dark Arts
entries: Stories tell of a spell so powerful that a council of Wizards agreed to have it wiped from the records forever. Now, its power has resurfaced.
As a Dark Arts Wizard, you wield an ancient spell with infinite possibilities. Though it was once forgotten, you shall show the new world the power of the Forbidden Spell.

subclassFeature.name: Forbidden Spell Versatility
entries: At 2nd level, you learn more ways to utilize the Forbidden Spell. You gain access to two Forbidden Arcana. You gain more Forbidden Arcana as you progress in this class. Each time you take a level in this class, you can replace up to one Forbidden Arcana with another available. You can only learn Forbidden Arcana within your tier, which is determined by your level in this class. Each time you cast The Forbidden Spell, you can select a number of Forbidden Arcana to apply to that spell up to the spell slot level used in its casting. Additionally, the Tier of the Arcana cannot total more than the level at which the Spell is cast at (Favoured Arcana excludes this)

subclassFeature.name: The Forbidden Spell
entries: At 2nd level, you gain knowledge of an ancient spell. {@spell The Forbidden Spell|TftJC} is added to your spellbook, is always prepared for you and does not count against your prepared number of spells. You cannot create spell scrolls of this spell, nor can another Wizard copy this spell from your spellbook.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Modifications
entries: At 6th level, you learn to twist other spells in your favor. When casting a spell that uses a spell slot that makes a Spell Attack roll other than The Forbidden Spell, you can apply 1 Forbidden Arcana that you know to it. All other rules of Applying Arcana to spells apply for this spell.

subclassFeature.name: Favoured Arcana
entries: At 10th level, you become adept in using your favourite Forbidden Arcana. Select one Tier 1 Forbidden Arcana you know, it is now applied each time you cast The Forbidden Spell without it using one of your Forbidden Arcana slots. Whenever you take another level in this class, you may change your Favourite Arcana.

subclassFeature.name: Unleashed
entries: At 14th level, The Forbidden Spell becomes unstable. Once per long rest, when you cast The Forbidden Spell, you can apply as many Forbidden Arcanas that you know as you wish to it.

subclassFeature.name: Shorthand Spells
entries: At 2nd level, you become a savant in cramming in spells into your spellbook. When you prepare your Wizard spell, you can also shorthand a number of spells into your spellbook equal to half of your Wizard level, in total Spell Levels (rounded down). You cannot Shorthand the same spell twice, nor can you have a prepared spell also Shorthanded. You can cast these Shorthanded spells once each without using a spell slot, but cannot be cast again as a Wizard Spell. You can only Shorthand spells equal to or lower than 5th level.
Additionally, when copying spells into your spellbook, you can do so 10x faster.

subclassFeature.name: Spellthief's Skills
entries: At 2nd level, you gain proficiency in skills related to your craft. You gain Proficiency in Thieves' Tools, and you additionally gain proficiency in one of the following skills: Deception, Stealth, Sleight of Hand.
You can also take the Hide action as a Bonus Action.

subclassFeature.name: Spellthief
entries: A spellthief on the surface may seem to other Wizards like a scoundrel, only gaining value off other's merit. But the true Spellthieves know that their craft is the most difficult in the Wizarding world. Sneaking into libraries late at night to add more knowledge to their repertoire, climbing into the magical castles of powerful mages to collect a new rare spell.

One is more likely to find a budding Spellthief trained by the streets rather than a college. Spellthieves bring the cunning of rogues into the world of Magic, making them unpredictable and powerful allies, or formidable foes.

subclassFeature.name: Quickened Copying
entries: At 6th level, you learn to Shorthand on the fly. As a reaction to seeing a spell be cast, you can replace one of your Shorthanded spells with that spell (even if it not a Wizard Spell). You can only copy a spell up to 5th level.

subclassFeature.name: Personalized Notes
entries: At 14th level, you can tie in your own creativity into your shorthand. Whenever you use the Final Cast of a shorthand spell, you can apply one effect of your choice to the spell. The effect you pick must be able to affect the spell correctly

items: You can increase the level of the spell by one spell slot level.
You can impose disadvantage on the Saving Throw.
You have advantage on the spell attack roll
The duration of the spell is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Hidden Talents
entries: At 14th level, your ability to stay hidden is perfected. You can choose to ignore either the Somatic or the Verbal component of a spell, and always have {@spell Invisibility} and {@spell Greater Invisibility} shorthanded (these do not count against your number of shorthanded spells, and these spells cannot be replaced by Quickened Copying).

entries.name: Desert's Guide
entries: You can see small details within the Desert's landscape. You cannot get lost except by magical means while traveling through deserts, canyons, mesas or badlands. You can spend10 minutes to gather enough water from underground deposits to fill a waterskin.

entries.name: Dunish Magic
entries: You have learned magic to aid in your survival. You learn the {@spell Druidcraft|phb} cantrip. At 3rd level, you learn the {@spell Create or Destroy Water|phb} spell and can cast it once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot for it. At 5th level, you learn {@spell Dust Devil|XGE} and can cast it once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot for it.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Duodrone
entries: At 1st level, you learn the {@spell Detect Magic} Spell. At 3rd level, you learn the {@spell See Invisibility} Spell. You can cast these each without requiring a Spell Slot or material components once per Long Rest. Your size becomes Medium.

entries.name: Hellfire Imp
entries: Hellfire Imps embody the Nine Hell’s natural affinity to Fire, and empower themselves with it.

entries.name: Infernal Resilience
entries: Imps are durable creatures, and gain resistance to Fire damage.

entries.name: Invisibility
entries: As an Action, an Imp can magically turn invisible (along with anything its carrying) for up to 1 minute, or casting another spell or making an attack roll, or until its concentration is broken. It can do this a number of times per Long Rest equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries: Imps have a natural affinity with magic, and can cast the following spells. You know the {@spell Produce Flame|XGE} Cantrip. At 3rd level, you learn the {@spell Hellish Rebuke|PHB} spell and can cast it once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot for it. At 5th level, you learn {@spell Knock|PHB} and can cast it once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot for it.
Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Cold Adaptation
entries: You have advantage on Constitution Saving Throws against cold weather, and have resistance to Cold Damage.

entries.name: Frost Magic
entries: You know the {@spell Frostbite|XGE} Cantrip. At 3rd level, you learn the {@spell Ice Knife|XGE} spell and can cast it once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot for it. At 5th level, you learn {@spell Snilloc's Snowball Swarm|XGE} and can cast it once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot for it.

entries.name: Monodrone
entries: Monodrones have a Flying speed of 30ft, and their walking speed is reduced to 20ft. Your size is small.

entries.name: Pentadrone
entries: Your size becomes Large. Once per Short Rest, you can exhale a 15ft cone of prismatic Energy as an Action. Creatures within it must make a Constitution Saving Throw (DC 8 + prof + INT), and creatures who fail are incapacitated until the start of your next turn. Creatures who pass have their speed halved for this time instead.

entries.name: Quadrone
entries: Instead of taking your Ability Score Increase from this racial option, four of your ability scores are increased by 1. Your size becomes Medium.

entries.name: Tricksy
entries: Tricksy Imps are known for their cunning and mischievous ways, shapeshifting and spying on unsuspecting prey.

entries.name: Infernal Resilience
entries: Imps are durable creatures, and gain resistance to Poison damage, and have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition Poisoned} Condition.

entries.name: Imp Shapeshifting
entries: Imps have the ability to reshape their bodies. As an action, you can polymorph yourself into a Rat, Raven or a Spider. You can use your action to revert to your Imp form. Any equipment carried transforms into your new form or is dropped. You retain your Mental Statistics, health and other features granted by your Race. You can do so a number of times per Long Rest equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries: Imps have a natural affinity with magic, and can cast the following spells. You know the {@spell Message|PHB} Cantrip. At 3rd level, you learn the {@spell Faerie Fire|PHB} spell and can cast it once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot for it. At 5th level, you learn {@spell Nathair’s Mischief|TftJC} and can cast it once per Long Rest without expending a spell slot for it.
Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Tridrone
entries: You can no longer be surprised, nor can other creatures benefit from flanking you. Your size becomes Medium.

vehicle.name: Arcycle
action: This magical machine can be fueled with Arcane Magic to become a quick and reliable vehicle. While riding this vehicle you have 90 feet of speed. This speed is reduced to 45 on any terrain that isn’t flat. The vehicle requires magic to function. A creature can touch the Arcycle’s battery and use an action to expend a spell slot. The Arcycle then gains charges equal to the spell level x3.
Charges can be expended to do any of the following actions, which require a bonus action by the crew:

items.name: Engage (1 charge)
items.entry: The Arcycle turns on, allowing all other features to be used. Once engaged, it remains engaged until an hour has passed, at which point the Arcycle must be rengaged.

items.name: Nitro (2 charge)
items.entry: The Arcycle’s speed is tripled, but any checks to steer have a -5 penalty.

items.name: Wheelie (1 charge)
items.entry: Ignore the penalty to uneven terrain until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Shield (3 charges)
items.entry: The Arcycle and all crew or passengers have resistance to all damage until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Lightbreak (2 charges)
items.entry: The Arcycle gains a climb speed equal to its land speed and can climb up flat surfaces, including ceilings.

action: Due to the Arcyle’s size and shape, checks to steer while there is at least one passenger on it have disadvantage.

The number of charges that an Arcycle can hold is determined by the Spell Gem used in crafting it. 10 charges for an Uncommon Spell Gem, 30 Charges for a Rare Spell Gem, 50 Charges for a Very Rare Spell Gem, 100 Charges for a Legendary Spell Chem. An installed spell gem can be replaced with a DT 50 Tinkering Tools check.
An Arcyle has room for two modifications. Modifications can be added with a DT 50 Tinkering Tools check. Removing a modification takes 1 hour, with no check.
